127901490716981.description:
Dr. Maté presents:
• the biological, psychological, social and spiritual causes of addiction
• circumstances in child development and brain development that make us vulnerable to addiction
• exploring the problems that addictions are trying to solve
• the link between stress and addiction
• experiential exercises to explore our own unhealthy habits
• novel ways of working with addicted clients or ourselves
• counseling techniques to use with the addicted population
• one-on-one healing interactions with course participants

What You Will Gain from this Workshop:
• understand the relationship between trauma and addiction
• learn the principles of brain development as shaped by the pre- and post-natal environment
• understand the general outlines of addiction neurophysiology and the role brain circuits play in the formation and persistence of addictive behaviours
• learn the basic principles of psychological defences against vulnerability active in the addicted personality
• grasp the concepts of neuroplasticity - the capacity of the brain to develop new circuits, even later in life
• experience and practice healing techniques based on attunement
• learn how to foster a healing relationship
• know the principles of harm reduction practices

Cost:
$300 + HST after January 30th, 2014
$325 + HST at the door
Please click here to register online or for more information http://beyondaddiction.ca/mind-body-approaches-addiction-recovery-dr-gabor-mat%C3%A9-toronto-may-22-2014.

Registration and information:
519 372 9212
satdharamkaur@gmail.com
www.beyondaddiction.ca
127901490716981.name: Mind-Body Approaches to Addiction Recovery with Dr. Gabor Maté, Toronto, May 22, 2014

1376936439252254.description:
Monday April 14th, 2014 // Tranzac, 292 Brunswick Ave, Toronto, ON M5S 1Y2 // Doors 7p // $7 - 15 sliding scale

The 2014 Glitter Roadshow features Damien Luxe, Heather Ács, Shomi Noise, Sabina Ibarrola, Angel Nafis, Alvis Parsley, and wrangler/visual artist Lizxnn Disaster. The Heels on Wheels Glitter Roadshow tours the US annually with a dazzling, diverse cabaret of performance art works and acts of resistance by queer folks of femme-inine spectrum genders. The fearless artists rampage from hi-femme to femmedrogyny in a wild revue of visceral poetic performance, emotional escape plans, high femme drag, multimedia mermaids, and rocknroll you can sink your heels into!

The show itself consists of six touring performers and local acts in every city – including Toronto locals Sedina Fiati, Sunny Drake, Alex Cafarelli, and ILL NANA/DiverseCity Dance Company

Shomi Noise plays guitar and reads from her zine series “Building Up Emotional Muscles,” the story of her journey as a Bolivian immigrant navigating U.S. culture and finding herself through alternative music scenes. Damien Luxe “Femme Footprints In The Sand” uses mermaids and powdered milk to explore thriving past poverty. Heather Ács’ “Welcome to the Waldorf Hysteria” uses multi-media high-femme drag histrionics to reach beyond language and ask, what do we gain when we lose control? Angel Nafis’ poetry celebrates the everything and everywhere of her world, of love and divinity, of her black girl brilliance in its vastness and depth. Alvis Parsley's heartfelt confession draws on their experiences as a genderqueer Asian while questioning the roles of institutions, authority, and the ecosystem of the arts with both humor and tenderness.
Sabina Ibarrola melts down and melts hearts in a pop culture performative exploration of breaking up and breaking through with the help of karaoke and Carrie Bradshaw. This year also includes a selection of video art by Louis Chavez, Kristin Li, Ellie Beth, Jacqueline Mary, and Celeste Chan.

Come see the glitter and grit for yourself: don’t miss the fifth Heels on Wheels Glitter Roadshow, April 11-20, 2014, heelsonwheelsroadshow.com 

Access info: The venue is 19+ (not all-ages). Wheelchair accessible to enter. Washrooms are on the ground floor with no steps but no extra-wide stalls. Unfortunately, there will be no ASL interpretation this time.

XO,
Heels on Wheels

Heels on Wheels is a Brooklyn-based group of interdisciplinary artists who create performance-based cultural works and community events that have a feminist and radical agenda, are produced from sites of femme/inine-positive queer embodiment, and reveal the power in under-represented communities. More about the event, the artists, and the Heels on Wheels here: http://www.heelsonwheelsroadshow.com/roadshow-2014/
1376936439252254.name: TORONTO: Heels on Wheels Glitter Roadshow

1382316308683725.description:
https://soundcloud.com/natureboys
http://pauljacobs.bandcamp.com/

Friends of ours are returning. They get out of the van and the vibe gets bright and fun. 

The Nature Boys from Toronto are the newest high energy RocknRoll combo on Boppa do Down. Many Parts Power Pop, Punk and Twang, The Nature Boys have been described as a cross between "Exploding Hearts and mid-period Social Distortion" (Dave Brown - Career Suicide). The Nature Boys include members of T.O. bands Pow Wows and By Divine Right.

Not only is it great to see these Toronto rockers, but the incomparable Paul Jacobs is playing his last Windsor show before he leaves town. The guy is one of the most unique performers/musicians we have. I'm always pumped to have him back, stinging my ears with raw newness.

And a new local band, Queen's Rug, will be cutting their teeth on our stage to open the night. And Phog is always keen to get new bands on the stage, so they'll be contributing to the new music fabric of Windsor.

Gonna be a solid show.
1382316308683725.name: The Nature Boys (Toronto) w/ Paul Jacobs (Windsor) and Queen's Rug (Windsor)

1388143611429322.description:
Excision 2014 tour dates announced and the return of The Executioner.

Get tickets for Toronto @ http://smarturl.it/XApr4Tickets

There is truly no sleep for the wicked, as Canadian Dubstep pioneer Excision announces his massive 2014 Tour. Starting this January Excision will hit the road only weeks after wrapping the final string of Destroid live shows for 2013. 

Embracing an unyielding pursuit to push the boundaries of bass music, Excision is continually creating and re-imagining innovative uses of cutting edge technology to impact his fans, as well as the EDM community at large. This 2014 Tour will prove to be his most extensive and most immersive tour experience to date. With an already phenomenal level of production at his disposal, you better believe he has gone even further. He is stepping things up to a whole new level and bringing a monstrous 150,000 watts of sound, which is capable of delivering insanely loud yet crystal clear audio to blast dance floors with room shaking bass in a way that bass music is ultimately designed to be felt as well as heard.

The 2014 tour also marks the return of the 28 foot wide, 15 foot tall mammoth video and lighting installation known as The Executioner. This custom crafted stage production was specifically designed for Excisions 3D video mapped visual sequences as he DJ's both music and video live on stage. The Executioner is fully recharged and returning as Excision’s on-stage bass bunker, complete with brand new 3D visual animations displayed across its 420 square feet of surface area. This technological audio video monstrosity is equipped with various sliding panels and pneumatics to hide lazers, fog machines, an extensively upgraded lighting system and more than a few surprises yet to be revealed.


Dirtyphonics
-
Dirtyphonics, the fabulous french DJ team joins with Excision for his 2014 tour. Bringing their signature style of genre bending madness from DNB, Electro House and everything in between, don't miss a second of their electrifying sets as they set the world on fire!
1388143611429322.name: Excision in Toronto @ Sound Academy

The Lox (stylized The LOX or The L.O.X.) is an American hip hop group from Yonkers, New York, composed of East Coast rappers Sheek Louch, Styles P, and Jadakiss. They had originally signed to Sean Combs' Bad Boy Records in 1995, before joining Ruff Ryders Entertainment in 1999, and have since launched their own label, D-Block Records.

The LOX gained national exposure in 1997 with an onside collaboration on Sean "Puffy" Combs' single "It's All About the Benjamins", shortly after gaining additional exposure with their multi-platinum tribute to The Notorious B.I.G. "We'll Always love Big Poppa". The trio later appeared on a multitude of hits, Mase's "24 Hrs. to Live", Mariah Carey's "Honey", and Jennifer Lopez's "Jenny From The Block". The group's debut album Money, Power & Respect went platinum

1392611581016164.description:
Two amazing Toronto events launching The Winter We Danced #TWWD on April 4, 2014!

Daytime Launch: 
Ryerson University, Ted Rogers School, 55 Dundas St. West, Room 2109 
2:30-4:00pm

Feat. readings contributor Judy Rebick and The Kino-nda-niimi Collective (including lead editors Hayden King, Niigaan Sinclair, and Wanda Nanibush).
Refreshments will be provided (coffee, tea, juice).
*Hosted by The Ryerson's Office for Aboriginal Initiatives and Ryerson Aboriginal Student Services.

Evening Launch: 
Toronto Council Fire Native Cultural Centre, 429 Dundas St. East.
6:30-8:30 pm

Feat. performances from contributors Tara Williamson, Lee Maracle, Russ Diabo, Naomi Klein, and readings from The Kino-nda-niimi Collective (including lead editors Leanne Simpson, Hayden King, Niigaan Sinclair, and Wanda Nanibush). 
Light Dinner: Corn soup, scone and strawberry drink.
*MC'd by Wanda Nanibush and supported by Ryerson's Office for Aboriginal Initiatives and The Ryerson Aboriginal Student Services.

About the book: The Winter We Danced is a vivid collection of writing, poetry, lyrics, art and images from the many diverse voices that make up the past, present, and future of the Idle No More movement. Calling for pathways into healthy, just, equitable and sustainable communities while drawing on a wide-ranging body of narratives, journalism, editorials and creative pieces, this collection consolidates some of the most powerful, creative and insightful moments from the winter we danced and gestures towards next steps in an on-going movement for justice and Indigenous self-determination.

Copies of the book will be available at the launch. More info about the book can be found here: http://arpbooks.org/books/detail/the-winter-we-danced

Royalties from the sale of this book will be donated to the Native Youth Sexual Health Network.

Come join us for an amazing night of beauty, word, and song!
1392611581016164.location: Toronto Council Fire Native Cultural Centre
1392611581016164.name: Toronto Launches of The Winter We Danced: Voices of the Past, the Future and the Idle No More Movement

1394837227448302.description:
Hello dancers and friends! I'd like to let you know about an exciting evening of dance, music, food and drink coming up!

Come dance with us March 22nd at 918 Bathurst in Toronto. We'll be dancing old Breton dances (get your pinky muscles working!), groovy new versions of the partner dances scottische, mazurka and waltz, and the famous dance from Auvergne: the bouree!

We've been learning/dancing these French and Breton dances in small cafes for almost a year now in Toronto, and its time to put on a big Bal and invite you all to join us.

The dances are easy and fun, and we'll have musicians joining us from as far as Montreal, the USA and the Netherlands!

1397431763859978.description:
“What can we gain by sailing to the moon if we are not able to cross the abyss that separates us from ourselves?”  Thomas Merton

We are taught from childhood that mind and body are separate. This lesson is not merely inaccurate – it has created a way of being that is disconnected, anxious and off-balance. Our primary challenge is to recover the harmony of our being. Philip has gained an international reputation as a teacher whose original techniques enable people to reunite their conscious thinking with the deep-dwelling intelligence of the body, and to do so in a way that grounds us in the present, and gently opens a door to the experience of wholeness.  In the process, he provides tools to last a lifetime.

The workshop takes place in a remarkably supportive natural environment: poised at the edge of Lake Ontario, in the middle of an island park that is just a ten-minute ferry ride from the bustle of downtown Toronto. Getting there is easy – we’ll send you information once you’ve signed up!

Dates: May 3/4
Time: 10am to 5pm each day
Cost: $225
Place: Gibraltar Point Centre for the Arts, Toronto Island
For more info, or to register: http://philipshepherd.com/events/radical-wholeness-weekend-workshop-toronto-2/
Class size limited to 16.
1397431763859978.name: Radical Wholeness – a weekend workshop in Toronto with Philip Shepherd

PIFF | IFFSA | Toronto is the biggest South Asian Film Festival in North America. This seven day extravaganza showcases a diverse, language independent, selection of the best feature films, documentaries and short films from around the world, on themes of Punjabi | South Asian culture and identity.

In addition, the festival also features concerts, gala events, film parties, seminars, workshops and networking opportunities with government representatives, business leaders, local organizations that support film development, film stars, producers, directors, members of the media and more.

The festival has grown to include two segments:

Punjabi International Film Festival (PIFF) – Toronto
International Film Festival of South Asia (IFFSA) – Toronto

PIFF | IFFSA | Toronto 2014 weekend will be held from May 15- May 19, 2013 in Ontario, Canada as part of South Asian Heritage Month celebrations. The launch events will take place during the month of April, 2014.

Exciting and glamorous events planned for the cities of Toronto, Brampton and Mississauga at various pristine and prestigious venues.

1405427806392671.description:
Presentation 1: "The Universe in a Computer"

From smartphones and tablets to FuelBands and Google Glass, computers have revolutionized our everyday life. But did you know that computers also allow us to learn about the Big Bang and black holes? In this talk I will discuss how the largest supercomputers in the world allow astrophysicists to gain insights into the workings of the universe around us. 

JD Emberson is an Astrophysics PhD student at the University of Toronto. His work involves using supercomputers to study the structure of the universe on large scales and at early times in its history.

----

Presentation 2:"So long, and thanks for all the pink"

Men are from Mars and Women are from Venus, or so they say - but are we really so different? We will explore sex and gender, and how our conceptions of the differences between boys and girls have changed over the past 3000 years (or so). We'll look at how societal expectations and marketing have shaped our views on what is and isn't appropriate for boys and girls - including, but certainly not limited to, which colours they should wear!

Dr. Jenn Neilson has a PhD in philosophy specializing in gender norms, from the University of Texas at Austin. She is the founder of Jill and Jack Kids, a clothing company that's inspiring the next generation of leaders to think beyond pink and blue. She is also co-organizer of Versatile PhD Toronto, a networking community for recovering academics.

----

Presentation 3: "I want to do EVERYTHING (Life as a Polymath)"

When you meet new people for the first time and they ask you what you do, do you have a dozen different answers? If so, you're not alone. A confluence of different personality traits and learning and thinking styles can lead people to become "scanners". Because choosing is hard, but learning is fun!

Adam Emanon is a man of a million hobbies (yes, he has a day job too) with an unrelenting desire to keep learning. He takes pride in being a diverse "non-expert" and sharing as much of what he finds (information and resources) as possible, with others. Adam runs a blog at www.curiositycrossroads.com

----

Trivia!
1405427806392671.name: Nerd Nite Toronto XXIX

I've lived in BC for almost 4 years, and this year, since I did a decent job at my job, I'm giving myself a two week vacation home for, among other things:

Oh No! Yoko (Abbotsford/Vancouver/Montreal)
www.ohnoyoko.bandcamp.com

If you haven't heard of these guys, we haven't talked about music where I'm living now, but according to guitarist in bands that have great guitar players,  J'ai Sans Fil: "Yeah, I know those guys."

Expect intense, catchy power pop-rock licks and tight, technical breakdowns that make you wish they lasted a lot longer. These guys just moved (back) to Montreal this winter, and I'm stoked that they're willing to come to Toronto JUST for yours truly. Also, they are awesome. These boys play Drake Underground style rooms for breakfast in Vancouver, so this is a particularly exciting set to bring to the Annex in 2014.

Featuring a member of GSTS, and having been 3/4X3/4 of supergroup Real Boys with YOU SAY PARTY bassist S.O.S., you know they came out here for a reason.

Bare Claws (Guelph/Toronto)
www.bareclaws.bandcamp.com

David Levy says: How come these guys aren't big?

Brandon Barraclough may have a difficult to spell last name, but he has an easy to take songwriting style that buffers between ballad to ball buster and timid to terrorizing pianos, guitars, and gang-chants from one minute, and the next still. Flanked by Nodoubt Fersure, otherwise known as the first guy to do my old job right, a year after I left it, at the Jimmy Jazz, and a dope-ass guitar slanger with years of tutelage under the incomperable Ken Aldcroft.

Bosh Flimshaw / Pj Styles (Toronto)
https://www.facebook.com/bflimshaw

Somehow he's a youthful ten year vet of the Toronto party scene. I think maybe that's my fault? He's going to make you laugh, not cry, and impress you with his selections and production. Check it out yo.

I will also be welcoming a host of friendly performers and a slew of DJ's to make my first Toronto birthday since moving out West an excellent if not exciting time :P

presented by Rolling Rock
https://twitter.com/Rolling_Rock
https://www.facebook.com/RollingRock

After enduring an ice storm, freezing temperatures and a damn polar vortex, not only do we DESERVE this upcoming warm weather but we should feel ENTITLED to attending events that maximize everything GREAT about Spring - and that's why the R&B: Relationships & Bullsh*t show is coming back to Toronto on April 26th for show #3. As summer descends upon us, it's time to put all that antisocial, winter-hibernation bullshit on the shelf, and get back into the swing of enjoying long-warm nights with great food, great friends and great music, EVERYTHING you can expect from an R&B show.

If you've NEVER been to an R&B show, it can best be desribed 25% conversation party, 25% Jazz lounge (with singers and band), 25% mixer/cocktail reception and 25% party. Not only will we be talking about relationships and bullshit, but you will also be entertained with great music, great food, nice drinks and a frowsy-free venue.

On the 26th, the main point of our conversation will be, “Are People In TORONTO Still Interested In Serious Relationships & Marriage, OR Do We All Just Want Casual Sex?!”  which you KNOW will be a HOT topic.

This will NOT be a panel event, but instead will be a co-hosted and interactive discussion featuring the help of my homegirl Bee from 83toinfinity.com.

The doors open at 8:00 PM and the show starts promptly at 9:00 PM.

Get your tickets today at: RNB3.eventbrite.com (Early bird tickets are on sale until April 3rd, so get your tickets ASAP because the last show was completely SOLD OUT!)

I look forward to seeing you all there!

(if you own a business and you are interested in sponsor/vendor/giveaway opportunities, please email: lincoln.blades@gmail.com)

1414965562093732.description:
This latest production by Sarah Skinner and the Sisters of Salome brings the iconic 1001 Nights to the dance stage.  Assembled over centuries during the Islamic Golden Age, this collection of Arabic fairy tales was translated into English in 1706 and have come to be known to western audiences as “Arabian Nights”.  The tales are told by Sherehezade, the latest bride of King Shahryar during her wedding night.  Her goal: to save herself from her own execution the next morning by captivating her husband with her fantastical and eccentric tales.  Filled with action, mystery, jealousy, sex and romance, these stories are brought to life through the beautiful art of belly dance.  A feast for the senses, Arabian Nights will transport you to exotic lands and times with enthralling music, colourful costuming, dramatic storytelling and exotic belly dance.  Come away with Sarah Skinner and the Sisters of Salome and let them ‘tell you a story’  at  The Toronto Fringe  Festival July 2-13 2014. More details coming in April!

Arabian Nights: “Let us tell you a story” 
A belly dance spectacular

Thursday, July 3, 2014 - 6:30pm  
Saturday, July 5, 2014 - 1:45pm  
Monday, July 7, 2014 - 4:30pm 
Wednesday, July 9, 2014 - 9:15pm  
Thursday, July 10, 2014 - 4:00pm  
Friday, July 11, 2014 - 11:00pm

Freedom is so simple that most of the people totally miss the significance of it. Freedom is free, but not cheap, so if you want to afford freedom you have to give up everything, which creates fear in you, since you don't want to give up everything. But in order to keep freedom you have give up everything and give up even the freedom itself only then you can have freedom though it can not be kept, only you can be kept in freedom, because this is your natural way of being. Completely free, boundless and limitless, infinitely so.

 

I invite you to explore and look with your own eyes and experience to something overlooked so greatly. Your liberation is in your own hands now, and it's certainly very simple to recognize as your own seeing once you can to places like this meeting.

 

How many practices and years of different traditions, rituals and exercises spent chasing the freedom? Total freedom. Absolute Liberation.

How many of these practices actually did set you free? Not simply made you chains less tight, but really can you confirm that they totally chopped the heavy chains holding you stuck to something, without the complete freedom from all?

 

Your coming here will result in absolute freeing of your being :]

 

Isn't so that every practice, ritual, technique strives to reach the place where no more practice is needed, but it eventually becomes your natural way of being?

 

If you have a sense that it is your time to come into your own Absolute, Total, and Complete Freedom and You Can Handle Your Own Eternal Freedom, come and rest into your natural way of liberated being.

 

Come into your Wholeness and Freedom Today ;]

What other people say? :

Hi Rimvi,
I find all the meetings delightful. I often feel as if we are all sitting around a campfire, eating chocs, watching the sun set, the sky darken and the stars emerge. The interactions among everyone who attends is respectful and comfortable. Not that it matters to me, but it is a "safe" place to express all kinds of emotions and thoughts. Nobody is judge. Nobody is police. Personally, each meeting reminds me of things that I've put aside for various uninteresting reasons. Attachments to any belief, thought or illusion are revealed for what they are: constructs and illusions. Like a snake shedding its skin, these attachments  itch, and irritate, until the old skin is torn away. Perhaps it is a process of de-evolution: unmasking the pointless nonsense we tend to believe is true. Whatever it is, it is good. All good. Thank you. -K.E. Jones

Thank you so much Rimvi for these meet ups. I was on a spiritual journey for a while looking to find something and you helped me find my true self which I was like ,whooooaah!.....it was mind blowing ... i cried.. i laughed... im still surprised....but im sooo deeply humbled and grateful that you were the one to make me see...my whole life has shifted so much for the better and I m not lost anymore. Im home... I... am... home.....Keep up the truth and love Rimvi! Your heart is a big one...See you in the next meet up and looking forward to seeing new faces. It's time for more people to hear what is shared in this group...just Golden...no words to express......language limits us....the truth is too great...I love it!  - Lisa

Hi Rimvi
I would just like to say that I found your approach very refreshing in its simplicity. After all, why make anything complicated? I found your group to be a pleasant learning experience - a good place to connect with like minded people. Thank you for continuing to offer this space for people to learn how to just BE.  - Sue

Hi Rimvi,You asked for feedback...The fastback is that everything happens as it supposed. You do what you must do, and other people do what they must do.Do I like it? YesIs it useful? Yes, it is the only place which I know about which produces awakened people, real ones. And it does that without years of meditation practice, etc. It is a very honest place, where lies not presented, but instead lies are busted. No religious beliefs, not a sect, just a group of people working to discover the truth.About the rest we discussed in our one on one meetings.Cheers, - Radim

I truly enjoyed the creative and relaxed atmosphere of the event I attended, and I know it's quite different from other events out there (refreshingly different!!!) - Laura

1418442145076351.description:
We invite you to join us at the heart of a historic meditation gathering in Toronto this summer. Take a seven-day journey with Deepak Chopra and reconnect to what matters most, reclaiming inner and outer peace and prosperity. Each day, Deepak and master educators will lead you in reflective workshops, beautiful yoga practices, and guided meditations dedicated to increasing global consciousness and connection. 
	
	Are you ready to experience transformation from the inside out? Join us in Toronto, Canada for the global meditation event of the year. Practice Primordial Sound Meditation, the Seven Spiritual Laws of Yoga, and celebrate an international community gathering of meditators. Whether you’re new to meditation or have been practicing for years, we invite you to contribute your unique gifts and your presence at this historic event.
	
	We know that real change is possible—and it starts with each one of us.
	
	This beautiful retreat is about slowing down and tuning into the peace of present moment awareness. Through the practice of Primordial Sound Meditation, Seven Spiritual Laws of Yoga, and other timeless tools, you will begin to:
	
	Deepen your meditation practice
	Move beyond limiting conditioned beliefs
	Appreciate the gifts of your life as it unfolds
	Let go of the struggle and achieve more by doing less
	Shed layers of accumulated stress
	Release the stress and obstacles to balanced living
	Tap into your deepest potential to manifest your wishes, dreams, and desires.

	Learn and practice Primordial Sound Meditation with Chopra Center master educator Davidji
	 

	In a supportive group of like-minded individuals, Deepak Chopra, special guest speakers, and Chopra Center master educators will guide you in Primordial Sound Meditation, Seven Spiritual Laws of Yoga, visualizations, creative activities, and discussions that will awaken you to all the gifts that lie within.

1418673861720729.description:
HASTI is proud to be presenting the latest collection "PARADISE "at |FAT| Toronto Arts and Fashion Week 2014. Hope to see you all at the event!

“PARADISE”

HASTI’s handcrafted rain jackets are presented in a collection entitled “PARADISE”. The word Paradise derives its name from the Old Persian word “Pardeiza”, which literally means a walled garden, a place offering tranquility, peacefulness and connection with nature. 
Each piece of this collection is hand painted and printed on a base of natural fabric with a mixture of plastic and reused materials. The patterns from the Persian motifs Including cypress tree, spiral flowers and the mythical bird “Simorgh” have been incorporated into the designs, replacing some of the more figurative natural elements with colors Inspired by the four season. 
The elements of nature and industry life work together in playful designs to show the complexity of the human contemporary lifestyle.

Tickets and media passes: 
http://fashionarttoronto.ca/buy-tickets/
1418673861720729.name: "PARADISE" BY HASTI SHOWCASE AT |FAT|- FASHION ART TORONTO 2014

******************* SPECIAL EVENT **********************

21+ $5 (10pm-2am)

2 for 1 Signature Drinks until 11:30

After-hours 18+ $10 (2am-4am)
____________________________________________
RONNIE & WYLDE
(Toronto, Canada)

Remixes: info@ronnieandwylde.com
www.soundcloud.com/ronnieandwylde
Promo's - promo@ronnieandwylde.com

Bio:

Toronto DJ/Production duo Ronnie & Wylde have found a way to create a unique hybrid genre of EDM. With influences from multiple sources, the duo has created a sound that can be described as a love child of the heavy bass of electro house mixed with the feel and bounce of tech house and the melodic structure of progressive.

Ronnie Pinnell and Wally “Wylde” Saleh met while on tour in Florida. Since meeting the two have teamed up on numerous productions including bootlegs of multiple tracks. In December of 2013 the two decided it was time to team up and create music under the moniker Ronnie & Wylde. In January of 2014 they released their bootleg of "Mastodon" by Milk N Cookies which gained numerous blog support and over 8,000 plays in just over week and followed with an 7 stop international tour, hitting Canada and the US supporting Milk N Cookies.

Individually have toured all over the North America, including stops in major cities in Ontario, Florida, Missouri, Illinois, Kentucky, Tennessee, Ohio, Michigan, Virginia and Punta Cana. Be on the look out for Ronnie & Wylde in a city near you in the near future.
__________________________________________
Opening set by:
JAMESON ALEXANDER

After-hours with:
ROB MORLEY

1422050714710158.description:
HOSTED BY: Will of Peace!
Where? The Central on Markham St.
When? Wednesday, April 9, 2014.
5:30PM – DOORS OPEN
6:00PM – SIGN UPS
6:30PM - OPEN MIC/SLAM STARTS
Slammers: Age 12-19
Open Mic and Audience: ALL AGES
Cost? $5 Cover
Follow us on Twitter! https://twitter.com/BAMYouthSlam

-----

Toronto's only monthly Youth Poetry Slam, BAM!, is back in full effect for April, featuring veteran wordsmith, MACER!

INTERESTED IN COMPETING?
Rules of a BAM! Poetry Slam are quite simple. Bring 3 poems, just in case. There we will have 12 slots open for youth poets ages 12-19 - 2-3 rounds (based on number of competitors), 3 minutes with a 10 second grace period for every poet to drop their fire, with a 0.5 penalty for every 10 seconds afterwards. No props, no instruments, etc.

There is an OPEN MIC available for ALL AGES for anyone that wants to share his or her works on stage!

INTERESTED IN QUALIFYING FOR THE BAM! TEAM?
Basically, from now monthly to September, finishing 1st will get 5 points, 2nd place gets 3 points, 3rd place gets 2 points, and the remaining youth slammers gets 1 point. In October, the top 12 point leaders in descending order will be invited to our October semi finals to compete to be on the BAM! Toronto Youth Poetry Slam Team! Priority will be given to those who have competed 2 months or more.

POINTS STANDINGS HERE: https://www.facebook.com/notes/bam-the-toronto-youth-slam/season-standings-2014/10151999628535415

SO COME THRU AND BRING A FRIEND OR TWO! Let’s pack the house and have a great time! You will not regret it. There will be fire, blood and poetry! See you there!

-----

SO WHO IS MACER?
Combining the whimsical with a stylistic poetic flow, Macer has entertained audiences for more than a quarter century, performing on three continents and countless stages. From the heartfelt and somber to the bizarre and unexpected, his poems, like his life, cover the entirety of the poetic gamut. He currently lives.
1422050714710158.name: BAM! Toronto Youth Poetry Slam ft. MACER! (APRIL)

Join us at Tranzac (292 Brunswick Ave.) for a night of trivia, good company, booze, prizes and just an overall good time.

Teams of 4-6 is ideal... you can have less than 4 people on your team, but we ask that you don't have more than 6 people.

Time for our next huddle! Join us at Sunnybrook Dog Park for our April 27th meet, weather permitting.
Although the event is free we hope you that will bring a small donation to support our Paws 4 A Cause, Grand River All-Breed Rescue. Please bring any of the following items on the wish list posted below (such as unopened/new pet toys, canned food, etc)!
Along with our P4C, this month we're going to be doing something a little different. We will be at the dog park until around 2:15pm, then go on an on-leash hike around the park (with the group photo being taken before we leave) so please try to make it on time! Don't forget to bring the necessities: water, towels and poop bags for your pups! And we hope to see you there! :)

Our April PAWS 4 A CAUSE:
http://www.grandriverallbreedrescue.ca/modules/content/?id=1

Their Wish List:
http://www.grandriverallbreedrescue.ca/modules/content/index.php?id=4

Address: 1132 Leslie Street
Toronto, ON Canada M1P 4N7
Near: Leslie & Eglinton

RSVP today and please spread the word to anyone who is owned by a Siberian Husky, Alaskan Malamute or Northern Breed!

The same rules apply to this meetup as with all our other meetups:

- H2M2 strongly recommends that puppies have gone through the entire cycle of vaccinations including rabies and bordatella as a precautionary measure and for the safety and well being of your pup.

- We do NOT allow aggressive dogs or females in heat at our events. Every owner is responsible 100% for their own pet.

- In addition, there should be NO toys, no treats or food as it could create issues among other dogs who may have toy/food aggression or guardng issues.

1427859514120778.description:
RushCon 14: Celebrating 14 years of the greatest fans gathering and 40 years of the world’s greatest band.

Tickets On sale now!: http://www.rushcon.org/register/index.html

We are very excited to announce that our 14th annual convention will take place in Rush’s hometown of Toronto, August 22nd - 24th, 2014. 

Enjoy 3 days of Rush-filled festivities, including games, prizes, trivia, a memorabilia charity auction, special guest speakers, a tribute band concert and much, much more. Full convention details will be announced later this spring, but we wanted to make sure folks saved the date! 

This is the year! Don’t be kicking yourself for missing yet another RushCon. From the friends you will make, to the music you will sing along with, RushCon 14 will be an unforgettable experience.

Our convention events will take place at The Great Hall. This super cool space will hold our daytime activities on Saturday and Sunday, as well as our Tribute Band show on Saturday night. 

OFFICIAL HOTEL
Our official RushCon 14 Hotel is:
Eaton Chelsea, Toronto
33 Gerrard Street West 
Toronto, Ontario M5G 1Z4
Phone: 416-595-1975

Centrally located within walking distance to Toronto‘s subway system, near the corner of Yonge St. and Gerrard St. W., Eaton Chelsea offers our angular mass of Rush fans contemporary and comfortable accommodations in the heart of the city. 

We are pleased to offer a group rate of $149.00 per night (based on single or double occupancy) for August 22 - 25, 2014.  Reservations must be made by July 23, 2014 to receive the convention rate.  Rooms always fill up quickly, so make your reservations early!

When booking over the phone, please use the group code " RUS101014 " or mention “RushCon” by calling  at or 416-595-1975, or online with the code  "RUS101014"  via the link below: https://gc.synxis.com/rez.aspx?Hotel=59052&Chain=10316&start=availresults&locale=en-GB&arrive=19/08/2014&depart=28/08/2014&adult=1&child=0&group=RUS101014

You belong at RushCon 14. http://www.rushcon.org

SAVE THE DATE: Social Justice Discotech: AMC Fundraiser Future Design Lab Toronto!

Time & Location
Saturday, April 26, 10am-6:30pm
Bento Miso, 862 Richmond St. W., Unit 100, Toronto

Summary
Discover how to use design and technology to map out and build more just and sustainable visions of the future!

Description
This one-day social justice-focused skill-sharing extravaganza will host numerous design and technology discovery stations. This will be devoted to hands-on, DIY, Do It Together, collaborative design, making and hacking, hardware and software collaboration stations and skill-shares. Bring your ideas for a better world and we’ll show you how to:

*Drawing Infinitely Scalable Images
*Screen-printing: Design your own poster

1433411513570823.description:
R&B artists and music has evolved significantly over the past years. Each decade bringing a different perspective on love, relationships, and life experiences overall.

The 90’s brought us the mass of respectable R&B icons – R. Kelly, Toni Braxton, Keith Sweat, Boyz II Men, KCi & Jojo. 

The early 2000’s embodied both artists from the previous decade, the present, and the future – our decade. 

Artists from Brian McKnight, Mary J Blige, Ginuwine, to Frank Ocean, Alicia Keys, and Usher created music that empowered us, got us through those lonely nights, and helped us rebuild ourselves from the ground up.

The evolution of R&B has caused avid music lovers to develop a passion for its music – a love for R&B.

I ❤ R&B is for the independent woman, who carries herself with class, knows where she came from, and is modest about the hard work and hardships she endeavoured to get where she is today. 

I ❤ R&B is for the woman who loves R&B music because it connects with her on an intellectual level, unleashes her passion and her inner goddess.

On Thursday, April 17th 2014, the lifestyle continues – an evening of class, great music, guests passionate about R&B music, with a relaxing ambiance.

I want to take you back to when you wanted to dance with that special someone "Too Close". Where you wanted to make that girl your "Wifey" where you and that special someone shared that "Butta Love". I want to thank you, my people for 5 years of patronage, 5 years of R&B and most importantly 5 years of love. As a gift from me to you I am bringing out the big homie"R.L." of R&B group, NEXT, to bring that love moment forward for the next 5 years.

- I ❤ R&B Event Details -

Easter Thursday - Thursday, April 17th 2014
TIME Nightclub | 81 Peter St.

* FASHIONABLE DRESSCODE IN FULL-EFFECT *
Casual, Clean & Current Attire - No Exceptions

Advance Tickets | Bottle Service | Inquires: 
(647) 209-2543 or (416) 571-4110

Please join  BookThug on Tuesday April 15th as we celebrate the launch of our Spring 2014 season. 

What a night we have in store for you! Three sets featuring great readers, panelists and musicians to help us launch another wonderful season of literature.

In the first set, we present two, that's right TWO new books by bpNichol! The first is Theseus, a collaboration with Wayne Clifford and the second is bp:Beginnings. To present these books we have planned a special panel of speakers including Stephen Cain, editor of bp:Beginnings, Lola Tostevin and Brian Dedora, moderated by Gregory Betts. Also a virtual reading by Wayne Clifford.

The second set features readings by Jacob Wren, author of the fabulous new novel Polyamorous Love Song and  Aisha Sasha John, who will launch her highly anticipated 2nd poetry collection THOU. 

The third and final set is a real treat. Enjoy a very special set featuring a reading by Guadalupe Muro, Argentine author of the debut novel Air Carnation and a musical performance by Songs for Runaway Girls featuring Ana López and Julián Muro and Guadalupe Muro. They will perform original music from the soundtrack for Air Carnation. Think of it as the soundtrack for the film that doesn't yet exist! Oh and they are coming all the way from Bariloche, Patagonia for this! We can't wait!

Join us on Tuesday April 15, 2014
7:30 pm. Readings to begin at 8:00 pm.
Supermarket
268 Augusta Avenue 
Toronto, ON

THOU by Aisha Sasha John

1437652276473837.description:
Bertha Oliva and Bob Lovelace on Honduras & Canada 
Part of the Building Solidarity with Honduras Tour: Peoples' Rights over Corporate Rights

We will also be joined by Jessica Brant and Dan Doreen both Mohawks from Tyendinaga who will speak to us about the murdered an missing Indigenous women and the current blockades. 

Friday, April 11, 2014, 7-9pm
Beit Zatoun, 612 Markham St (Bathurst subway station)
Finger food and light refreshments served

More info: http://www.commonfrontiers.ca/tour-2014

Join us for discussion and reflection about current social, political, human rights crisis and land defence in Honduras, Canada’s role, and related struggles of Indigenous nations in Canada against resource extraction. 

Despite extreme violence and repression in Honduras, exacerbated since the 2009 coup d'état and the widely contested November 2013 elections, the Canadian government is deepening its political and economic ties in the country. A free trade agreement between Canada and Honduras was signed in November 2013 and is currently being pushed through Parliament, putting investor rights ahead of community rights.

Part of speaking tour stopping in Toronto, Six Nations, Ottawa, and Montreal from April 7-11.

Hosted by York University, The Centre for Research on Latin America and the Caribbean (CERLAC) and The Council of Canadians and Common Frontiers

Follow the tour on Twitter at #hondurassolidarity
1437652276473837.name: Building Solidarity with Honduras Toronto event: Bertha Oliva & Bob Lovelace

1438891713016754.description:
Come out to the Toronto Pagan Pub Moot at The Fox and Fiddle!

The Toronto Pagan Pub Moot will be held at The Fox and Fiddle 1535 Yonge Street (2 blocks north of St. Clair on Yonge) in the upstairs private room to enjoy a bite and a drink with old friends and new!

Monday, April 21st, 2014.

7:00pm to close

Enjoy a night out with other Pagans and Pagan-friendly folk of the GTA. The Fox and Fiddle is a pagan friendly venue that offers a complete menu and a well stocked bar.

Children are welcome.

St. Clair Subway Station is in walking distance.

There is free parking at the Church next door. (Entrance is on the North Side of the Church...not the south!)

The Toronto Pagan Pub Moot is the first Pagan Pub Moot in Canada (c. Feb 1996) and is an open and friendly social event that meets every Third Calendar Monday of every month. It is open to Pagans, Wiccans, Witches, Druids, Asatru, etc of ALL ages and those who are new and would like to learn more. As this is a social event, there are no lectures or specific talks. It is a GREAT place to meet up with old friends and make new friends.

The TPPM is also a great place to find out what else is going on in the Greater Toronto Area Pagan Community. A wonderful place to network, grow and learn. We get about 30 - 60 people at each Moot so it is a great place to connect.

The Fox and Fiddle welcomes the Toronto Pagan Pub Moot by offering a private upstairs room, a full menu of pub fare, drinks, those who are 19 years or younger CAN now come to the Moot! Pagan Parents can come and bring their children.

Those who are 16 to 19 should come with others and those who are under 16 should come with a guardian or parent.

Come out to have a great time, meeting new people, connecting with old friends, and having just a great ol' time with other Pagans and pagan friendly people.

Karen Dales will also have some copies of her award winning book limited edition of "Angel of Death: Book One of the Chosen Chronicles" (incl. 'Changeling: Prelude to the Chosen Chronicles" and her new novel "Shadow of Death: Book Two of the Chosen Chronicles" available for purchase. http://www.karendales.com/

If you have any questions or the like please email karendales@rocketmail.com

or better yet, call Karen or Evan at 416-635-5981
1438891713016754.name: Toronto Pagan Pub Moot

PRESENT workshop Toronto
Le Jeu and Clown
Location: TBA
June 21st and 22nd, 2014
11-5 each day

We will be continuing the work in Le Jeu and Clown inspired by Philippe Gaulier. This work helps us get unstuck. It teaches us to listen, to re-discover play, not to push too much or shy away but to let go and be attuned to the moment - to find our open, sensitive, vulnerable, human and ridiculous quality. For performers and non-performers.

"With this work people have to find a way of being beautiful and surprising... and by beautiful I mean being in the grip of pleasure or freedom".
Philippe on Clown


Workshop cost: $200 plus HST 

50% discount for returning students 
20% discount for ACTRA and Equity members
Scholarship positions available. 
Pre-payment is required. Workshop space will be limited to 16 people.

For more information and to register:
john@johnbeale.net (416) 892-4322
www.johnbeale.net

JOHN BEALE is a Toronto based actor and teacher from Peggy's Cove, Nova Scotia. John is a graduate of the Philippe Gaulier International Theatre School in Paris and The University of King's College in Halifax and has been holding publicly offered performance workshops inspired by Gaulier since 2005.

1439328502978506.description:
VOLUNTEER WITH THE 519 TO SUPPORT GREEN SPACE TORONTO

Green Space is a dynamic 4-day celebration that takes place during Toronto’s LGBT pride celebrations, presenting a series of landmark events, such as Starry Night, One World, Lipstick Jungle, Disco Disco and TreeHouse Party.

In 2013, Green Space Toronto raised over $300,000 for programs at The 519. This event relies on the contribution of hundreds of volunteers to succeed.



Volunteers are needed in a number of roles, most of which involve directly interacting with party-goers:

* Bar Team - Outgoing and friendly volunteers serving up drinks and good times

* Token Sales Team - Customer-focused volunteers selling drink tokens with a smile

* Bank Team - Behind-the-scenes volunteers that help keep track of the cash

* Venue Team - Active volunteers that help manage the event space and keep it clean

* Harm Reduction Team - Extroverted volunteers that make sure everyone stays safe while having a good time

* Food Service Team – Energetic volunteers that are as good in the kitchen as they are with customers

Signup today to help The 519:

https://www.volgistics.com/ex/portal.dll/ap?AP=457819291

1449025721977684.description:
March 1st, 2014 was a national day call for action against the Harper government. It was a response by the Canadian public, who demonstrated in more than 35 marches across the country, who do not support the Harper government’s various changes to legislation, particularly OMNIBUS BILLS, such as C-38, which encompasses changes to 70 laws.

These laws weaken our environmental legislation and violate the federal government’s obligation to consult with Aboriginal communities. Harper uses omnibus bills as a ploy to group together multiple reforms to our government which circumvent our Democracy and gut our environmental protection laws.

Furthermore, another facet to this grand scheme is to alter our democratic process; with Bill C-23, the so-called ‘Fair’ Elections Act. “The proposed Bill C-23 is an attempt by Conservatives to suppress the voting rights of students, seniors, and Aboriginal peoples; with bill C-18, Canadian Farmers will lose the right to save, store, sell & reuse farm-saved seeds.” He has already dismantled the Canada Wheat Board. The list goes on.....

There is a tremendous lack of accountability within our current government. It is time for Canadians to unite and stand up for our rights, our children’s rights, and the future of Canada before we have nothing left.

The Harper government has established a pattern of muzzling government scientists & closed down the Sciences Libraries in a Hitler type action.

Information and programs lost included the Marine Programs such Marine Biology and others such as the Fisheries & Oceans .... main in the Atlantic provinces. This has resulted in loss of species & putting other species At Risk .

Harper promised to transform Canada so it would not be recognizable, and he has been doing his best to keep that promise with secretly-negotiated neoliberal free trade deals and corporate protection pacts (the TPP, the Canada-EU CETA, numerous FIPAs), which focus on increasing corporate rights (including compensation for so-called “lost profits”), privatization, austerity and greatly reduced environmental standards, while requiring governments to open up public services, education, health care, & water resources (among other things) to foreign transnational corporations to purchase and operate as for-profit businesses, or risk being sued. Canada is losing its sovereignty!

Democracy needs our protection and participation. When we look the other way or assume democracy is safe, people like Mr. Harper start chipping away at the edges and before we know it fascists will be changing laws quietly. Stealing our democracy wrecking our environment, poisoning our water, air and food.

PM Harper needs to be held accountable for several “Acts of Contempt” against Canadians, our Constitutional Rights, and our Democracy:

• Election Fraud, which makes him an “Illegitimate” Prime Minister.
• Senate Scandal – proven cover up, lies and corruption in Harper’s PMO
• Abuse of proroguing powers to avoid Parliamentary discussion. Four times!
• The Illegal misuse of the $15 million G-8 legacy fund.
• Omnibus Bills to prevent Parliamentary debate for new laws and to hide legislation, while being fast tracked.
• Stripping protection from 99% of Canada’s 2.5 million rivers and lakes. In 2012 just 82 (1 %!) remained protected.
• Abuse of the Temporary Foreign Workers program.
• Currently has the record number of laws struck down by the courts as “unconstitutional “ - and still counting....
• Privacy breeches like internet searches and phone tapping without warrants.
• $3.1 billion anti-terrorist fund “lost.”
• Corporate tax cuts of over $500 billion.
• Bill C-60 allows Harper unprecedented control over CBC workers and news programs. Controlling the freedoms of the press and freedom of speech.
• Increased OAS eligibility to age 67.
• Food inspection cuts & promoting GMOs.
• Cuts to Health care funding across Canada.
• 7000% increase in advertising budgets for Natural Resources Canada.
• $114 billion to bailout banks during a recession, even though the banks showed a profit and were in no danger of going bankrupt.

1454819358081874.description:
101 Vagina in TORONTO !

Dates:
Saturday 14 June – Sunday 22 June, 2014

Venue:
Creative Blueprint Gallery
376 Bathurst Street
Toronto

See tour details here:
http://101vagina.com/usa-canada

Twitter: @101vagina
--------------------------

101 Vagina is coming to the USA and Canada with a Book Launch and Exhibition Tour!

This tour will mark the official launch of the 101 Vagina book in the USA and Canada.

The exhibitions will comprise all 101 photos and stories from the 101 Vagina book. Three months, six cities! I’m officially excited!


At a some of the exhibitions I will try to organise a one day Festival of the Vagina, pulling together local artists, performers, educators, etc. under the umbrella of celebrating the vagina and removing the taboos.

Know someone who might light to participate? Pass it on :)


ABOUT 101 VAGINA:

101 Vagina is about breaking down the taboo around vaginas and body image shame generally. It confronts the lies we are told about what’s normal and celebrates our uniqueness and diversity. 101 Vagina is also about the sharing of story, of experience; the passing down of knowledge and wisdom.

This book contains 101 beautiful black and white photos of 101 women, along with a message, story or poem written by each woman to accompany their photo. The messages are candid and span the spectrum of emotions. They are raw and honest and form a small compendium of women’s experiences with their bodies and womanhood in general, with a focus on the vagina.

101 Vagina is light and profound, cheeky and deep.

Avicii

May 17, 2014 at Rogers Centre 

Tickets on sale January 31 at 12pm on LiveNation.com

www.facebook.com/avicii
www.twitter.com/avicii

Avicii is renowned for his spectacular live shows, bringing audiences to ecstatic moments of party bliss and ‘driving the crowd bonkers” (Rolling Stone). The highly-anticipated tour that sold out shows in minutes in cities throughout Europe including London, Stockholm, Paris and Amsterdam, will showcase an all-new, world-class production.

After just three years of performing, Avicii rocketed to the #3 position on DJ Mag’s yearly poll of the Top 100 DJs and has appeared on Forbes Most Powerful Artists Under 30 in 2013 and 2014. His first album, last year’s TRUE, was named Album of the Year by Elektro while the New York Times called Avicii “savvy and timely,” and “an artist carrying today – and tomorrow – on his shoulders.” Dancing Astronaut wrote, “…timeless…an hour of excellence.” “Wake Me Up,” the first single from the album, reached #1 in 81 countries, sold over 8.5 million copies worldwide and is a triple platinum-certified single in the US. The song's video has been watched over 235 million times on YouTube alone with views continuing to grow each day. “Hey Brother,” his current single, is exploding at radio while its video has received raves around the world. Watch the video here: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=6Cp6mKbRTQY

1469209493298113.description:
Sultans of String invite you to Kingston Road United Church on Sunday, May 4, 2014, 1:30 - 2:30 pm where they'll perform with special guest sitar master Anwar Khurshid - Sitar Fusion

Tickets $20, available at the church, and through http://smallworldmusic.com/shows/

JUNO nominees/2x CFMA winners, Sultans of String, perform their high octane worldbeat-jazz at the Kingston Rd United Church, May 4th, 2014.  In this special concert, Sultans of String meet the electricity of sitar master Anwar Khurshid.  Anwar's music has been featured in Oscar-winning film Life of Pi as well as The Love Guru and Kama Sutra, besides performances in Europe, North America and Asia.

Known for dizzying roots music jams, poly-rhythms and revved up riffs, the Sultans of String sound can't be pinned down -- it's Sable Island meets the Silk Road, with detours through the Gypsy-Jazz coffeehouses of Eastern Europe, next an East Coast Kitchen Party, over to the majestic Arctic, then to the bustling markets of Lebanon. Fiery violin dances with rumba-flamenco guitar while a funk bass lays down unstoppable grooves. Throughout acoustic strings meet electronic wizardry to create layers and depths of sound. Since their formation 6 years ago, Sultans of String have been riding a wave of success, hitting #1 on world/international music charts in Canada, a JUNO nomination, 2 Canadian Folk Music Awards and 1st prize in the International Songwriting Contest (out of 15,000 entries). They have just released their new, roots-worldbeat-symphonic mash-up, Symphony!, featuring The Chieftains’ very own Paddy Moloney, folk-pop darlings Dala, ukulele giant James Hill, and other special guests. Symphony! is distributed across North America on Red River through SONY, and is available on iTunes and at http://www.sultansofstring.com). Check out their official video, called “Luna”:http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=6uSEI4zRxLM.

Part of #SWAMS14 
Presented in association with Small World Music Society
1469209493298113.name: Sultans of String with Special Guest Anwar Khurshid at Kingston Road United Church in Toronto

1471992883029117.description:
Welcome to ChiSeries March Madness! Featuring three awesome authors, two musicians, three men and a baby and a thief, his wife and her lover. Okay, probably just the authors and the musicians (Kari Maaren & Peter Chiykowski). And hosted by Sandra Kasturi.

ChiSeries Toronto receives funding support from the Ontario Arts Council.

Terri Favro is the author of THE PROXY BRIDE. Described as “a raucous, gritty roller coaster of betrayal, lost innocence and desire,” the book won the Ken Klonsky Quattro Books Novella Award. Terri also collaborated on the graphic novels BELLA AND THE LOYALIST HEROINE and WAITING FOR MARIO PUZO, published by Grey Borders. In 2013, she was shortlisted for the CBC Canada Writes Literary Prize for Creative Non-Fiction, was a finalist in the Broken Pencil Indie Writers Deathmatch and received an Honourable Mention in the CZP/ Rannu Fund speculative fiction contest. She blogs at terrifavro.ca.

Stan Rogal was born in Vancouver, though he's lived in Toronto for so long now he barely remembers the west coast, except as myth. His work has appeared in numerous literary magazines and anthologies in Canada, the US and Europe. He is the author of 4 novels, 4 story and 11 poetry collections. His new collection of stories, OBSESSIONS appears courtesy of Leaping Lion Press. He is also a produced playwright.

Douglas Smith is an award-winning Canadian author whose work has been published in 30 countries and 25 languages. His recent urban fantasy novel, THE WOLF AT THE END OF THE WORLD, was described in Publishers Weekly as "an immersive and enjoyable reading experience. Readers will delight in learning more about Native American mythology, which is skillfully woven throughout the story. Smith's novel is both well paced and deftly plotted." His collections include CHIMERASCOPE, IMPOSSIBILIA, and LA DANSE DES ESPRITS (France). Doug is a three-time winner of Canada's Aurora Award, and has been a finalist for the John W. Campbell Award, CBC's Bookies Award, Canada's juried Sunburst Award, and France's juried Prix Masterton and Prix Bob Morane. His website is smithwriter.com, and he tweets at twitter.com/smithwritr.

Kari Maaren is the ChiSeries Toronto's resident ukelele comedienne. Her first solo album, BEOWULF PULLED MY ARM OFF is almost sold out!

Peter Chiykowski is co-creator of the Kickstarter darling, "Half-Cat." He performs songs and writes stories and poems when not doing fake zoology.
1471992883029117.name: ChiSeries Toronto Presents: Terri Favro, Stan Rogal, Douglas Smith, plus Kari Maaren!

1472961296253734.description:
Sister Spit was established in San Francisco in the early 1990’s as a weekly all-female open mic series, co-founded by Michelle Tea and Sini Anderson. The duo launched the first Sister Spit national tour in 1997: 2 vans chock-full with cutting-edge dyke female writers and performers. Since its inception, Sister Spit has crossed the country many times and re-merged in 2007 as Sister Spit- Next Generation featuring established writers with young, emerging queer and queer-influenced artists of all genders.

April 7, 2014, 7:30pm- The Gladstone Hotel
sliding scale $10-20
Hosted by Beth Lisick!
SPECIAL GUESTS Zoe Whittall AND Kaleb Robertson!!!


Starring.....
Chinaka Hodge is a poet, educator playwright and screenwriter. Originally from Oakland, California, she graduated from NYU’s Gallatin School of Individualized Study in May of 2006, and was honored to be the student speaker at the 174th Commencement exercise. In 2010, Chinaka received USC’s prestigious Annenberg Fellowship to continue her studies at its School of Cinematic Arts. She received her MFA in screenwriting, in 2012. In the Fall of that year, she received the San Francisco Foundation’s Phelan Literary Award for emerging Bay Area talent. Chinaka was a 2012 Artist in Residence at The Headlands Center for the Arts in Marin, CA. In early 2013, Hodge was a Sundance Feature Film lab Fellow for her script, 700th&Int’l.  Since its early days, Chinaka has served in various capacities at Youth Speaks/The Living Word Project, the nation’s leading literary arts non-profit.   During her tenure there, Hodge served as Program Director, Associate Artistic Director, and worked directly with Youth Speaks’ core population —  as a teaching artist and poet mentor.  When not educating or writing for page, Chinaka rocks mics as a founding member of a collaborative Hip Hop ensemble, The Getback. Her poems, editorials, interviews and prose have been featured in Newsweek, San Francisco Magazine, Believer Magazine, PBS, NPR, CNN, C-Span, and in two seasons of HBO’s Def Poetry.

Rhiannon Argo is a writer and schooled librarian. She is the author of two works of literary fiction: the Lambda award–winning novel, The Creamsickle, and the YA-ish novel, Girls I’ve Run Away With. Her stories and novels have inspired both short films and German translations. Argo has performed her work in gazillions of bars, colleges, feminist squats, bookstores, and libraries. She has criss-crossed North America and Europe with Sister Spit enough times to have once acquired a mild case of scurvy. She also tours with her own band of literary renegades, the Moon Babes. Argo has been both a Lambda Literary and Radar Lab Fellow. She is the founder Moonshine Press, and co-founder of the Que(e)rySF, a collective that throws parties to raise funds for hidden queer library collections. She enjoys discussing the art of DIY publishing, sex workers rights, and animal spirit guides.

Virgie Tovar, MA is an author, fat activist and one of the nation’s leading experts and lecturers on fat discrimination and body image. She is the editor of Hot & Heavy: Fierce Fat Girls on Life, Love and Fashion (Seal Press, November 2012). She holds a Master’s degree in Human Sexuality with a focus on the intersections of body size, race and gender. After teaching “Female Sexuality” at the University of California at Berkeley, where she completed a Bachelor’s degree in Political Science in 2005, she went onto host “The Virgie Show” (CBS Radio) in San Francisco. She is certified as a sex educator and was voted Best Sex Writer by the Bay Area Guardian in 2008 for her first book. Virgie has been featured by MTV, the San Francisco Chronicle, NPR, Huffington Post, Bust Magazine, Jezebel, 7×7 Magazine, XOJane, and SF Weekly as well as on Women’s Entertainment Television and The Ricki Lake Show. She lives in San Francisco. Find her online at www.virgietovar.com.

Dia Felix is a writer and filmmaker. She has written for blogs including City Lights and the Museum of Arts and Design and performed her work at many venues including Segue Series and Dixon Place. She is founder and editor of “Personality Press.” Her novel “Nochita” will be published through City Lights/Sister Spit in early 2014. She is an award-winning digital media producer for museums (Exploratorium, Museum of Arts and Design) and teaches and mentors teens in experimental documentary filmmaking. Born and raised in California, she lives in New York.

A longtime fixture in the Bay Area arts scene, Beth Lisick has been a nightlife columnist, independent film actor, performance poet, band leader, and arts organizer. She is the author of five books, including the NY Times bestseller Everybody Into the Pool, and the co-founder of San Francisco’s Porchlight Storytelling Series. In 2012 she received a grant from the Creative Work Fund for her work with Creativity Explored, an arts center for adults with developmental disabilities. Her most recent book, Yokohama Threeway and Other Small Shames was published by City Lights/Sister Spit. She is currently at work on her comedy web series with Tara Jepsen, Rods and Cones. www.bethlisick.com.

Jerry Lee Abram has spent the last 15yrs doing just about anything for queer artists.  He has Tech Directed an extensive amount of projects including The Sex Workers Art Show, Homo A Gogo, Fabulous Artistic Guys Get Overtly Traumatized Sometimes: The Musical and Sister Spit, additionally his lighting in film can be seen in music videos by Hunx and His Punx, The Younger Lovers, Harlem and Brontez Purnell Dance Company’s film FREE JAZZ.   He is honored to be a part of Valencia and will be screening his chapter on Sister Spit 2014.

Award-winning poet, playwright and musician Lenelle Moïse creates jazz-infused, hip-hop bred, politicized performances about Haitian-American identity, creative resistance and the intersection of race, class, gender, sexuality, memory and spirit. Moïse is a current Huntington Theatre Company Playwriting Fellow. Her two-act comedy Merit won the 2012 Southern Rep Ruby Prize. She also wrote, composed, and co-starred in the critically acclaimed drama Expatriate, which launched Off Broadway at the Culture Project in 2008. Lenelle was the fifth Poet Laureate of Northampton, MA. Her debut manuscript of poems, Haiti Glass, is forthcoming from City Lights/ Sister Spit. http://www.lenellemoise.com

1475655875981204.description:
Two of Canada’s most treasured and celebrated trans artists, Ivan Coyote and Rae Spoon, present their acclaimed multimedia show “Gender Failure,” featuring animation and video elements from Seattle artist Clyde Petersen. Through visuals, words, sounds, and original music, “Gender Failure” explores and exposes the prolific pair’s failed attempts at fitting into the gender binary—and ultimately how the gender binary doesn’t add up. Coyote brings their razor-sharp timing and powerful narrative, while Spoon adds an ethereal voice and poetic turns of phrase to the dynamic duo’s now eight-year-old artistic partnership.

This is also the official book launch of Gender Failure, a poignant collection of autobiographical essays, lyrics, and images documenting Ivan and Rae's personal journeys from gender failure to gender self-acceptance. Equal parts hilarious and heartbreaking, it's a book that will touch LGBTQ readers and others, revealing, with candor and insight, that gender comes in more than two sizes. Gender Failure is co-written by Rae and Ivan and published by Arsenal Pulp Press:

http://www.arsenalpulp.com/bookinfo.php?index=398

Doors at 7pm. Show at 7:30pm.

www.raespoon.com
www.ivanecoyote.com


Tickets $15 at the door.

Pre-sale Tickets at:

http://www.eventbrite.ca/e/rae-spoon-and-ivan-e-coyotes-gender-failure-book-launch-at-the-gladstone-hotel-tickets-10956606505?utm_campaign=new_eventv2&utm_medium=email&utm_source=eb_email&utm_term=eventurl_text

Accessibility:

This venue is wheelchair accessible. There is a ramp into the venue as well as an accessible washroom.

1476048982616336.description:
DATE CHANGED TO: APRIL 5th Saturday!!!!

On behalf of the Canadian Centre for the Responsibility to Protect based at the Munk School of Global Affairs, University of Toronto, we are inviting secondary schools in Greater Toronto Area to participate in our upcoming campaign to commemorate the 20th anniversary of the Rwandan Genocide this spring.  

The students will get a tour at the University of Toronto (St.George campus), followed by a special seminar on R2P which will take place at Trinity College, University of Toronto. This seminar will include an introduction to R2P, a case study on R2P & Syria, as well as a hands-on workshop on our R2Plive.org online database.

Through this campaign, we seek to educate and engage with the wider public on the relevance and importance of R2P in today’s world. We also believe that it is important for the younger generation to learn about genocide and reflect upon the meaning of “never again” as they hold keys for the future of humanity.

Please register through our Eventbrite page to attend this event: https://www.eventbrite.ca/e/a-day-at-the-university-of-toronto-tickets-10782423519
1476048982616336.name: A Day at the University of Toronto:  Canadian Centre for Responsibility to Protect

1476990752515063.description:
Canada's First National BJJ Organization Hits Eastern Canada!
 
**********GENERAL INFO**********
 
LOCATION:
- Ryerson University's Kerr Hall Gymnasium
 
RULES:
- Adult Gi, Kids Gi, & Kids NoGi are IBJJF Rules
- Adult NoGi is SUBMISSION ONLY. (In partnership with Fight Network's LAST TO TAP)
 
DIVISIONS:
- All weight divisions as per IBJJF standards
 
WEIGH INS:
- Everyone can weigh in between 8am & 11am the day of the event. This allows for competitors to re-hydrate and eat for their fights
- If you miss this time slot, competitors may weigh in between 12pm & 1pm
 
EARLY REGISTRATION CLOSE DATE:
- May 5th 2014
 
REGISTRATION CLOSES:
- May 16th 2014
 
WATCH OUR PROMO VIDEO HERE!
http://youtu.be/nkBRm99w9qk
 
**********MYSTERY BAGS**********
 
Toronto Classic will be giving out 100 mystery bags to the first 100 registers with over $10,000 worth of prizes!
 
These bags will be available for you to physically choose from at the event. The bags will contain random prizes from our sponsors such as Gameness, Break Point, Hayabusa, Venum, PreFight, MaxSweat, Defense Soap and the Fight Network. 
 
*****TWO $200 SUBMISSION OF THE NIGHT AWARDS*****
 
There is keen interest, more than ever, from companies & television networks in finding Canada's best submission fighters. In order to facilitate this process, the CBJJF & Neojits will have a staff of camera operators for each individual ring, & each individual match. The CBJJF is the first to ever do it this way.
 
A team of 5, which include a black, brown & purple belt will review all the submissions and filter them down to 5 from male adult and 5 from women adult divisions. (if you would like to join the team to filter submissions email info@neojits.com to inquire)
 
Once the fighters are nominated via video, the jiujitsu community will vote online for who they deem to have the best submission.
 
The criteria used for filtering down submissions include, but not limited to:
1. How fast did the submission happen?
2. How close to the bell did the submission happen?
3. How difficult is that submission to apply?
4. How technical & smooth was the submission?
5. Was there a significant weight difference?
 
Please note that we are doing this because we want to help you enjoy your jiujitsu journey and because we want to find the HIDDEN TALENT companies, sponsors & networks want. However, safety is our number one priority. Toronto Classic is very happy and proud to say that the head of the Canadian Brazilian Jiu-Jitsu Federation - CBJJF John Davies is notorious and very much respected for the dedication and emphasis he places on the safety and overall well being of his competitors. Oss.

                **********LAST TO TAP**********

Last To Tap is a Submission Fighting Reality TV Show to be aired late 2014 in over 30 countries (updated from 8) on the Fight Network.

Brazilian jiujitsu & submission fighting is spreading like an epidemic all over the world with virtually a new brand or school opening every single week, if not more. 

This is great news! 

Why? Because it shows that the sport we love is finally catching on, both in raw global awareness and in the business world. At the end of the day, we are all one global jiujitsu community and should celebrate the successes and advances of every brand, affiliation & organization. A perfect example of this is the amazing community focused bjj Podcast JUST THE GI TOP (fb.com/justthegitop).

However, there are good & bad news.

The bad news is... the general population still doesn't understand grappling.

To the general population, submission fighting still looks a bit strange & only a small percentage of MMA fight fans (who don't train) truly understand jiujitsu for what it is.

Only if you train and experience it will you understand how life changing it is.
Only if you train and experience it will you understand how profoundly vast the martial art really is.
Only if you train and experience it will you understand how efficient and humbling it is.

which means...

Only if you train and experience it will you understand why it's creating businesses and academies globally the way it is. 

The good news is...  LAST TO TAP is looking to change precisely that.

Last to Tap will show the world:
WHY we live, breath and eat Brazilian jiujitsu.
WHY we become so emotionally, physically and spiritually involved with submission fighting.
WHY some of us are willing to risk EVERYTHING, to make jiujitsu a part of our daily life.

All, through the lives and experiences of 16 of the most decorated up and coming submission fighters out of Canada. 

Yes, it's finally our time.

For more info & interest to participate in up and coming auditions at OPEN MAT MMA in Toronto this April visit www.lasttotaptv.com 

Do you truly love jiujitsu? Do you want to be involved with jiujitsu full time? Are you doing well in competition?
Last to Tap wants to hear from you.

Auditions for Montreal Quebec TBA.
1476990752515063.name: CBJJF Toronto Classic International & LAST TO TAP

1477298072492111.description:
Dear friends,

We're going to celebrate the Indian spring festival of Holi at this coming satsang regardless of how much more snow we get before this winter is finally spent! For those of you who have not experienced the festival, the primary ingredient is coloured powder.  We'll put a couple of white sheets down, and anyone who wishes to be daubed or to daub someone else can stand on the sheet to indicate their willingness to play! If you don't get near the sheet you'll remain colour-free. But it is fun and many get sucked in by the end, even if it's just a small smear of purple on the cheek. Wear clothes you don't mind getting soiled.

Miranda and I enjoyed one of the first days of our honeymoon in Rajasthan, in March 2004, caught up in a swirl of Holi play. There wasn't another adult woman to be found anywhere and I was very nervous for my new bride and even more so for her Nikon camera every time she manually changed a roll of film amidst clouds of red and green dust. In more urban areas of India the women get involved. Once I was the recipient of a bucket full of coloured water dumped on my head, while a 90 year old grandmother, coloured up from head to toe, stood by laughing her head off before giving me her blessing with some more powder.

We are taught by example of our Satguru Yeshu to rejoice with those who rejoice and mourn with those who mourn. To get more wine, when the wine runs out and not worry about what religious people may think! To dive in and get involved with the world and it's celebrations. And while doing so to be filled with God's love.
In that Spirit we welcome (and long for) the coming of Spring.  

The following satsang will be on Good Friday, April 18th. We will be conducting a Maha Prasad (breaking of the coconut to symbolize the sacrificial death of Christ on the cross).

blessings,

Chris and Miranda



-----------------------

Yeshu Satsang

 

Friday, March 21st, 2014

7 pm

Church of the Resurrection

1100 Woodbine Avenue

Toronto, ON, M4C 4C7

1482432285308435.description:
Live in Concert Lebanon's National Cultural Award winner, brings her electrifying vocals for the first time to the Queen Elizabeth Theater in Toronto. Karaa's unforgettable vocal performance in the Oscar nominated, Golden Globe winning movie American Hustle's in White Rabbit- Arabic has received worldwide recognition and garnered her fans around the globe.
 
In an evening of unforgettable music Mayssa Karaa brings together some of the finest traditional and rock musicians performing with her both traditional folk Arabic and French melodies, while introducing  her new soul stirring rock compositions all infused with lush orchestral arrangements. Karaa combines her  classical music/vocal training from Berklee college of Music with her deep understanding of her Lebanese cultural roots. Karaa is joined on stage by masterful Flamenco guitarist Marcus Nand whose roots via Spain -UK and now the United States and Canada, has won him International acclaim. Nand and Karaa will perform their new duet, a reflective rock melody driven with their stunning vocals and Nand's passionate gypsy-rock guitar rhythms.
1482432285308435.name: Mayssa Karaa -May 24, 2014 Toronto Buy Tickets online www.royalstartour.com

Vendredi 18 Avril au Cabaret Lion d'Or, nous invitons la reine du swing, la pétillante Tia Brazda accompagnée de son live band en provenance de Toronto.

Bienvenue dans l'univers du Speakeasy Electro Swing Montreal !
Nées clandestinement dans un loft montréalais il y a trois ans, les soirées mensuelles Speakeasy font maintenant danser les swingers au grand jour. Le bon plan des concepteurs Eliazar, Don Mescal et Khalil ? Marier la musique de la première Grande Dépression à la technologie de la seconde... et ça swing en diable ! Musiciens, cours de swing, performance cirque et burlesque viennent ajouter une touche de folie !
▬▬▬▬▬▬▬▬▬▬▬▬▬▬▬▬▬▬▬▬▬▬▬▬▬▬▬

☛ TIA BRAZDA (Toronto)
Talent, pin-up et attitude sont les quelques adjectifs qui décrivent bien la pétillante Tia Brazda.
Cette jeune torontoise a sorti son premier album "Cabin Fever” en Février 2012. Après avoir perfectionné son style dans les clubs de Toronto, l'impertinente Tia Brazda est parti faire une tournée en Europe l'an dernier.
La musique de Tia Brazda rend hommage à l'âge d'or du swing tout en restant audacieusement moderne.

http://www.tiabrazda.com/

PERFORMANCE BURLESQUE :

★ Lulu Les Belles Mirettes ★

Lulu les belles mirettes est une artiste burlesque basée à Montréal dont l’univers coloré, humoristique et très graphique est teinté de pop-culture. Son style décalé et facétieux vous charmera. Elle a performé au sein de différentes troupes à Montréal telles que ACME Burlesque ou Sublimes rondeurs ainsi que plusieurs festivals : Montréal, Toronto, Boston ou encore Burlington, VT. Elle est par ailleurs la co-fondatrice de BurlesGeek Montreal – Heroes & Boobs, un ensemble d’artistes dont les performances scéniques allient burlesque et culture geek.

★ Miguel Jalaff ★
Actif depuis plus de dix dans l’univers circassien, Miguel Jalaff se spécialise en tant que jongleur, manipulateur d’objets et monocycliste. Il a acquis son expertise majoritairement en Amérique latine avec des maitres tels que Sean Gandini, Antonio Antolio, Jesus Fornies y Michael Moschen. Domicilié au Québec depuis maintenant deux ans il exerce son art de façon autonome, notamment dans les plus grands festivals de la province (Festival de Jazz de Montréal, Montréal en lumières, etc.) il est également très actif sur la scène culturelle  locale.

Depuis 1865, El Tinieblo Ranch a produit un Mezcal artisanale de grande qualité. Ce Mezcal provient de Tamaulipas. Légèrement fumé au goût avec une touche épice & poire sur la palette, à déguster en shooter ou sur glace comme un bon vieux scotch.

Born in the secrecy of a Montreal loft three years back, the monthly Speakeasy Electro Swing evenings now bring the rhythm out into broad daylight… along with deepest midnight! Conceptualists Eli, Tibo and Khalil had a plan: to marry the music of the first Great Depression to the technology of the second… and swing like crazy!

☛ TIA BRAZDA (Toronto)

 hitting #1 on iTunes Canada Jazz chart as well as charting on college radio stations across the nation. Having honed her cutting edge sound in the clubs of Toronto, Tia Brazda’s sassy songs and pin-up girl style have made a startling impression. Globe and Mail declares her music “a technicolour swing that’s just the thing” while Metro New’s states,”her talent, style and attitude are all befitting of stardom.”
“Thief In The Night” wouldn’t be out of place on a Tarantino soundtrack.
Tia Brazda’s music pays homage to the golden era while still remaining daringly modern.
