1486290678256636.description:
THE PEOPLE’S KING by Noam Lemish
A Musical Tribute to Bhutan
Thursday, April 24th
THE MUSIC GALLERY
197 John St. 
(Church of St. George The Martyr: 1 block north of Queen St. We. on the NE corner of John St. & Stephanie St.)
Doors at 7:00 pm, concert & presentation at 8:00 pm
$20 advance / $15 for Music Gallery members and students
Presented in association with Small World Music & The 12th Annual Asian Music Series

Tickets:
https://www.musicgallery.org/ticketing/raots_start.php


--

The People’s King is a four-part suite, composed by Noam Lemish during his time teaching in Thimphu in 2009-10 and presented to the King of Bhutan on the occasion of His Majesty’s 30th birthday. The original composition has been modified for jazz quartet, and this special concert is the project’s Toronto premiere. It will be accompanied by a presentation by the composer about the musical and cultural traditions of this little-known Himalayan nation.  

Links:
www.thepeoplesking.com
www.facebook.com/thepeoplesking 

The band:
Noam Lemish: piano, composition & arrangement
Sundar Viswanathan: reeds
Justin Gray: bass
Derek Gray: drums
--

About The People’s King

The People’s King is a musical tribute to Bhutan, its dedicated and compassionate King, its beautiful culture, and wonderful people – all of whom touched pianist & composer Noam Lemish during his residence as a volunteer music teacher in Bhutan’s capital city of Thimphu in 2009-2010.

This musical offering–commissioned by The Royal Office of Media in celebration of the King’s 30th birthday–features four traditional Bhutanese instruments, piano, and chanting monks, and integrates jazz, classical Western music, and traditional Bhutanese folk music. This multi-movement suite was recorded and delivered to His Majesty, King Jigme Khesar Namgyel Wangchuck on the occasion of his thirtieth birthday, February 21st, 2010; with excerpts performed before him in July of that year. The monks of Dechen Phodrang Monastery in Thimphu were recorded especially for the purpose of this composition, chanting the Amitayus mantra of Limitless Life in dedication to His Majesty’s Birthday.

Upon his return to North America, Noam arranged the concert-length suite for jazz quartet featuring piano, woodwinds, bass and drums; while continuing to incorporate the recorded chanting monks in the live performance. The jazz adaptation made its world premiere on opening night of the 2011 Healdsburg Jazz Festival in northern California and  has since been performed on numerous occasions.
1486290678256636.name: THE PEOPLE'S KING Toronto Premiere Thu Apr 24 @ The Music Gallery

1486614341557586.description:
Join us for an exciting night of live competitive painting on April 29th for AB115 at The Great Hall in Toronto! 

Art Battle Toronto welcomes 16 artists to the national community, we can't wait to showcase their talent and courage on this very special night!

Featured painters in AB115:

Maria Gernega
Chris Perez
Marc Cooper
Karen Grosman
Kyryl Volovik
Maria Fondler-Grossbaum
Alona Malysheuski
Antonina Kostiyk
Bahar Hashemi
Romeo Masalunga
Natalia Starikova
James Muehmer
Patrick Nunziata
Anthony Smerek

Now in more than a dozen cities from coast-to-coast, Art Battle Canada is searching for the best painters from across the country and Toronto is the city that started it all! You decide who wins the title, $200 cash prize and an easel in the AB Toronto Finals. Winner of the Toronto Finals will advance to represent the city in the 2014 National Championship.

News about Art Battle Day: On May 10th the whole country will be painting together in the first ever Art Battle Day. There will be 3 local organizations in Toronto running live competitive painting events as part of the celebration, see where they are and which communities in Canada are joining the fun > http://artbattle.ca/abd/

The Art Battle Day facebook event page is here > https://www.facebook.com/events/1400036086935542/

Visit us at http://artbattle.com/ for info on all our events and follow on twitter @artbattlecanada

To compete as a painter at Art Battle in Toronto or another city, please visit our application page http://artbattle.ca/register

What is Art Battle?
Art Battle is a live competitive painting event. 16 painters will create the best work they can in 20 minutes. As they work, the audience moves around the easels, allowing them an up close view of the creative process. The medium used is acrylic paint and the tools allowed are brushes, palette knives or any other non-mechanical implements. At the end of the round, the audience votes for their favourite painting and can also later place bids in a silent auction to take the paintings home. This is Art Battle Canada's 5th season!

Art Battle 115
Tuesday, April 29th, 2014
The Great Hall, 1087 Queen St W, 7:30pm

Tickets available online and at the door
$20, 15$ Earlybird 
12-Month Membership passes also available.

Email hello@artbattle.ca with any questions :)

See you on the 29th!
xo
Art Battle
1486614341557586.name: Art Battle 115 - Toronto

1487266158156219.description:
WEAROUT will be at the  FAT- Arts & Fashion Week in Toronto from Tuesday April 22d to Saturday 26th, 2014.

WEAROUT emerges from a study on dress and society. Clothes are the most visible and immediate manifestation of self. Intimately linked with the wearer, they also convey the values of society.
Is it possible to approach fashion design without imposing a model to follow?
This project is the outcome of this premise. Since body movement is as individual as our fingerprints, a design that takes this into account becomes singular to each person. The mechanism applied on the fabric adjusts to the wearer. The garment takes its final shape once each person has used it.
1487266158156219.name: Exhibition WEAROUT at Fashion Art Toronto 2014

1524499877776497.description:
Join us for our monthly meeting on Friday, March 28th. We will be focusing on women's struggles in Canada, where women still earn 26% less than men and ongoing cuts and austerity are disproportionately impacting low-income and marginalized women across the country. 

 Helen Kennedy will be speaking on the topic, followed by discussion. Helen is a long time social and labour movement activist. She is the current president of CUPE's Toronto District Council and an executive officer for the Toronto and York Region Labour Council. Helen is also the former chair of CUPE's National Women's Task Force.

After our presentation and discussion we will be holding elections for our new executive! The positions are: One male identifying and one female identifying co-chair, two members-at-large, a treasurer, and an equity coordinator. Half of the positions must be filled by female identifying members. You must be 25 and under and a member of the NDP to be eligible to run.

Meeting details:
Date: Friday, March 28th 2014
Time: 7pm-9pm
Location: OPSEU membership centre at 31 Wellesley Street East (in the basement)
Contact: Jessica at 647-378-1385 or email us at torontoynd@gmail.com

NO TICKET NEEDED-FREE EVENT 
Keep us #1 in the world! For updates follow us on Twitter@GMMLIVE

The 16th annual Global Marijuana March (GMM) is FREE to attend and you DON'T need a ticket to participate. Date is set for Saturday May 3rd 2013 in well over 100 cities across the globe! 

The GMM is the world’s largest marijuana march attracting upwards of 20,000 medical and recreational cannabis supporters and enthusiasts to downtown Toronto. The GMM crowd gathers behind the provincial Queens Park legislature at HIGH NOON before the parade at 2pm north of the park at Charles Street. The confirmed march route will be released in the new year and we expect to once again be travelling along the world's longest street. There will once again be a 4:20PM countdown at the official GMM after party. 

The peaceful protest and celebration has never had an arrest in the event's 16 year history. The GMM is the City’s largest spring outdoor gathering generating millions of dollars to the local economy. It will be taking place 3 weeks after ERB4HERB's Natonal 'www.420rally.ca' on Sunday April 20th 2013. Toronto's 4/20 will once again be at Yonge & Dundas Square.

Invite all your friends all at once! Keep us #1 in the world!

203444603199381.description:
IT'S ST. PADDY'S DAY SO LETS SHOW THEM HOW PAGANS CELEBRATE!

Come out to the Toronto Pagan Pub Moot at The Fox and Fiddle!

The Toronto Pagan Pub Moot will be held at The Fox and Fiddle 1535 Yonge Street (2 blocks north of St. Clair on Yonge) in the upstairs private room to enjoy a bite and a drink with old friends and new!

Monday, March 17th, 2014.

7:00pm to close

Enjoy a night out with other Pagans and Pagan-friendly folk of the GTA. The Fox and Fiddle is a pagan friendly venue that offers a complete menu and a well stocked bar.

Children are welcome.

St. Clair Subway Station is in walking distance.

There is free parking at the Church next door. (Entrance is on the North Side of the Church...not the south!)

The Toronto Pagan Pub Moot is the first Pagan Pub Moot in Canada (c. Feb 1996) and is an open and friendly social event that meets every Third Calendar Monday of every month. It is open to Pagans, Wiccans, Witches, Druids, Asatru, etc of ALL ages and those who are new and would like to learn more. As this is a social event, there are no lectures or specific talks. It is a GREAT place to meet up with old friends and make new friends.

The TPPM is also a great place to find out what else is going on in the Greater Toronto Area Pagan Community. A wonderful place to network, grow and learn. We get about 30 - 60 people at each Moot so it is a great place to connect.

The Fox and Fiddle welcomes the Toronto Pagan Pub Moot by offering a private upstairs room, a full menu of pub fare, drinks, those who are 19 years or younger CAN now come to the Moot! Pagan Parents can come and bring their children.

Those who are 16 to 19 should come with others and those who are under 16 should come with a guardian or parent.

Come out to have a great time, meeting new people, connecting with old friends, and having just a great ol' time with other Pagans and pagan friendly people.

Karen Dales will also have some copies of her award winning book limited edition of "Angel of Death: Book One of the Chosen Chronicles" (incl. 'Changeling: Prelude to the Chosen Chronicles" and her new novel "Shadow of Death: Book Two of the Chosen Chronicles" available for purchase. http://www.karendales.com/

If you have any questions or the like please email karendales@rocketmail.com

or better yet, call Karen or Evan at 416-635-5981
203444603199381.name: Toronto Pagan Pub Moot

204922689716791.description:
Local production company MDFF and independent video magazine The Seventh Art announce their partnership on a monthly screening series at Toronto’s CAMERA. The series builds on MDFF's run of successful screenings at multi-use arts space Double Double Land and will start on April 16th with the Toronto Premiere of HAIL. Australian filmmaker Amiel Courtin-Wilson will be in attendance.

Both epic love story and autobiography, the audacious HAIL is the culmination of six years of collaboration between director Amiel Courtin-Wilson and Daniel P. Jones, a 50-year-old former prisoner with a poet’s vision of the world. Released from prison, the fierce-yet-vulnerable Danny is reunited with his lover Leanne (played by Jones' real-life partner Leanne Letch), with whom he shares an intense and haunting love. But despite his best intentions, Danny remains profoundly troubled by the spectre of alcohol and past violence witnessed, and it isn't long before his fragile domestic existence is torn asunder. The film  premiered in 2011 at the 68th Venice International Film Festival as part of the Orizzonti section.

Located within Stephen Bulger Gallery on Queen Street W., CAMERA is a fully licensed venue, featuring stadium seating, a 50-person capacity, and is wheelchair accessible. 

Advance tickets available here: http://guestlistapp.com/events/244659

Link to full press release: http://www.theseventhart.org/main/mdff-and-the-seventh-art-team-up-for-screening-series-at-torontos-camera/
204922689716791.name: MDFF and The Seventh Art launch new screening series at CAMERA: Toronto Premiere of Amiel Courtin-Wilson's HAIL.

206144699538716.description:
www.EndFluorideToronto.com 

A peaceful assembly and march to end artificial water fluoridation in the city of Toronto.

Sign the petition to end water fluoridation in Toronto: 

http://www.change.org/en-CA/petitions/toronto-city-council-stop-fluoridating-toronto-s-tap-water

Why End Water Fluoridation?

1.) Hydrofluorosilicic Acid is a toxic waste by-product of phosphate fertilizer production that is used to fluoridate Toronto's public water supply. In addition to Fluoride, it contains toxic chemical elements, such as lead, arsenic, mercury and radioactive substances. 

2.) The largest U.S. study comparing tooth decay between those drinking fluoridated vs. non-fluoridated water found a non-significant gain of 0.6 of a surface of a tooth (out of 128 tooth surfaces) for those drinking fluoridated water (Brunelle & Carlos, 1990). Other research shows that there is no relation between dental carries and the amount of Fluoride ingested ( Warren et al., 2009). 

3.) Consumption of artificially fluoridated water has also been associated with lowered IQ, bone cancer in boys, skeletal and dental fluorosis, hypothyroidism, kidney disease, and other adverse health effects.
For specific studies pertaining to these adverse health effects visit www.FluorideAlert.org or www.cof-cof.ca

4.) Forcing the public to consume fluoridated water infringes on their right to informed consent

www.EndFluorideToronto.com
206144699538716.name: Unfluoridate Me - End Fluoride Toronto

209360109261457.description:
Presented by Bum Chic Productions

Contemporary Musical Theatre Songs by Kerrigan & Lowdermilk

Kait Kerrigan (words) and Brian Lowdermilk (music) made their off-Broadway debut in 2006 with their adaptation of Henry and Mudge. Other musicals include The Unauthorized Autobiography of Samantha Brown, Tales From The Bad Years, The Woman Upstairs, Wrong Number, The Freshman Experiment, Republic and Flash of Time. Their first album, Our First Mistake (2011), charted at #1 on the iTunes Singer/Songwriter chart; their new album, Kerrigan-Lowdermilk Live (2013), documents a concert tour that resulted from their breakout $35K kickstarter. Among them, they have received the 2009 Kleban Award, 2006 Larson Award, 2005 Richard Rodgers Award, and 2004-2005 Dramatists Guild Fellowship. They have held residencies at the Orchard Project and the MacDowell Arts Colony. www.kerrigan-lowdermilk.com. 

PARTY WORTH CRASHING is a special concert of songs from Kerrigan & Lowdermilk's musicals. It's a show about youth, coming of age, and learning lessons. It’s about laughing at yourself, and figuring things out on your own. It’s about realizing that with the freedom to do anything comes the responsibility to do something.

209965842527797.description:
Assembly Time: 12:00 pm
Start Time: 1:00 pm


THE TIME HAS COME!

This year we will again be calling loud and clear for the abolition of animal slavery and exploitation, and will demand an end to breeding, farming, fishing, and slaughter.

Meat consumption causes more suffering and death than any other human activity and is completely unnecessary.

This is a conservative estimate of the number of aquatic animals killed worldwide:

31,710 (each second)

1,902,588 (each minute)

1,000 billion (each year)

This is conservative estimate of land animals killed worldwide for the appetite of humans:

2,029 (each second)

121,766 (each minute)

64 billion (each year)

On Saturday, June 14, 2014, be part of an historic international day to denounce the injustice done to all nonhuman victims of human oppression and exploitation.  Join us in a peaceful march through the streets of Toronto to close down all slaughterhouses.

Compassionate citizens are mobilizing to engage communities in the Meat Abolition movement. So far, Paris, Toulouse, Toronto, Montreal, New York, Los Angeles, Sydney, Berne and London and  have confirmed their participation.  Join this historic and international march!

See the video below from the first Toronto march held in June 2013:

http://youtu.be/uM4_7DBUYHg

For more information, please visit: 

Toronto march website:  www.mtcas.org
French website:  www.fermons-les-abattoirs.org/en
Meat Abolition website: www.meat-abolition.org

If you would like to volunteer and/or contribute your talents to help making the march a success, please contact us at: tmtcas@gmail.com

Please join our Facebook group and like our page!

https://www.facebook.com/TorontoMarchToCloseDownAllSlaughterhouses

https://www.facebook.com/groups/209715355828656/

214051315471489.description:
Ребята, привет!

Начиная с января у нас регулярно начал проходить богословский кружок для молодёжи. Мы читаем разные церковные книги, в том числе и Евангелие, Святых Отцов и ведём дискуссии на разные темы, в том числе о значении прочитанного, о его смысле, о том как это применяется и связано с современной жизнью. Также, после этой части, можно побеседовать и провести дискуссию на любую интересующую вас тему с отцом Вячеславом.

Следующая встреча состоится 10-го апреля в 6.30 вечера в зале столовой Свято-Троицкого Храма по адресу 23 Henry Street. (Зайдя на территорию Храма, заходите в самую правую, т.е. южную, дверь и спускайтесь по лестнице вниз). У нас также будет краткий молебен. 

Мы также заодно проведём небольшие посиделки!) Накроем общий стол - каждый приносите с собой что-то перекусить и напитки- пожалуйста приносите с собой только постную пищу, так как сейчас идёт Великий Пост (постная пища не содержит в себе ничего мясного, рыбного, молочного и яичного).

Чтобы принять участие, НЕ обязательно быть прихожанином нашего Свято-Троицкого Храма. Приходите и приглашайте своих друзей и знакомых, которым это может быть интересно.;)

У нас есть прекрасная новость, уже в скором будущем, наш кружок станет еженедельным! :)

ABOUT
Toronto based DJ Wristpect remains focused on delivering quality music to the masses. He has played a-list events at world-renown venues, released award-winning collaborations, and has worked closely with some of today's most influential music, lifestyle, fashion, technology and entertainment brands.

Deep musical knowledge and sharp technical skills have allowed Wristpect to establish himself as one of North America's finest open format DJs. Blessed with the unique ability to read and connect with all sorts of individuals, he is constantly the DJ of choice for product launches, nightclubs, concerts and private events all over the world. 

Over the last five years, Wristpect has played alongside and for the likes of Eminem, DJ AM, Rihanna, LMFAO, Lady Gaga, Usher, Mary J Blige, Busta Rhymes, Jazzy Jeff, Drake, Nas, Ludacris, The Clipse, Oasis, Justin Bieber, John Legend, Samuel L Jackson, Lebron James, MSTRKRFT, Kim Kardashian, Adidas, Blackberry, Toronto International Film Festival, TEDx, Google, Sony- Ericsson, Hennessy, MTV, Moet, Belvedere, and Playboy.

On top of maintaining residencies at Canada’s premier venues, Wristpect continues to tour internationally throughout Europe (Belgium, France, Norway, Amsterdam, Zurich, London), Asia (Hong Kong, Shanghai, Kuala Lumpur, Singapore, Beijing), South America (Costa Rica), and North America (Toronto, Las Vegas, New York City, Los Angeles, Montreal, Chicago, Vancouver, Whistler, Boston, Washington, Calgary, Edmonton, Winnipeg, Halifax, Newfoundland).

Known for showing off diversity and depth, his sets are always custom tailored to the event and audience at hand. His eclectic and high energy selection has been known to contain everything from classic and current house, dance, hip hop, electro and old school to r&b, rock, dancehall, trap, 80s, 90s and current hits – all tastefully blended, and remixed together live on the spot. 

Wristpect has entertained music lovers through playing live sets worldwide, sharing online mixes with a dedicated global podcast listenership, and also on commercial radio (where he was the youngest DJ to be featured on Toronto’s FLOW 93.5 FM Mixology Show Saturday Nights 9- 10pm). He has also lectured at university-level music courses and was a featured instructor at Canada’s premiere DJ School, ‘Scratchlab DJ Institute’.

Wristpect's talent, hard work and to his craft have not gone unrecognized; he was awarded ‘Fan Choice DJ of the Year’ as well as ‘Toronto DJ of the Year’ at the 2011 Stylus DJ Awards and has also received accolades such as ‘Canadian Club DJ of the Year’, ‘Toronto DJ of the Year’, and ‘Mixtape of the Year’ in past years.

Continuing to build his brand, this young DJ, entrepreneur, and emerging producer remains driven by the desire to share his passion for music with individuals and audiences worldwide.
215670371976998.name: FRESH FRIDAYS with Toronto's DJ WRISTPECT

218820881630100.description:
The Toronto Student Film Festival is run by youth for youth. Since its inception in 2006, the festival has received hundreds of submissions from almost every continent on the globe.

TSFF is currently heading into its ninth season in 2014. 

The Toronto Student Film Festival is run by youth for youth. Since its inception in 2006, the festival has received hundreds of submissions from almost every continent on the globe. 

The festival strives to promote and showcase the work that young filmakers are creating around the world. Whether it was shot on a cell-phone or an HD camera we want to see it. 

The top films selected by the programmers will be screened May of 2014 at the Isabel Bader Theater.

On the night, category winners will be awarded with prizes ranging from cash to film programs to scolarships. Past sponsors include the New York Film Academy, TIFF, Theatre D Digital, and Urban Post Production. 

Our judging panel has been comprised of filmmakers from various fields within the film industry. Last years judges were Ron Mann, Susan Coyne and Richard Crouse.
218820881630100.location: Isabel Bader Theater - University of Toronto
218820881630100.name: 9th Annual Toronto Student Film Festival

Tickets $20. Proceeds to charity. Doors open at 7:30, shows start at 8:30. General seating. Must be 19 or older to attend.

Show Description:
Ron Burgundy and the Channel 4 News Team are back on the Toronto news scene. Only one problem, hobnobbing with Rob Ford and Justin Trudeau has its risks and they get caught smoking the pot by the po-po. With Harper's 'tough on crime' agenda, this minor offence lands them in the slammer. What's more... Harper budget cuts and his fear of a Canadian 'Pussy Riot' have led to the world’s first co-ed kind-of-like-res-but-in-lockdown federal prison. There, they meet the women from The Orange is the New Black and learn what it really means to 'drop the moisturizer'. 

Will they discover the extent of Warden Harper's plan before it threatens the lives of every clean air loving, green party voting, marijuana smoking, left-leaning pinko in Canada? Tune in to the Prison News to find out.

http://www.eventbrite.com/e/international-karate-seminar-ii-featuring-scott-langley-6th-dan-master-instructor-tickets-11126859737?aff=efbevent

If you attended the Langley sensei karate seminar in 2013 you know that you will not want to miss his return visit to Canada for this two day intensive karate seminar. Learn from a master, one of only 5 westerners to graduate the intensive  JKS Instructors Course. Langley sensei will be instructing childrens and adult seminars on Friday and Saturday.

Advance registration is recommended, take advantage of our packaged All Session pricing. Please purchase tickets in advance and print out your tickets to bring to the event.

Scott Langley 6th Dan

Scott is one of the youngest people ever to win the World Championships and has over 25 years experience practicing and teaching karate.

Scott spent 5 years studying at the Japan Karate Shotorenmei World Headquarters in Tokyo and then returned to Ireland with a mandate to build the JKS in the UK & Ireland.

“Scott Langley is one of the few instructors to have learnt karate in Japan from the source. He teaches the true art of karate. In Europe this is very rare and should be taken advantage of!” Yutaka Koike 5th Dan – All Japan Champion

224138171109104.description:
Guest speaker: Mary Fragedakis, City Councillor

Last July, a tanker train carrying inflammable "Bakken oil" exploded in Lac Megantic, Quebec in the middle of the night, killing 47 residents. This train travelled right through Toronto on the CP Rail line on its way to Lac Megantic.

Similar trains roll through our city many times each day. Could such an explosion happen right here, in our city? 

Mary Fragedakis has helped lead City Council in its call for strong action to avert this threat.

Come to an open discussion. Hear the fact and speak your mind. 

Organized by East End Against Line 9
info@eastendnotar.org
224138171109104.location: Danforth Mennonite Church, 2174 Danforth Ave., east of Woodbine - Toronto
224138171109104.name: Can Lac Mégantic Rail Tragedy Happen in Toronto?

--------------------
About Matthew Barry:
--------------------

Matthew Barry - Head Casting Director


My Goal for You:

My goal is not only to make you a better actor, but a working actor by giving you advantages over your competition. Taking your strengths and making them stronger. Breaking bad habits. Giving you confidence and guiding you through the audition process, your pictures, demo reels - and advice on how to secure that elusive US manager and/or agent.

Me in a nutshell:

Born in New York - Matthew Barry was a successful actor, best known for starring in Bernardo Bertolucci's film "La Luna".

After many years of acting, he asked director Barry Levinson for a production job and was guided to the casting department.


Matthew has since spent the next 20 years as a Casting Director, working with Tim Burton on "Ed Wood and "Mars Attacks", Brett Ratner on "Rush Hour 1 and 2" and "Family Man", Nick Cassavetes on "Unhook the Stars", "She's So Lovely", "John Q" "The Notebook", "Alpha Dog", “My Sister’s Keeper", and Producer Jerry Bruckheimer on "Crimson Tide" (Tony Scott) and "Con Air" (Simon West).


Matthew's ability to spot and work with talent has allowed him to discover, and was significant in advancing the careers of James Gandolfini and Philip Seymour Hoffman ("Money For Nothing"), Ryan Phillipe, Steve Zahn and James LeSure ("Crimson Tide"), Don Cheadle ("Devil in a Blue Dress"), Dave Chappelle and Monica Potter ("Con Air"), Lucy Liu ("Shanghai Noon"), Dakota Fanning ("Tomcats"), Roselyn Sanchez ("Rush Hour 2") Rachel McAdams ("The Notebook"), Katt Williams ("Friday After Next"), Amanda Seyfried, Oliva Wilde, Ben Foster, Anton Yelchin (“Alpha Dog”) among others.


His next venture will be directing the feature film “Good Guys”, based on the biggest hostage situation in the history of America.

224682567720616.description:
Nouvelle coproduction entre le 7(7) café et Club Bizarre. Cette fois nous avons le plaisir de recevoir les canadiens de Jokers of the Scene au courant de leur tournée européenne. 
Le rendez-vous est donc pris le Jeudi 3 Avril à partir de 22h, warm up par Club Bizarre, entrée libre bien entendu! 

JOKERS OF THE SCENE (NEW KANADA/THRONE OF BLOOD) :

Toronto duo JOKERS OF THE SCENE have ranked among the brightest lights in Canada’s dance music renaissance, with a string of releases on Fool’s Gold Records and a deep remix catalogue.
For the latest JOTS releases and possibly the most expansive yet , they recruited remixers Daniel Avery, Mickey Moonlight, Psycatron, Hrdvsion and more creating a soundtrack perfect for home listening and strobe-lit warehouses alike.
Late 2012 also saw the birth and debut EP of their collaborative alias Bohemian Groove on Throne Of Blood Records. They are also working on original JOTS material for the New York based label this year.

https://www.facebook.com/JokersoftheScene
http://soundcloud.com/jokers-of-the-scene


CLUB BIZARRE (DAYS OF BEING WILD/ASTROLAB) : 

Créé en Novembre 2010, le Club Bizarre de Binda et Sam Berdah s'est fait petit à petit une place dans la scène électronique. Après un premier EP sorti sur le label anglais Days Of Being Wild et remixé par Chloé, quelques remixes pour Clouded Vision et Startalk Int. notamment, le duo prépare la sortie de deux nouveaux EPs avant l'été, ainsi qu'un morceau sur la prochaine compilation Clouded Vision Experiment et plusieurs remixes. Entre quelques dates à Berlin, Londres, Madrid et Tel-Aviv, Club Bizarre sera aux commandes du 7(7) pour ouvrir la soirée. Un printemps chargé donc…

http://www.facebook.com/leclubbizarre
http://www.soundcloud.com/club-bizarre


ARTWORK : HELLOGZA

225303551002871.description:
Every 4th Thursday of the month MACHINE: // A Modern Discotheque takes over Plush ATX.

This months special guest_
CYCLIST- Toronto Canada
DFA Records, MANI/PEDI, Whiskey Pickle

https://soundcloud.com/cyclist
www.facebook.com/cyclistmusic
https://twitter.com/cyclistmusic

From a rapturous dawn, dee-jay Mark Penner, alias Cyclist, was knee-deep in disco. After a gold star cajoling turn in the DFA remix competition for The Rapture's "How Deep Is Your Love" (alongside fellow Canuk Pat Lok), Cyclist has gone from strength to strength; a successful all-disco residency with A Digital Needle at Toronto's Beam Me Up has seen the eclectic producer share the spotlight with the likes of Al Kent, Kon, Psychemagik & Eddie C, as well as bolster his production repertoire by working with Goldroom, Drop Out Orchestra, Rogue Vogue & notably vocalist Maiko Watson - a collaboration which has resulted in over a hundred thousand plays on Soundcloud.

Since embarking on his first international tour - an excursion which included stops in Mexico, Spain & France - Cyclist has brought his indie-dance fusing brand of boogie funk to the global stage, with a full slate of North American & European dates to follow in 2014. His own label, MANI/PEDI Records with RAC's Karl Kling, launched late 2013 to intercontinental kudos, with a deluge of dancefloor-oriented releases to transpire in the year to come.

When not occupied by establishing Beam Me Up as Canada's premier disco party, Cyclist is consumed by his passion for analogue synths and digging for records - an obsession which, while steeped in the past, influences a sound that is very much modern - a juxtaposition that makes Cyclist the obsessive, disco-discerning tastemaker he is.

++

Resident Players_
_ MACHINE: // A Modern Discotheque _
ADAM WARPED + JFrancis + RiCHARD.GEAR

https://twitter.com/machinedisco
http://soundcloud.com/machine-discotheque
http://whiskeypickle.com/ http://discobydesign.com/
http://kcmanagement.net/

21+ w/ID
$5 after 11pm

After enduring an ice storm, freezing temperatures and a damn polar vortex, not only do we DESERVE this upcoming warm weather but we should feel ENTITLED to attending events that maximize everything GREAT about Spring - and that's why the R&B: Relationships & Bullsh*t show is coming back to Toronto on April 26th for show #3. As summer descends upon us, it's time to put all that antisocial, winter-hibernation bullshit on the shelf, and get back into the swing of enjoying long-warm nights with great food, great friends and great music, EVERYTHING you can expect from an R&B show.

If you've NEVER been to an R&B show, it can best be desribed 25% conversation party, 25% Jazz lounge (with singers and band), 25% mixer/cocktail reception and 25% party. Not only will we be talking about relationships and bullshit, but you will also be entertained with great music, great food, nice drinks and a frowsy-free venue.

On the 26th, the main point of our conversation will be, “Are People In TORONTO Still Interested In Serious Relationships & Marriage, OR Do We All Just Want Casual Sex?!” which you KNOW will be a HOT topic.

This will NOT be a panel event, but instead will be a co-hosted and interactive discussion featuring the help of my homegirl Bee from 83toinfinity.com.

The doors open at 8:00 PM and the show starts promptly at 9:00 PM.

Get your tickets today at: RNB3.eventbrite.com (Early bird tickets are on sale until April 3rd, so get your tickets ASAP because the last show was completely SOLD OUT!)

I look forward to seeing you all there!

(if you own a business and you are interested in sponsor/vendor/giveaway opportunities, please email: lincoln.blades@gmail.com)

225826027578663.description:
Thank you to everyone who came out to Empty The Tanks 2013! 

Please save the date May 24, 2014 

Just in the planning stages - More info to follow soon

Facts...
Approximately 17 dolphin family members are killed for every one dolphin sold (for ~$200,000) to Seaworld, Marineland and all the other Marine Abusement Parks that hold cetaceans captive for our entertainment. 

If there is no demand, there will be no Slaughter.
For the Dolphin Slaughter to end, people actually have to do Nothing! They just have to NOT buy a ticket! 

Dolphins & Whales

•	There are currently 42 orcas being held captive worldwide.

•	At least 136 wild orcas have been taken into captivity from the wild since 1961. 

•	123 of these (or 90.4%) orcas are now dead.

•	Orcas & Dolphins are self aware and have language. 

•	Dolphin calves call their mothers ‘by name’. Dolphin friends call each other by name.

•	Dolphins are altruistic. They will not leave a family member in distress and have often rescued humans and other predator species

•	Scientists say that due to their high intelligence and complex social structure, dolphins should be designated as non-human persons with rights 

•	In the wild, Orcas live as long or longer than humans
              In captivity, their lives are cut toless than half that.

•	Dolphins live 25-50 years in the wild, but only average 5 yrs. in captivity

•	Dolphin sons never leave their mother’s side their entire lives
•	Orca offspring never leave their mothers side their entire lives.  

•	Approximately 1,000 Dolphins are inhumanely slaughtered in Taiji every year.

•	Of those, 250 are selected for captivity. The rest will be butchered for their meat which is extremely toxic with mercury.

•	Captive Dolphins sell for $150,000 or more to Seaquariums making this at least a $40 million per year business for Taiji. 

•	53% of captured dolphins will die within 3 months of confinement.


•	Food is withheld from Orcas & Dolphins to ensure they perform

•	Many are on medications their whole lives

•	Orcas & Dolphins are forced to inbreed. Mothers often reject captive born babies bred from close relatives.
•	Wild Orcas swim up to 100 miles/day
•	Wild dolphins swim up to 40 miles/day

It would take 5,000 endless circles per day to swim that far in a tank


From September 1st, 2012  -  Feb. 25, 2013:

	1,486 dolphins were driven into the cove in Taiji, Japan. 

o	899 were killed
o	247 were live-capture.

o	340  survivors were released

o	Dolphin meat sold as food is highly toxic with mercury

	
Dolphins struggle in pain and terror while they are bludgeoned, stabbed, suffocated and sliced open, still alive.  It is NOT a quick death. Family members stuggle to rescue their loved ones until it’s their turn.  
Those selected for captivity swim in their family's blood watching the horror. 
Still in shock, captive dolphins are trained by starvation to do tricks for food. 

Captive dolphins who would swim 40 miles per day in the wild, hunting fresh fish are confined to a tiny chlorinated pool & fed dead fish, destined to entertain or ‘swim with’ humans to survive, never seeing their pod again.  
Dolphin Sonar, a useful tool in the wild, disorients them as it bounces off the concrete pool walls. It’s like living in a hall of mirrors.

They become neurotic and depressed and agressively frustrated.

3 trainers have been killed by Orcas so far and numerous attacks have been recorded.

Dolphins in captivity die from capture shock, pneumonia, intestinal disease, ulcers, chlorine poisoning, and other stress-related illnesses. To the captive dolphin industry, these facts are accepted as routine operating expenses.

The only way to learn about dolphin habits is in the wild. They don't have any natural habits in captivity.

Everytime someone buys a ticket to a marine abusement park, they support the slaughter of these family-oriented, sentient beings.


The only way to close their doors for good is to get the general public to stop buying tickets. We need your voice, your posters, and your dedication to seeing an end to the captivity industry.

 EMPTY THE TANKS!

**Please only RSVP to the events you are going to attend and contact the email below if you are interested in holding a Empty the Tanks protest in your town!!!! Let's make this huge!


The main page with links to each city :  https://www.facebook.com/events/589482841111412/?fref=ts
225826027578663.name: EMPTY THE TANKS TORONTO 2014

226956234167975.description:
GOT WHAT IT TAKES TO WIN A GAME ABOUT TORONTO?
You Could Be the Champ of TradeCity!

On April 1st 2014, TradeCity: Toronto beta will launch a live reality augmented game.  Visit tradecitygame.com for details on how to register for your chance to be the Champ of TradeCity.

TradeCity: Toronto beta is a live reality game that takes place from April 1st to 12th 2014, throughout Metro Toronto. TradeCity is an experimental art project by Toronto-based artist Golboo Amani.  Amani has partnered up with various co-operative communities to design an exciting game that is both fun and challenging!

TradeCity:Toronto is an adventure based game that explores Toronto by asking Players to compete in site-specific as well as virtual challenges. There are dozens of chances to win prizes by demonstrating your gaming skills!  

To play you must register in person on April 1, 2014 from 7pm to 9pm at TradeCity: Toronto beta Headquarters, University of Toronto Art Centre, 15 King's College Circle. Players can register as a team or as individual players. You must be 18 years or older to play. Registration is FREE! For more information visit tradecitygame.com.



Golboo Amani is an interdisciplinary artist who creates projects that focus on concepts of community that blur the boundaries between art and life. Amani's work often deals with alternative and sustainable forms of “currency” and exchange.  Past projects have included developing sites for generous skill sharing and empowered acts of reclamation. Amani is best known for her public performance work 'The School of Bartered Knowledge' where she offers 'fair-trade' exchanges of knowledge with passersby. 

“Amani's social interface gently pushes aside the anonymity of the internet in favour of a refreshingly direct and open-ended exchange of information.” DAVID JAGER Now Magazine

This year the artist has taken on a large scale project that brings together various communities, co-operative spaces and local residents in a fun and adventurous way.
226956234167975.name: TRADECITY: TORONTO beta - !PLAYER REGISTRATION DAY!

Join the steering committee and members of the editorial board for a Call for Papers and launch reception. Everyone is welcome and refreshments will be served.

Drop by for some Beer-reviewed Pub Libation! (Thanks, Tyler!)

So what's a tweetup anyway? It's a chance to meet in real life a bunch of people you know only by their Twitter profile picture. And to meet a bunch of new people too! Everyone with an interest in science and technology on the web are welcome to attend: scientists, engineers, developers, science communicators, students, journalists, librarians, advocates and everybody else.

No agenda, no action points, just socializing.

Please feel free to invite more people both on and off Facebook. And no need to sign up here in order to show up. I just use the attending number here to make an estimate for the Duke reservation.

227874374072764.description:
Ребята, привет!

Начиная с января у нас регулярно начал проходить богословский кружок для молодёжи. Мы читаем разные церковные книги, в том числе и Евангелие, Святых Отцов и ведём дискуссии на разные темы, в том числе о значении прочитанного, о его смысле, о том как это применяется и связано с современной жизнью. Также, после этой части, можно побеседовать и провести дискуссию на любую интересующую вас тему с отцом Вячеславом.

Следующая встреча состоится 1-го мая в 6.30 вечера в зале столовой Свято-Троицкого Храма по адресу 23 Henry Street. (Зайдя на территорию Храма, заходите в самую правую, т.е. южную, дверь и спускайтесь по лестнице вниз). У нас также будет краткий молебен. 

Мы также заодно проведём небольшие посиделки!) Накроем общий стол - каждый приносите с собой что-то перекусить и напитки.

Чтобы принять участие, НЕ обязательно быть прихожанином нашего Свято-Троицкого Храма. Приходите и приглашайте своих друзей и знакомых, которым это может быть интересно.;)

У нас есть прекрасная новость, начиная с 24-го апреля, наш кружок становится еженедельным! :)
227874374072764.name: Молодёжный Богословский Кружок - 1-го мая!

For the second year, MATSURI will return to Toronto’s Yonge-Dundas Square! With live music and dance performances, a market featuring the best of Toronto’s Japanese food, and new this year, a fashion show, we are excited to present the 2nd Toronto Japanese Summer Festival in the heart of the city.

The Toronto Japanese Summer Festival is an exploration of Japanese and Japanese-Canadian community, and a celebration of Japan, its culture, art, cuisine and quality of life through its products and services.

Hoping to attract even more than the over 20,000 guests of 2013, the 2nd Toronto Japanese Summer Festival will be bringing back the popular taiko drumming, yosakoi dance, Japanese folk music and geisha models!

The Festival is open to the public and free for everyone. Here is who you can expect to see at MATSURI 2014:

235163236676598.description:
EVENT IS POSTPONED UNTIL OCTOBER 3-5! 

Please read announcement here:

https://www.facebook.com/ADInitiative/posts/611462922277944

The Arab Development Initiative Conference is here again! Also known as EAS'14 "Envision Arabia Summit"

The Arab Development Initiative (ADI) is a registered non-profit organization whose mission is to encourage youth to direct their knowledge, skills, and resources towards addressing and creatively solving the vast array of development challenges facing the Arab World. A group of passionate.          and dedicated young professionals, we aim to establish the ADI as an intermediary between youth and organizations working in development across the region. 

The theme of the event this year is ‘Development Starts from Within’. After witnessing many significant changes in the Middle East, we realized that people have generally become discouraged, be it with their governments, their people, or themselves. However, many of these people don't realize their own potential and how much they could do to really "be the change they wish to see in the world". This is why we decided to focus on the self this year. By taking part in decorum debates and coming together to work on personal development, by focusing on topics such as the psychology of maximizing individual intellectual performance and intrinsic motivation, we can personally tackle the problems that face our societies and be true agents of change. 
 
-------------------------------------------
When? Oct 3-5th 

Summit Schedule:
http://www.arabdevelopment.com/content/summit-schedule-0

Our ambassadors for the ADI conference 2014 are:

Wafic El-Assi-University of Toronto 
Aya Dama-Western University (London)

Mariam Hamaoui-York University

237657533106403.description:
Johnny Coull is kicking off his cross-country tour with a set at The Central on the evening of Friday, April 25th. He'll be playing tunes off of his new album, City on the Hill.

You're invited to come out and enjoy this evening of piano rock and cheap beer. 

The show starts promptly at 7:30pm. For more info on the venue, check out http://www.thecentralbar.ca/

For more on Johnny, check out http://www.johnnycoull.com/

No admission! A hat will be passed.

___

BIO:

Johnny Coull is an independent singer-songwriter from Montreal, Canada. A seasoned pianist and vocalist, he’s worked in a range of styles and has performed extensively on the East Coast. His debut album, City on the Hill, was released in November 2013.

Stylistically, Coull has been described as “a singer-songwriter and a first-rate storyteller with a sound somewhere between Bruce Springsteen and Billy Joel […]”, and in live performance has been lauded as “a veteran pianist, […] skilled at showing off his virtuosity and his voice.”

His songs are classic Americana: punchy melodies and bluesy bursts of improvisation, with darkly humored stories that explore the loss of our innocence, the instability of our dreams, and the frantic desperation that draws us on in a life that only sometimes delivers what it promises.

Coull is touring across Canada during the spring of 2014.
237657533106403.name: Johnny Coull LIVE in Toronto @ The Central

243108649206400.description:
Join the protest against musicians who support Putin's annexation of Crimea!

Maestro Spivakov supports Putin's aggression! He is not welcome in Toronto! Shame on him!

Summary of current events in Ukraine and Crimea and Spivakov's role in them (version in Russian below):

Between February 28 and March 4, 2014, Russian forces seized government buildings in Crimea [1] and blockaded an airport [2], Ukrainian army bases [3], and a Ukrainian missile and air defence unit [4]. Despite claims by the Russian government that these operations were undertaken by local militias, there is overwhelming evidence that these were members of the Russian military and special forces [1,5,6]. Amidst this occupation on February 28, while the Crimean Parliament building was occupied by pro-Russian militia [7], a group of pro-Russian politicians formed a coalition and claimed authority over the Crimean peninsula [7], scheduling a referendum for March 25 (later moved to March 16) on the question of seceding from Ukraine and joining the Russian Federation [7], simultaneously appealing to Putin for help [8]. On the same day in Moscow, Russian legislators presented a bill to facilitate annexation of new territories [9].

On March 11, five days before the Crimean referendum, newspaper Izvestia published a letter that expressed "full support of the position of the president of Russian Federation on Ukraine and Crimea"[10]. The letter was signed by dozens of influential cultural figures, including Maestro Vladimir Spivakov. In signing this letter, Maestro Spivakov and the other signatories of this letter endorsed President Putin's aggression in Ukraine, his infringement of international law, his violation of Ukraine's sovereignty, and the continued violence perpetrated on the nation of Ukraine by the special forces and military troops occupying the Crimean peninsula. He has pledged his support to an administration that has put forward an illegal referendum [11] announced merely two weeks in advance of the voting date, held despite a lack of proper monitoring by third-party institutions [12, 13, 14]. Maestro Spivakov has declared himself to be on the side of the aggressor and not the victims of aggression; he has endorsed a regime whose actions have led to ongoing military escalation in Eastern Ukraine [15].

The letter was published with the intent of forestalling substantial backlash against Putin's regime, in the hopes that a demonstration of support from internationally renowned figures such as Maestro Spivakov, Denis Matsuev, Valery Gergiev, Yuri Bashmet, etc. would sway public opinion and invalidate the concerns of Putin's critics [16]. We believe that Maestro Spivakov, as well as his fellow signatories, should be held accountable for the irresponsible misuse of their influence in the world of art and culture to enable President Putin's belligerent tactics.

In light of the aforementioned facts, we demand as responsible citizens the following:

1) that Vladimir Spivakov immediately apologize and withdraw his name from the list of figures in support of President Putin's policies

2) if no such apology is issued, that the upcoming tour of Maestro Spivakov and the Moscow Virtuosi Chamber [17] be cancelled.

We call to boycott Maestro Spivakov's concert, and if no such cancellation occurs, we invite you to join us on May 9 to publicly protest Maestro Spivakov and the repressive regime he supports.

1. Russian special forces take seize government buildings, Ukrainian military bases http://vk.com/video195107477_168450408?hash=e3e8bb47db3bad0d
2. Crimean airports occupied by pro-Russian militia: http://www.bbc.com/news/world-europe-26379722
3. Pro Russian forces surround Crimea base: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=hzQjZMwxp28
4. Russian forces try to seize anti-aircraft missile base in Ukraine's Crimea - Interfax http://www.reuters.com/article/2014/03/01/us-ukraine-crisis-russian-anti-aircraft-idUSBREA2007M20140301
5. 3 lines of evidence that the Russian army is blocking Ukrainian military units: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=vnpUmoUVPAM
6. http://articles.latimes.com/2014/mar/04/world/la-fg-wn-local-forces-crimea-russian-military-20140304
7. With gunmen controlling the building, Crimea's parliament voted to hold a referendum on the region's status on 25 May http://www.theguardian.com/world/2014/feb/24/ukraine-crimea-russia-secession
8. Crimea crisis: pro-Russian leader appeals to Putin for help http://www.theguardian.com/world/2014/feb/28/barack-obama-vladimir-putin-ukraine-russia
9. Russian Legislators Present Bill to Facilitate Annexation of Ukrainian Crimea http://www.breitbart.com/Big-Peace/2014/02/28/Ukraine-Turmoil-Russian-Legislators-Present-Bill-To-Facilitate-Annexation-Of-Crimea

- Full list on the Russian Ministry of Culture website (in Russian): http://mkrf.ru/press-tsentr/novosti/ministerstvo/deyateli-kultury-rossii-v-podderzhku-pozitsii-prezidenta-po-ukraine-i-krymu

Между 28 февраля и 4 марта, 2014 года, российские военные силы захватили правительственные здания в Крыму [1] и заблокировали аэропорт [2], украинские воинские части [3] и украинскую зенитно-ракетную часть [4]. Несмотря на заявления правительства России, что эти операции проведены местными силами самообороны, существуют убедительные доказательства, что это были члены российских военных сил или спецназа [1,5,6]. 28 февраля, пока здание Крымского Парламента было оккупировано вооружёнными сепаратистами [7], группа про-российских политиков создала коалицию и провозгласила власть над Крымским полуостровом [7], назначив референдум об отделении от Украины и присоединении к Российской Федерации на 25 марта (позже перенесённый на 16 марта) [7], одновременно взывая к Путину о помощи [8]. В тот же день в Москве, российские законодатели вынесли на рассмотрение закон, формально упрощающий аннексию новых территорий [9].

11 марта, за 5 дней до крымского референдума, газета Известия опубликовала письмо, заявляющее о "твёрдой поддержке позиции Президента Российской Федерации по Украине и Крыму" [10]. Письмо было подписано десятками влиятельных деятелей культуры, включая Маэстро Владимира Спивакова. Подписав это письмо, Маэстро Спиваков и другие, подписавшие это письмо, одобрили агрессию Президента Путина на Украине, его попрание международных законов, его нарушение территориальной целостности Украины и продолжающиеся беспорядки на территории Украины, совершаемые российскими вооружёнными силами. Спиваков гарантировал свою поддержку администрации, которая провела незаконный референдум [11], объявленный лишь за две недели до даты голосования, проведённый, несмотря на отсутствие должного контроля независимыми наблюдателями [12,13,14]. Маэстро Спиваков выбрал сторону агрессора, а не жертвы агрессии; он поддержал режим, действия которого привели к продолжающейся военной эскалации в Восточной Украине [15].

Письмо было опубликовано с целью предупредить значительный протест против путинского режима, с надеждой, что заявления о поддержке от таких всемирно известных личностей, как Маэстро Спиваков, Денис Мацуев, Валерий Гергиев, Юрий Башмет, и т. д. повлияет на общественное мнение и сведёт на нет возражения критиков Путина [16]. Мы считаем, что Маэстро Спиваков, а так же другие, подписавшие позорное письмо, должны стоять в ответе за безответственное злоупотребление своим влиянием в культурном мире, дающее возможность продолжения путинской агрессии и путинских репрессий.

В свете вышеперечисленных фактов, как ответственные граждане, мы требуем, чтобы:

1) Владимир Спиваков немедленно извинился и отозвал свою подпись из списка деятелей культуры, поддерживающих политику Путина по Украине и Крыму.
2) в случае, если таких извинений не поступит, мы требуем отменить предстоящие гастроли Маэстро Спивакова и камерного оркестра "Виртуозы Москвы" [17].

Мы призываем к бойкоту концертов Маэстро Спивакова, а в случае, если гастроли не будут отменены, мы приглашаем вас присоединиться к нам 9 мая на открытый протест против Маэстро Спивакова и репрессивного режима, который он поддерживает.

246650512185123.description:
The future of Toronto’s urban landscape has long been the subject of intense public debate and is quickly turning into the hot-button issue of the upcoming mayoral election. As we consider how we want to shape the city through changes to its built environment, we need also consider the impact of these changes on our acoustic environment—or soundscape, a term coined by Canadian composer R. Murray Schafer to describe the particular combination of sounds in a given place, including natural sounds, animal sounds, human sounds, and mechanical sounds. In Schafer’s view, soundscape is as significant as landscape to one’s experience of a place, and the acoustic environment can become polluted just like the natural environment and with equally serious consequences for physical and mental health.

Drawing on these ideas, this walk considers the relationship between Toronto’s built and acoustic environments by exploring the impact of planned and present building and infrastructure projects on noise pollution in Toronto, both in their construction phase and upon completion. We also examine the noise control and regulation strategies currently in place and ask what other strategies can be used to minimize noise pollution or the impact of that noise. In particular, we focus on the projected noise impact of developments along the waterfront, including the Gardiner Expressway and Toronto Island Airport.

The walk begins at the Pavilion Stage of the Toronto Music Garden and ends at the foot of Bathurst Street, across from the Toronto Island Airport.

Presented by Erin Scheffer and Melissa Wong. This event is part of Jane's Walk Toronto 2014.

http://www.janeswalk.org/canada/toronto/all-quiet-waterfront-noise-pollution-and-urban-development-toronto/
246650512185123.name: All Quiet on the Waterfront: Noise Pollution and Urban Development in Toronto

248598888645541.description:
Update: Here's the Civic Champions that we've announced so far that will be there: Evergreen, CivicAction, City Youth Council of Toronto, Mayoral Candidates John Tory, Robb Johannes and Morgan Baskin, Groundforce Digital, Jane's Walk, Women in Toronto Politics, UforChange, NoJetsTO, TTC Riders, RaBIT, Cycle Toronto, The City of Toronto, Pathways to Education - Regent Park, Coalition of Youth Councils, Park People, Hivewire, GenSqueeze, Chrystia Freeland Liberal MPP, RiseEdutainment, 100 in 1 Day, Daniels Spectrum, Youth Empowering Parents, Regent Park Focus, Better Budget TO, Open Streets, Toronto Seed Library, Faith in Regent Park, Daniels’ Learning Centre, Shape My City, Green Ribbon, Imagine Cities, Youth Health Action Network , Regent Park Food Partnership Committee and Greenthumbs. 

----

On April 10th, we're going to host a civic engagement fair - imagine grassroots community meets the job fair model - so that we can all learn about how to get involved in our city from civic leaders/advocacy groups/other citizens/etc. 

It's called Turnout Toronto! 

This will be our second TT, the first one was held at CSI Annex in January and was attended by +500 folks and +50 plus civic champions for them to meet, learn from and support. 

The purpose of Turnout Toronto is to educate on the opportunities to get involved (e.g. working on a political campaign, volunteer with elections Toronto, become a member of Better Budget TO, etc), which hopefully leads to things like higher voter turnout, civic participation and love for TO. We can debate five ways to Sunday on what the city needs but we'd all agree that you can never have enough love. 

If you've felt the urge to take action, especially leading up to the fall civic elections, consider this a starting point to learn about the options on what type of action you can take. 

And if you'd like to share your project with the crowd to rally support and inspire, drop one of the event organizers a line and we'll take it from there.

249977975189126.description:
Bill C-23, the ironically named “Fair Elections” Act is a bill that will dangerously change how, and if, some Canadians can participate in our democracy. If passed, this act will see US style voter suppression imposed on Canadians and is clearly targeted youth and students, poor people, seniors, Aboriginal people and other marginalized groups. 

The “Fair Elections Act” eliminates key provisions of our current election system – including vouching and voter ID cards – which could deprive as many as 520,000 Canadians of their right to vote. The Act will also muzzle Elections Canada, cancelling voter education and engagement programs like Student Vote.

A day of action is planned for Saturday, April 26, 2014. In Toronto, a rally is being organized at Yonge-Dundas Square at 1pm. 

Other events and actions are taking place across the country. Learn more at letpeoplevote.ca 

This event is being organized by a coalition of groups including the Canadian Federation of Students-Ontario and the Council of Canadians. To add your organization's name, contact action@cfsontario.ca 

For more information or to get involved, contact action@cfsontario.ca
249977975189126.name: Toronto Rally Against the Unfair Elections Act

Momentum Dance Toronto presents: 

OFF CANVAS
 ~ art.  inspired. ~

APRIL 23 - 26, 2014

LOCATION: Winchester Street Theatre
80 Winchester Street, Toronto

Can you imagine our world without the arts?  Indeed, art plays a vital role in making our lives infinitely rich.  No matter the art form, artistic expression is a window into the soul of another and can be the voice of human experience.  In this year's fourth annual production, Momentum Dance Toronto challenged choreographers to seek inspiration from some of the world's most accomplished visual artists, and to explore what happens with space and movement when in relation to paint on a canvas.  We hope to demonstrate how varied interpretations of art can highlight and inspire the individual artist within us all.

Momentum Dance Toronto invites you to attend one of our five shows - to sit back, relax and be inspired by ART and its many canvases.

"Alternatingly delicate and brutal." 
-The Hollywood Reporter 

"A moving and unflinching character study"
-CriterionCast

"What a little gem of a film It's Only Make Believe is."
-Letterboxd.com

After serving 10 years in prison for murder, Jenny returns to society. She dreams of living a quiet life and of resuming her responsibilities as a mother, but soon dark shadows from the past start to appear. "It's Only Make Believe" is the story of a murder that never should have happened, of friends that never should have been trusted, and a debt that keeps on increasing for every down payment. Although Jenny has lost everything, she still has everything to win: her daughter. "It's Only Make Believe" is an exciting thriller and a heartfelt drama that marks a return to energetic and passionate filmmaking for Norwegian maverick director Arild Østin Ommundsen.

Opens June 6th at Toronto's Carlton and Kingsway Cinemas.

257799344380308.description:
The University of Toronto Refugee Alliance invites you to our annual charity fundraiser! (For tickets visit http://www.utrafundraiser.eventbee.com)

Please join us for dinner, music, art, and drinks on March 19 as we strive to do our bit for the plight facing refugees around the world. All proceeds from the event will be directed to the Syrian refugee crisis, through the Red Crescent (Red Cross), as well as to the Scarborough Community Volunteer Clinic, in keeping with our tradition of contributing locally.

This is a great opportunity to network with like-minded individuals to discuss and raise awareness about the innumerable problems encountered, both while seeking refuge and in host countries, by increasing refugee populations. More importantly, the perfect opportunity for all of us to help make a difference for the lives of refugees. We hope to see you there!

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=2Xiaq5dilRg


Student tickets: $30
General tickets: $40
Tickets can be purchased from:
http://www.utrafundraiser.eventbee.com

If you are not able to attend this event but still want to contribute, you can make a donation at the link above as well.


Guest Speakers:

Rima Kamal has been a delegate with the International Committee of the Red Cross for over 7 years. Her ICRC missions included Syria, Iraq, Jerusalem and Jordan.  During this time, she was a protection delegate working to uphold the rights of detainees and document violations of International Humanitarian Law. More recently, she was ICRC's spokesperson and head of its communication department in Syria. Previously, she worked as a consular officer for the Swedish Ministry of Foreign Affairs (2004-2006) in Jerusalem and Los Angeles. She holds an M.A. in Political Science from the University of Gothenburg in Sweden.

Dr. Paul Caulford is the Medical Director of the Scarborough Community Volunteer Clinic for medically uninsured immigrants and refugees. He is the Lead Physician and President of the Scarborough Academic Family Health Team in Toronto and is also an Assistant Professor in the Department of Family and Community Medicine at the University of Toronto. 
Read more about his work and findings here:
http://www.cfp.ca/content/58/7/725.full#corresp-1
http://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC3681469/


Where the money is going:

1. In 2011, a civil war broke out in Syria. Since then, there have been approximately 2.5 million Syrian refugees. The UN estimates that there will be more than 5 million Syrian refugees by the end of 2014. Red Crescent works to build secure refugee camps for the Syrian refugees inside and out of the country's borders. Essential needs, such as shelter and field hospitals, are provided for the refugees through Red Crescent.

2. In Canada, thousands of refugees and immigrants arrive and are denied basic and urgent healthcare. After being exposed to and escaping war and oppression, thousands of Canada's newcomers find themselves once again facing hurdles- within our healthcare system. Scarborough Community Volunteer Clinic provides free primary healthcare for medically uninsured refugees and immigrants in Canada.
257799344380308.name: University of Toronto Refugee Alliance Fundraiser

259126587600824.description:
We are pleased to invite you to the Toronto premiere of Ashid Bahl's film "For the Love of Children", winner of BEST PICTURE and BEST FEATURE DOCUMENTARY at the Monaco International Film Festival in December of 2013.
 
7:00-8:00 PM: Meet & Greet 
8:00 PM SHARP: FILM STARTS
9:00 PM: Q & A with Director Ashid Bahl, Raffle draw!

INBOX ME TO RESERVE TICKETS- Admission is $30.00.
All proceeds of this special screening benefit the victims of Typhoon Haiyan in the Philippines.
 
SYNOPSIS:
The film follows the journey of the courageous Ashid Bahl, considered by many to be a Saint and Hero, as he overcomes numerous challenges building schools, orphanages, creating sustainable living conditions for communities and delivering much needed care to children all over the world, while inspiring others to do the same by his example of selfess service, love and compassion.

About For the Love of Children Society:
This year marks the 33rd anniversary of Ashid Bahl’s aid work with For the Love of Children Society, providing millions of dollars of aid in supplies, support and man power to build stable orphanages and schools, and deliver medicine and healing methods that would otherwise be unavailable.
Bahl and his team have been at the front line of over a dozen torn and devastated countries including Lebanon, Sudan, Afghanistan, Haiti, Colombia, Peru, Sri Lanka and Japan. Run entirely by volunteers and charitable donations, the organization has built 76 schools and touched the lives of over 100,000 children to date.
Ashid and the Society have received recognition and praise from community leaders including the Prime Minister of Canada Stephen Harper, His Holiness the 14th Dalai Lama, Her Majesty Queen of Elizabeth II and humanitarian Angelina Jolie.

We thank-you for your support behind this amazing cause and look forward to seeing you at the Premiere!

"Life is not about us; life is about making it happen for someone else who is less fortunate. In that lies the true significance of living."
- Ashid Bahl, Director
259126587600824.name: "For the Love of Children" Toronto Film Premiere

261046917390452.description:
Virtuóz Világzene Középeurópából
CimBalogh Trio - Balogh Kálmán Cimbalom trio Budapestről

(info in English see below)
Balogh Kálmán a világ egyik leglismertebb cimbalomművésze,  aki híres Magyar cigányzenész családból származik. A Liszt Ferenc Zeneművészeti Egyetemen diplomázott, és most az egyetem tanára. A világ sok országában szerepelt és több mint egy tucat sikeres koncert turnén vett részt Észak Amerikában. Több világhírű zenekar vendégművésze volt az USAban, mint pl. a Philadelphia Orchestra, Portland Symphony, New World Symphony, Brooklyn Philharmonic és más zenekarok. Habár Kálmán a Magyar népzenén nevelkedett,  egyformán otthon van a balkán népzenében és a jazz világában, valamint a klezmer zenében. A mostani turnén, kitünő zenészbarátaival, világzenét játszik, ami a jazz és a népzene fúziója – állandó izgalmas, friss, újstílusú improvizáció.
 
 Március 25, kedd este 7 óra/ March 25, Tuesday 7pm
Parameter Klub,  695 Coxwell Ave. Toronto, 6. emelet klubszoba
(Coxwell-Danforth  •  2 percnyire a Coxwell metró megállótól)
A büfében: kávé-tea,  üdítő és pogácsa
jegyrendelés/tickets and  info: 416-693-8312
jegyek előrendelve /pre-ordered: $25,     
az ajtónál/at the door: $30


Central European World Music
Kálmán Balogh Cimbalom Trio from Hungary
Kálmán Balogh is one of the foremost Hungarian cimbalom players, descending from a famous dynasty of Hungarian Gypsy musicians. His virtuosity is matched only by his understanding and respect of his heritage. A graduate of Ferenc Liszt Academy of Music of Budapest, he has completed many successful tours throughout the world with various ensembles, including well over a dozen tours in North America. The cimbalom, a sort of oversized hammer dulcimer played with mallets like a vibraphone, possesses piano like percussive abilities to drive a band rhythmically or take the melodic lead. In Kálmán Balogh's expert hands, the cimbalom can do both simultaneously. His mastery of this unique and rare Hungarian folk instrument has mesmerized audiences.
Kálmán Balogh Gypsy Cimbalom Trio is the dynamic merging of music from the old and new worlds. Balogh continues a fabled European musical tradition harking back to the collaboration of masters like gypsy guitarist Django Reinhardt and violinist Stephane Grappelli, connecting ancient folk music traditions of Central and Eastern Europe with the chord progressions and swinging rhythm of jazz. Balogh's cimbalom becomes a new and compelling voice centering the Trio, which is enhanced by acoustic violin/viola and acoustic bass. Similarities in jazz and traditional folk music, such as improvisation and a kaleidoscope of emotional expressions, are immediately evident.
The Trio includes excellent musicians who have worked with Balogh extensively. Robert Lakatos, a viola and violin player from Slovakia, is steeped in classical music training and played with important classical orchestras, but always gravitated toward folk and world music. He plays in several groups ranging from classical to folk and jazz genres. Robert’s band, the RÉV, has become a popular band in Hungary and Slovakia. Bassist Csaba Novák is one of the most versatile bass players in Hungary, familiar with gypsy style, klezmer, folk music, jazz and world music.
Melodies polished in European villages for centuries are interpreted with great respect and understanding by trio, enabling present day music lovers to experience the emotions and beauty inherent in the music of our ancestors. Kálmán Balogh Cimbalom Trio brings a contemporary and uniquely forward-looking edge to time-honored traditions, leaving audiences enthralled and inspired.
261046917390452.name: Cimbalogh Trio Toronto concert

262611770575371.description:
Montreal writer Anna Leventhal launches her first book, Sweet Affliction, a collection of fifteen short stories that is by turns caustic, tender, and darkly funny. A short reading by the author will be followed by a conversation with Pasha Malla, author of People Park and The Withdrawal Method.

A pregnancy test is taken at a wedding, a bad diagnosis leads a patient to a surprising outlook, and a civic holiday becomes a dystopian nightmare. By turns caustic, tender, and creepily hilarious, Sweet Affliction reveals the frailties, perversions, and resilience of Anna Leventhal’s cast of city-dwellers. 

"Leventhal’s work grasps multiple and brazen connections between sisters, lovers, strangers, friends. These stories wander and please. They knife unexpectedly. Truth is lodged in all the cuts. These stories 'know the things energy can do.'"

Tamara Faith Berger, author of Maidenhead

"Sweet Affliction is — no big deal or anything — one of the most successful, high-functioning, sometimes perfect collections of short stories I’ve read in recent memory."

Andrew Hood, author of The Cloaca

"These stories stand Canadian literature on its head — amazing characters, totally original and unexpected situations, absolutely hilarious and heartfelt prose — Anna Leventhal is a one-of-a-kind talent."

Lee Henderson, author of The Man Game
262611770575371.name: Anna Leventhal launches Sweet Affliction in Toronto

Come out and participate in our largest event, and Toronto's largest annual scavenger hunt! 

Every year we work very hard to create the single best scavenger hunt out there, and this is our fifth year doing it. We are incredibly excited to see this years event take place! Please help us spread the word, as the more people who come out, the more fun this event is!

The Details:

When: Saturday, May 3rd from 1:00 PM - 5:00PM
Where: Nathan Phillips Square
What to bring: A backpack, a metro-pass/day-pass, something to take digital pictures with, and about $10 for certain tasks.
Wear: Comfortable clothing, and running shoes. Additionally we will be awarding a prize for the best team costume this year!

Prizes:
Prizes are still to be announced. There will be prizes for the first place team, AND for the best team costume!

**Please contact us if any individuals or companies would like to support us by offering up prizes/sponsoring the event. It is a free event, so prizes/donations really are appreciated: improvintoronto@gmail.com

How The Events Works:

We will be meeting up at Nathan Phillips Square (north side of skating rink) at 1pm. Feel free to be early. Don't be late!

We will be creating teams of 6-8 people, each with their own team name. If you come alone, we’ll be sure to find you a group, and if you come with friends, don’t worry you can stay with them! Groups can be smaller than 6 (if people want), but no bigger then 8.

The scavenger lists will then be handed out, as well as posted online. The list will contain tons of activities found throughout the downtown core. You will be tasked to complete challenges, find obscure items, solve puzzles, find answers, and take silly pictures. Some will be easy, and others will be quite challenging

You will have a max of two hours to search. With bonus points awarded if you return early. We will be meeting back up at Nathan Phillips Square to tally the points.

Let the scavenge begin!
#ITScavenger

--------------------------------------------------

We are always in desperate need of volunteers! Over the years we have cut down the wait time for teams to be judged dramatically, thanks in large part to volunteer support. If you are interested, please email improvintoronto@gmail.com

This event is brought to you by Improv in Toronto: http://improvintoronto.com/
263398463831488.name: Toronto Scavenger Hunt 2014

266725900153340.description:
Dora Award-Winning Keystone Theatre proudly presents The Last Man on Earth – an original silent film style play about The Devil, love, innocence and pies. Directed by Ginette Mohr with music composition and live accompaniment by David Atkinson, this charming and bittersweet tale sees an evil villain and his minion plotting to corrupt the last vestige of innocence on earth. Underdog Gormless Joe must choose to play the hero or lose everything, including his one chance at love with Penelope the pie seller. 

The Last Man on Earth opens Thursday, April 3 and runs to April 13 (with a preview on April 2) at The Berkeley Street Theatre Upstairs. Tickets are $25 (ask about discount offers and PWYC performances) and are available by calling 416-368-3110 or by visiting www.canadianstage.com

Performed by:

Phil Rickaby, Dana Fradkin, Sarah Joy Bennett; Stephen LaFrenie & David Atkinson 

Creative Team:

Director: Ginette Mohr
Designer: Kimberly Beaune 
Lighting Designer: David Fox-Procenko 
Fight Director: Matt Richardson 
Music Director: David Atkinson 
Stage Manager: Kimberly Beaune 

Keystone Theatre creates, develops and presents new performances inspired by the silent film era. Reaching back to the earliest recorded work of the masters of the art of acting, Keystone Theatre reinvents performance styles that are universally accessible and visually profound. Using our unique physical vocabulary to create characters and develop narratives, Keystone Theatre explores performance styles in multiple media, including theatre, film and music, sometimes all at once.

www.keystonetheatre.net
266725900153340.name: The Last Man on Earth Comes to Toronto

269372993238354.description:
**Join us for the Toronto premiere of SILENCE IS GOLD, a film that explores the state of free-speech in a corporate dominated world. This screening is co-presented with the NFB - National Film Board of Canada, MiningInjustice Solidarity Network,  protestbarrick.net and Point of View Magazine. Sakura Saunders and guest speakers will be in attendance.

SILENCE IS GOLD
Julien Fréchette / Canada / 2012 / 77 ' / French / S.T. English

What are the limits to freedom of speech? Can we put a price on our spoken and written words? Following the 2008 release of the book Noir Canada, author Alain Deneault, his co-writers and his publisher, Éditions Écosociété, grappled with these questions – at great personal expense – after being sued for defamation in Quebec and Ontario courts by two large Canadian mining companies. Deneault and his publisher fought back, becoming entangled in a seemingly never-ending spiral of judicial proceedings. Silence Is Gold is a thriller of a documentary that tells their story, set against the backdrop of the Canadian justice system. We follow the complex procedural twists and turns, eagerly anticipating a resolution that is repeatedly delayed.

Filmmaker Julien Fréchette’s camera and questions lead us through this little- understood legal territory without judging or wading into the merits of the cases. His gaze is both subtle and attentive as he tactfully immerses himself in the story, initiating a dialogue with Alain Deneault, who becomes the protagonist of the film. Silence Is Gold raises crucial questions about Canada’s role and responsibilities in the global mining sector, the limits of free speech and equitable access to the Canadian justice system.

cinemapolitica.org/bloor
269372993238354.name: SILENCE IS GOLD - Toronto premiere with special guests
