519405108170500.description:
Toronto Ravel is a score study group led by John Herberman. April's study features special guests: Asher Ettinger, Dr Lee Bartel, and Ron Jones (via skype from LA)!

How do we ‘hear’ music?  How does music convey emotion and how does the brain process musical emotion? What are some of the neural pathways that we do know about that relate to the perception of music?  How is hearing music different from imagining music? The answer will definitely surprise you! “Music and The Brain”... 

APRIL SPECIAL GUESTS:
- Asher Ettinger is a composer and artist, and partner in Think Music. His fascination with music and the brain has led him to read and study much of the current literature, and he will share some of his favourite topics with us. Asher is also a synesthete – someone who hears music in colours. 
- Dr. Lee Bartel is a researcher at the U of T Faculty of Music with a specialty in music and healing in the brain.  
- Ron Jones, originator of the ‘Ravel’ idea, is a composer in L.A., and currently scores “Family Guy” – with a pencil! 

9:30 A.M. – coffee and time to say hello to friends (please plan to arrive by 9:50)
10:00 – 11:00 – score study
11:00 – 12:00 – guest speaker
12:00 noon – light lunch is served, with plenty of time to mingle and converse with our guest

The cost is $22.50 by reservation ($25 at the door) which covers lunch. To reserve, please call Hugh’s Room directly at 416 531-6604, between 12:00 and 7:00 P.M. daily. 

For more information visit www.torontoravel.com

Toronto Ravel isn't just a score study. We are reminded that we are part of an ensemble; the larger collaboration of creators that enhances what we do: musicians, composers, directors, editors... All are welcome! 

See you at Ravel!
519405108170500.name: "Music and The Brain" Toronto Ravel - Tuesday April 15th

519473784840132.description:
Krip-Hop Nation founder, Leroy Moore along with Tangled Art + Disability kick off Canada’s first Krip-Hop event featuring Leroy Moore and Rob Da’ Noize Temple. Headlining the show will be Cleveland Heights’ alternative hip-hop duo Deacon Burns and Kaya Rogue, known to the music industry as KOUNTERCLOCKWISE.  Local Toronto hip-hop artist Rakiem Smith will be making his Toronto debut for this show. 

Krip-Hop Nation:

Krip-Hop Nation is a global movement of hip-hop artists with disabilities, founded by Leroy Moore. Since its inception, the movement has spread across the United States and beyond – from South Africa to New Zealand to Palestine. Krip-Hop is a community as well as style of music, an artistic space where youth with disabilities can speak out and speak back to the social structures that exclude people based on disability, race, sexuality, and a host of other marginalized identities. Krip-Hop Nation also strives to bring the talents of hip-hop artists with disabilities to the attention of a wider public, including media, educators, scholars, and journalists; and has developed a strong global online community to promote and disseminate the work of hip-hop by artists with disabilities.

About the artists:

Leroy F. Moore Jr.:

Your host Leroy F. Moore Jr. is a Black writer, poet, hip-hop/music lover, community activist and feminist with a physical disability. Leroy is Co-founder and Community Relations Director of the Sins Invalid performance project, and is the creator of Krip-Hop Nation.  He is currently writing a Krip-Hop book.

Rob Da’ Noize Temple is a music producer, songwriter, artists and keyboardist, and has been in the music industry for over 40 years. He has been playing keyboards since he was six years old and although he has Erbs Palsy, having just the use of one hand, he has never stopped trying to achieve his dreams.  As part of the group Conway & Temple, Rob was the first artist signed to Jive Records back in 1986 with the labels first single, “Love Lights / You Can Lay Your Head On my Shoulder” becoming a European hit.  He has continued producing music since 1980 as well as performing in live bands. Rob is currently music director, keyboardist and back-up DJ for the pioneers of Hip Hop, Rapper’s Delight featuring Wonder Mike & Master Gee  and  has just completed music production on their newly released documentary, “I Want My Name Back”.

Kounterclockwise:

Deacon Burns (MC, Producer, Songwriter, Musician & Engineer)

In 2007, as the group was courted by several indie & major labels; fate took a wrong turn when Deacon had a tragic accident – breaking 5 vertebrae, several ribs, collapsed both lungs and had a hairline neck fracture. He suffered a severe spinal cord injury that resulted in paralysis of both legs. As a true entertainer, Deacon decided that the show must go on no matter what. He spent his entire recovery time writing songs, accumulating an impressive catalogue of over 150. Deacon is a music aficionado whose influences vary from Nine Inch Nails to Ol’ Dirty Bastard. He plays multiple instruments (guitar, bass, ASR10 and a MPC 2000XL), is a gifted producer & songwriter, and even directs & edits videos.

Kaya Rogue (Co-Producer, Co-Writer, Engineer, Singer & Musician)

New York City’s Kaya Rogue also plays multiple instruments (guitar, bass, and keyboards), is a singer and assists Deacon in both music and video production. An entertaining part of the group’s live show is when the audience dresses up as different characters. Their concerts have been labeled as “visual art”. It’s been a long time coming for Kounterclockwise to release their debut album, “Daylight Savings Time.”

For more information, visit: http://www.kounterclockwise.com/

Join us on March 25th for AB107 at The Great Hall in Toronto!

Last month's all-star celebration was a truly amazing night of creation and community. This month Art Battle Toronto welcomes 16 new-star painters to the easels. We can't wait to share their talent and courage with you!

Featured Artists:

Rosalind Breen
Daniel St Amant
Danilo Ursini
Natasha Dichpan
Rija Ahsan
Colin Davis
Danny Smith
Svetlana Iouchkova
Christine Purdy
Leo Buendia Baduria
Al Konstantinou
Natasha Kudashkina
Spencer aka RANDOM
Han Sol Kim
Susan Qu

Now in more than a dozen cities from coast-to-coast, Art Battle Canada is searching for the best painters from across the country and Toronto is the city that started it all! You decide who wins the title, $200 cash prize and a chance to advance to challenge Vancouver's Yared Nigussu for the National Championship.

On May 10th the whole country will be painting together as we celebrate the first ever Art Battle Day. For more information and our call for local organizers, please visit http://artbattle.ca/abd, inquiries can be made by email to hello@artbattle.ca

Visit us at http://artbattle.com/ for info on all our events and follow on twitter @artbattlecanada

To compete as a painter at Art Battle in Toronto or another city, please visit our application page http://artbattle.ca/register

What is Art Battle?
Art Battle is a live competitive painting event. 16 painters will create the best work they can in 20 minutes. As they work, the audience moves around the easels, allowing them an up close view of the creative process. The medium used is acrylic paint and the tools allowed are brushes, palette knives or any other non-mechanical implements. At the end of the round, the audience votes for their favourite painting and can also later place bids in a silent auction to take the paintings home. This is Art Battle Canada's 5th season!

Art Battle 107
Tuesday, March 25, 2014
The Great Hall, 1087 Queen St W, 7:30pm

Tickets available online and at the door
$20, 15$ limited advance
12-Month Membership passes also available.

Email hello@artbattle.ca with any questions :)

See you on the 25th!
xo
Art Battle

    Spring at last! After taking a bit of a Winter break, we are super excited to see everyone again at our next PechaKucha Night Toronto Vol. 29 on April 1, celebrating all the fools! The lovely folks behind Ladies Learning Code and hackerYou have kindly offered their brand new learning space The Lab for the event. In case you have never heard of PechaKucha, we are a global volunteer-based non-for-profit creative community. There are over 740 cities around the world that run PechaKucha events. PechaKucha Nights, run by local organizers, are informal and fun gatherings where creative people get together and share their ideas, works, thoughts, holiday snaps -- just about anything in the PechaKucha 20x20 format. PechaKucha 20x20 is a simple presentation format where you show 20 images, each for 20 seconds. The images advance automatically and you talk along to the images. Started in Tokyo in 2003, PechaKucha organization has become the largest global creative network. Thanks to our sponsor WeSell ,we are thrilled to have Abokichi once again to create some new and exciting Japanese-inspired snacks. We will be adding new presenter profile on our presenter's list each day. Get your tickets early, we're expecting a full house again!

537345893047927.description:
When: Saturday, March 22, 6pm-12am
Where: 1482 Bathurst St, 4th floor  (NW corner of Bathurst and St.Clair, right by St.Clair West Subway Station)


This August 21st to 24th, a convergence unlike any other will descend upon the capital of the territory known as Canada.  Activists, Students, Indigenous peoples, Unions, Youth, Environmentalists, and thousands of ordinary fed-up individuals from across this land will gather to oppose the current political and economic order and propose a plurality of alternative paths towards a better world.

Join us in Toronto to celebrate the ongoing efforts to build this historic event, connect with people active in the organizing process, register for the forum, share your visions for what will be the largest social movement gathering in recent ‘Canadian’ history, drink and be merry. 

Oh and dance the night away to some incredible live music and DJ sets including:

-Lee Reed, rebel hip-hop pioneer from the Rhymethink Collective
-Rosina Kazi, of experimental global justice electro-soul group LAL
-Tyler Shipley, of the political folk-rock band The Consumer Goods 
-Jay Robi, of indigenous underground Hiphop group INDAGENIUS
-Faith Nolan, heading singalongs of social justice songs 
-SPIN el Poeta, Revolutionary Guatemalan Poetry & hip-hop
-Moyo Mutamba, sharing mbira music
-Mohammad Ali, with his new political rap album  
-Diem Lafortune, soulful radical songs on guitar 
-Zum One, renown Toronto DJ bringing you bass, dub, and dub step
-Eagle Woman Singerz

6-7:30pm: potluck, snacks, mingle, registrations for the forum
7:30-midnight: drinks, short speeches, musical performances, DJ sets, dancing

Accessibility: level floor at entrance, elevators allow for wheelchair access. 

Looking forward to partying with you!

___

Social Forums are spaces for activists, grassroots groups, scholars, and civil society organizations to come together to share knowledge and experience on social justice issues and organizing.

The first Social Forum was held in Porto Alegre, Brazil in 2001 and has since spread around the world as a means for progressive movements and people to connect, develop relationships, build solidarity, and strengthen campaigns and struggles for social, political, and economic change. 

www.peoplessocialforum.org

539842506137264.description:
Hi Everyone,

Just a reminder that Birthing From Within is coming to Toronto to do a training from May 7-9th.

-Early birth and group pricing ends April 7th. 
-20 Contact Hours

What is Birthing From Within?

Birthing From Within offers an incredibly unique perspective on supporting parents that balances practical information (book knowledge) with instinctual knowing.

After this training, you'll have deeply explored your personal relationship with childbirth and gained awareness of how you can separate your own experience with birth from those of your clients. In doing this, you are better equipped to mentor them as they discover what choices feel right for them. The emphasis here is that you're their guide, meant to help them find their own way, not a teacher who knows better and has more information than they do.

During the training, you'll practice a variety of verbal coaching techniques to help you learn what a parent might need to work through a moment of fear, panic or trauma during birth. You'll explore the emotions that come up surrounding medical support and learn how one might approach the topic of epidurals and cesarean deliveries compassionately so as to prepare your clients for any path of birth that may unfold.

At the end of the training, the facilitator will actually do these practices with pregnant couples in front of you, so that you can see how what you're learning in the training translates to actual work with clients.

The training can be done on it's own to deepen your support skills or, following the training, you can register to certify as a Birthing From Within doula or childbirth educator.

Here's the link! They only come here once every few years and are not planning another training here for the next 5 at least. This is not an "I'll do it next time" situation. If you're at all interested in this training, now is the time to do it!

http://thenestingplace.ca/news_events.php

Warmly,

On June 4th to 5th the G8 meeting is in Sochi, Russia and they will be addressing global issues.  The best time for us to come together and express OUR thoughts and feelings about our global well being.  INVITE INVITE INVITE, STAND UP AND FIGHT.

The role of the G8:

The G8, otherwise known as the Group of Eight, is an assembly of world leaders who meet annually to discuss global issues.  Each year, the G8 holds a Leaders’ Summit, in which Heads of State and Government of member countries meet to discuss and attempt to reconcile global issues.  Although the G8 is best known for its annual summits, it works throughout the year to tackle important contemporary topics such as the economy and climate change.  The G8 discusses and creates global policies.  However, adherence to these policies is not obligatory, and other countries can decide whether or not to obey.

Let's stand up and EXPRESS our rights and freedoms with in this world !

Anonymous welcomed !

Sources: http://www.g8.co.uk/

This session will have you screaming 'bring on the men!' as boylesque darling Dew Lily poses as a Royal Canadian Mounted Police officer.

152A Augusta Avenue, Toronto

Friday, April 4, 2014

Bring drawing materials. All mediums welcome, but sketchbooks work best.
Art contests! Win stuff!

Dr. Sketchy’s Anti-Art School is the little New York art event that became a movement. Started in 2005 by artist Molly Crabapple, the concept is simple. Artist’s draw glamorous burlesque dancers, compete in contests, and win wacky prizes. From it’s humble Brooklyn beginnings, Dr. Sketchy’s now has over 100 branches around the globe, including Los Angeles, London, Rome, Tokyo, and Melbourne. Learn more about Dr. Sketchy's here: http://www.drsketchy.com/

561782683919190.description:
We are building a small rehearsal & performance studio out the back of our home at Lansdowne and Bloor in Toronto - so excited! 
 
I’m looking for people to either volunteer OR do work trades – your help in exchange for usage of the studio when it’s finished. See the list at the end for help we need.
 
After years of dragging my sets all over multiple continents, scrounging for space and rehearsing in my bedroom, it’s gonna be AWESOME to have my own studio to create theatre work in collaboration with amazing queer, trans* and other artists.
 
I’m also considering options for curating a residency program for other local and international artists to access the space, prioritising artists who are queer, trans*, two spirit, BIPOC, disabled, women and/or other independent artists whose work is under-represented in mainstream spaces. 

The studio will have heating for year round use, and dreamy 10 foot wide glass windows/doors opening onto our backyard apple tree haven. It will be wheelchair accessible to enter, although unfortunately will not have an accessible washroom.
 
A contractor will be building the structure, but we need help with the following:

* Note: You don’t necessarily need to know how to do these things! 

-       Preparing salvaged wood – pulling out nails, sanding etc (April)
-       Painting (May)
-       Building shelves (May/ June)
-       Re-doing the garden paths (concrete or paved) to align with the new entrance door (May/ June)
-       Re-doing a 3 metre stretch of the concrete path up the side of the house to make it accessible (anytime between now and June)
-       Building a small removable ramp (for 1 small step) for accessibility into the studio
-       Laying down a floating laminate floor(June)
-       Space beautification – I want to keep it very clear feeling, but would also love it to be beautiful, warm and inspiring to work in! (May/June)
-       Building a small roof off the edge of the studio for covered bike storage (June)
-       Lending a car/truck to pick up various materials (April/May/June)
 
Feel free to suggest others who you think might be interested too.

Email sunny@sunnydrake.com

ABOUT: Whether you’re a fan of comics, manga, or graphic literature, make sure to clear your calendars this May in order to attend The Toronto Comic Arts Festival 2014! With the main Exhibition taking place May 10th and 11th 2014 at Toronto Reference Library, and a week’s worth of events leading up to it, TCAF is expected to draw a crowd of 20,000 across all festival events, and will reach new heights as one of the most celebrated literary comics events in the world!

Founded in 2003 in cooperation with Toronto’s venerable comix enclave The Beguiling, TCAF seeks “to promote the breadth and diversity of comics, and what is considered comics, as a legitimate medium of literary and artistic worth.” By partnering with Presenting Sponsor Toronto Public Library, TCAF has achieved its goal of changing the North American comics landscape by creating an industry-leading event that is free, diverse, and accessible to existing readers of comics and new fans alike.

PROGRAMS: 

TCAF KIDS DAY: Where are the next generation of comics and graphic novel readers coming from? TCAF KIDS DAY! TCAF Kids Day 2014 will take place at St. Paul’s on Bloor, 227 Bloor St. E., on Saturday May 10th from 10am-5pm. TCAF Kids Day 2014 will feature young-reader oriented author presentations for audiences up to 200, as well as large author signings, interactive activities, and more! TCAF’s first Kids Day was in 2012 at St Paul’s on Bloor, and was visited by more than 1000 attendees! This will act as a compliment to TCAF's Kids Programming at Toronto Reference Library, Beeton Audtorium, on May 10th and 11th as part of the traditional TCAF program. 

CANADIAN READING SERIES: This year, TCAF has created a dedicated space to discover and enjoy the work of Canadian graphic novelists. Come to discover what the whole world already knows -- that Canada is creating some of the most unique and interesting graphic novels in the world! 

WORD BALLOON ACADEMY: On May 9th, TCAF will be offering a new stream of professional development programming by comics creators for comics creators and comics professionals. Share and build up your own knowledge base and skills! Maybe you’ve figured out Twitter, maybe you want to do an inking demo with a specific kind of nib, maybe you’ve got photocopying down to an art, maybe you’ve got storytelling down to a science — This is the day for you! Look for information on registering for these programs this March.

And More to come!
577410509009931.name: TCAF 2014 @ Toronto Reference Library

WorldPride 2014 Toronto is shaping up to be one of the biggest international events of our times. These ten days of queer celebration will turn streets into parades, parks into parties and strangers into friends. Come out and meet the people from around the world expected to gather downtown and in neighbourhoods right across the city.

WorldPride offers something for everyone:

• Thrilling opening and closing ceremonies
• The prestigious WorldPride Gala and Awards
•An international human rights conference

•Bustling streetfairs

And an arts and culture festival that will have you wishing the ten days will never end. Outdoor stages, music for every taste, fun for the kids, and some of the world’s top thinkers gathered for an unprecedented ten days of programming. Toronto will be bursting with a rainbow of colors and voices.

Start by adding the dates to your calendar! See you June 20-29, 2014!

ADVANCED ACTING FOR THE CAMERA

Do the work on camera!

MONDAYS ~ March 17-April 7, 2014 7pm-10pm (OTTAWA)
WEDNESDAYS ~ March 12-April 2, 2014 7pm-10pm (TORONTO)

Work on scenes from SCREENPLAYS, TV Scripts or PLAYS on-camera — something you’ve written yourself, a brand new assigned scene or SIDES for an upcoming AUDITION.

Practice GOING on ACTION.

MAKE dangerous CHOICES.

HAVE fun in the ROOM.

BRING yourself. Every time.

oh and…

WATCH your WORK. Constructively CRITIQUE yourself.

Each class will commence with RELAXATION and SENSORY, PRIVATE MOMENT and/or ANIMAL EXERCISE.

Locations: 
ACT Studio, 94B Montreal Rd. Ottawa, ON (behind Lorenzo’s Pizza, Palace St. Entrance)

Milestone Casting ~ 401 Logan Ave, Toronto, ON

Space is Limited.

Cost: $222.00 (incl. HST)*

*Discounts for people who are registered in another class in the same session

Registration Deadline: Wednesday, March 5

Instructor: Claudia Jurt

Claudia Jurt is the owner and senior instructor of A.C.T. (Acting for Cinema & Television), a professional acting school that was founded in August 2001. Classes operate in both Ottawa and Toronto. 

Additionally, she is the Ottawa Director and one of the Toronto Directors at Lonsdale Smith Studios.

She continues to work in various aspects of film and television, not only as acting coach, but as director, producer and actor and previously as talent agent and casting director (Ottawa Casting, Ottawa’s original casting company). 

Some of Claudia’s Film & Television credits include, Reign, Clown, Tell the World, Find Me, House at the End of the Street, Metal Tornado, The Righteous Tithe, Une Vie Meilleure, The Maiden Danced to Death, Dark Places, The Wild Hunt, My Family’s Secret, Like Mother, Like Daughter, Maid of Honor, The Cold War Series, Hockey: A People’s History and Naked Josh.

Claudia trained as an actor and teacher with Michèle Lonsdale Smith for close to 10 years in cities
all over the world, including, L.A., New York, London, Vancouver, Toronto, Montreal and Ottawa. A few years ago, She had the honor of working on Fat Pig by Neil LaBute with Michèle at the helm, as director.

She proudly attributes her growth and success to Michèle, her longtime friend and mentor, and is thrilled to be collaborating and teaching under the umbrella of Lonsdale Smith Studios.

In an effort to get back to her roots (she’s originally from Switzerland), Claudia is making a trip to Berlin & Zurich to seek out locations to teach acting intensives. Email us and get on the list!

Also, she is developing a couple of feature film ideas that she intends to write, produce and direct.

Lots to do and so much fun!

Please register online at www.actottawa.com

585236671553780.description:
Toronto Eid Festival is the Third annual Toronto Eid Festival. 

It's a celebration of South-Asian identities. Year 2012 was a birth year of this biggest Eid Festival in Toronto and now we are here to make it bigger & better for you! 

The festival will have everything to celebrate the spirit of Eid. Shopping, food, zakat walk way, Naat Khawani, Free Iftar Taravee, prayer area, kids entertainment area, and more!!

The festival will have over 60 booths to serve your shopping needs including, clothes, jewelry, home decor, bangles, henna, printing, gift wrapping, cakes, Rugs, shoes, make up and more. The festival will also have an indoor food court with multiple vendors, Iftar! Many frozen food items to take home. Food samples will be given away with tastings! 

Toronto Eid festival will be fabric of Ontario's heritage and Toronto's multiculturalism. The festival will provide a unique opportunity for children to experience a true sense of Eid and Muslims to educate themselves! 

A very important aspect of Eid is the charity, which all the Muslims are expected to extend to the needy. Toronto Eid Festival will have a Zakat walk way for you. Where you will have five to 7 seven different charities and you can give your zakat hassle free.


This festival is taking place in the heart of Mississauga at Radisson Plaza, Mississauga. The Festival will have children's entertainment area, food court, Prayer area, charity area and shopping area. 

The festival will also have a Match Making session, you can bring your families to meet other families. We understand the difficulty in meeting singles due to busy work schedules, religious constraints and general lack of opportunities to meet in appropriate settings. This event provides the best opportunity to meet single for the purpose of marriage in a comfortable, relaxed and organized atmosphere.

The festival will also have a NAAT KHAWANI SESSION by leading Naat khawan!


Charities at the Zakaat Walkway will be there to introduce their organization and or to collect your Zakat. 

Come celebrate your Eid with us!!
585236671553780.name: Toronto Eid Festival

This is an excellent chance to meet some of the participants in the project, network, enjoy wonderful coffee, art and celebrate Toronto (and nice weather!)

No Dress Code. All are Welcome.

The works will remain in RSquared until April 30th, 2014.

-

Cosmopolis Toronto is an attempt photograph the whole world without leaving the GTA. So far Colin Boyd Shafer has photographed people born in over 170 different countries.

Our next large-scale exhibition will be June 12 – 26, 2014 @ Moniker Gallery (452 Richmond St. W) 

www.cosmopolistoronto.com

596038527144601.description:
This three-day workshop in Toronto, ON offers you innovative and compassionate ways to help parents deeply and dynamically prepare for birth & parenting. Our three-day workshop is an introduction to the philosophy of Birthing From Within and is designed for mothers, midwives, doulas, nurses, childbirth educators, breastfeeding counselors, and yoga teachers who want to empower parents to experience a “birth from within.” You will learn creative ways to: Validate, Motivate, Educate, Initiate, and Celebrate parents! You will feel your heart and mind open to growth, exploration and many possibilities, both in your professional work and in your own personal growth and knowing.
Midwives and nurses earn 20 contact hours through CA Board of RN, provider #12800. Workshop runs from 9 am to 6 pm from Wednesday to Friday.

You will:
• Explore the Labyrinth of Birth and the Birth Warrior's Journey
• Learn deep and effective listening-- a unique set of communication skills
• Renew your birth passion and inspire parents
• Help expectant parents build determination and a coping mindset.
• Motivate parents to participate in planning for birth and parenting
• Examine your own beliefs, assumptions, and experiences of birth
• Gain new hope and new skills, which you can pass on to parents
• Discover the power of Birth Art
• Find new ways of understanding and preventing emotional birth trauma
• Go beyond what you already know
• Prepare to be challenged and enriched by our unique and cutting-edge model of birth preparation.

More info: http://www.birthingfromwithin.com/introductory_workshop
To register: http://www.birthingfromwithin.com/store/show_by_tags/Workshops

Cost: $425.
**Save $75: Register at least 30 days before the workshop (by April.7)
Space is limited; sign up soon to save your spot.
596038527144601.name: Toronto: Introduction to Birthing From Within

597649143644060.description: It's time Torontonians and the world think of and see our great City in a positive light.  We are constantly  bombarded by negative stories in the media in particular the embarrassing past year for Toronto and I saw this video http://youtu.be/Ib3Duz_6a9M that inspired my idea. I want everyone to put on their earphones and dance their  way to and from work / school this day.  (NOT DRIVERS OF VEHICLES).  Come on Toronto, join this event, like the post if you see it, share this event and in particular please invite everyone you know on Facebook, and Fri. Apr. 25 let's show the world how amazing Toronto is and have millions of us dancing to and from work / school all day.  I can't dance, I do this white guy kinda shuffle lol, so don't worry whether you can dance or not, it's about us coming together in a celebration of fun positive energy.  Who is with me? (Pedestrians obey your signals and drivers be extra careful this day.) I need your help to promote this so please click on the 'Invite' tab and click on everyone you know in Toronto to add them directly to this event.  Thanks!  #torontodancetowork

J-Serve is a worldwide tikkun olam program through which over ten thousand Jewish teens (in Grades 6 to 12) participate in service projects all on the same day in communities around the world.

This year, J-Serve is scheduled for Sunday, April 6, 2014. Our program here in Toronto will take place at TanenbaumCHAT Wallenberg (200 Wilmington Avenue) from 11:30 a.m. to 5:00 p.m.

Choose one of more than a dozen J-Serve project options, and join over five hundred Toronto-area teens for the Global Day of Jewish Youth Service.

Earn 5 volunteer hours.
Open to all students in grades 6 to 12.

ABOUT
Toronto based DJ Wristpect remains focused on delivering quality music to the masses. He has played a-list events at world-renown venues, released award-winning collaborations, and has worked closely with some of today's most influential music, lifestyle, fashion, technology and entertainment brands.

Deep musical knowledge and sharp technical skills have allowed Wristpect to establish himself as one of North America's finest open format DJs. Blessed with the unique ability to read and connect with all sorts of individuals, he is constantly the DJ of choice for product launches, nightclubs, concerts and private events all over the world. 

Over the last five years, Wristpect has played alongside and for the likes of Eminem, DJ AM, Rihanna, LMFAO, Lady Gaga, Usher, Mary J Blige, Busta Rhymes, Jazzy Jeff, Drake, Nas, Ludacris, The Clipse, Oasis, Justin Bieber, John Legend, Samuel L Jackson, Lebron James, MSTRKRFT, Kim Kardashian, Adidas, Blackberry, Toronto International Film Festival, TEDx, Google, Sony- Ericsson, Hennessy, MTV, Moet, Belvedere, and Playboy.

On top of maintaining residencies at Canada’s premier venues, Wristpect continues to tour internationally throughout Europe (Belgium, France, Norway, Amsterdam, Zurich, London), Asia (Hong Kong, Shanghai, Kuala Lumpur, Singapore, Beijing), South America (Costa Rica), and North America (Toronto, Las Vegas, New York City, Los Angeles, Montreal, Chicago, Vancouver, Whistler, Boston, Washington, Calgary, Edmonton, Winnipeg, Halifax, Newfoundland).

Known for showing off diversity and depth, his sets are always custom tailored to the event and audience at hand. His eclectic and high energy selection has been known to contain everything from classic and current house, dance, hip hop, electro and old school to r&b, rock, dancehall, trap, 80s, 90s and current hits – all tastefully blended, and remixed together live on the spot. 

Wristpect has entertained music lovers through playing live sets worldwide, sharing online mixes with a dedicated global podcast listenership, and also on commercial radio (where he was the youngest DJ to be featured on Toronto’s FLOW 93.5 FM Mixology Show Saturday Nights 9- 10pm). He has also lectured at university-level music courses and was a featured instructor at Canada’s premiere DJ School, ‘Scratchlab DJ Institute’.

Wristpect's talent, hard work and to his craft have not gone unrecognized; he was awarded ‘Fan Choice DJ of the Year’ as well as ‘Toronto DJ of the Year’ at the 2011 Stylus DJ Awards and has also received accolades such as ‘Canadian Club DJ of the Year’, ‘Toronto DJ of the Year’, and ‘Mixtape of the Year’ in past years.

Continuing to build his brand, this young DJ, entrepreneur, and emerging producer remains driven by the desire to share his passion for music with individuals and audiences worldwide.
602318299836865.name: #FRESHFRIDAYS - Toronto's DJ WRISTPECT

A night of rhythm, drums and dancing @ Adelaide Hall: Beyond Sound Empijah, Joaquin Nunez Hidalgo featuring Dyalis Machado Migeles, Maracatu Mar Aberto, T.Dot Batu, Muhtadi & The World Drummers **** DJ's Miss Boom, Patrick Roots and DJ Chocolate

Muhtadi Interntaional Drumming Festival is proud to present Beyond Sound Empijah, Joaquin Nunez Hidalgo featuring Dyalis Machado Migeles, Maracatu Mar Aberto, T.Dot Batu, Muhtadi & The World Drummers for the MIDF XV Benefit at Adelaide Hall April 25th.  The 19+ Benefit will be an eclectic and energetic night of dancing and World Beat to raise funds for the 15th Annual Muhtadi International Drumming Festival. 

The April 25th Benefit at the Adelaide Hall  250 Adelaide Street promises to be a night to remember. The night will start out with FIVE distinct Drumming Groups taking you from Traditional West African to Afro’ Brazilian Samba Reggae Percussion.  Beyond Sound Empijah, Joaquin Nunez Hidalgo featuring Dyalis Machado Migeles, Maracatu Mar Aberto, T.Dot Batu, Muhtadi & The World Drummers will have the audience up off of their chairs and Groovin' to the beat.  

Adelaide Hall located at 250 Adelaide St W, in the heart of downtown, is the newest concert venue to join Toronto’s music scene. This space is the perfect setting for an intimate concert experience. With two levels and a balcony overlooking the stage, Adelaide Hall creates a unique atmosphere for concertgoers.  The hall is a short walk from the St. Andrew Subway station.

The performances will be followed by dancing showcasing sets featuring the distinct signature sounds of DJ MISS BOOM Canada's DJ Diva spinning afro beat, soca and chutney mixtures and Selectors Patrick Roots and DJ Chocolate. If there’s reggae music and Toronto people involved, chances are you’ll find DJ Chocolate and Patrick Roots involved in either a musical or promotional capacity.

Each year the Muhtadi International Drumming Festival, the largest percussion-based event of its kind in Canada, presents over 40 live performances, free of charge.  This year the festival will be held June 7th and 8th in Woobine Park.

The proceeds of the Adelaide Hall Benefit will go directly towards the costs of producing this year’s free festival so your attendance and support will be greatly appreciated.  Come early as CU (Casineros Unidos) Productions will be presenting a complimentary Salsa Lesson when the doors open at 6:30 p.m. Advance tickets are $25 plus S.C. and are available online at Northern Tickets.
604566192971168.name: MUHTADI INTERNATIONAL DRUMMING FESTIVAL XV BENEFIT:  Live at Adelaide Hall in Toronto April 25th 19+ Event

612994695441388.description:
ALS is a cause that is close to our hearts and we are happy to show Toronto's support for the Pints 4 Pete World Tour. A night of drinks, friends, and music to raise money and awareness for ALS in cities across the world and to support Pete Frates, a friend we met in Boston a few years ago who was diagnosed with the disease at the age of 27 and in memory of our Aunt Marilyn who passed away from ALS two years ago. “Frate Train” members across the globe will be hosting coinciding events at their local bars to meet up, have a pint and raise awareness for our mission to strike out ALS. 

Arynne and I will be hosting the event at 2Cats cocktail lounge on Thursday May 1st at 8pm. Drop by for an after work drink and show your support for ALS research. 

The event is free but donations to the cause are appreciated. You can make a pledge on the fundraising page for Toronto's event here: 

http://www.sbtwf.com/pints4pete/pledge/toronto/

Hope to see everyone out for a drink to support a great person and a great cause.
612994695441388.name: Pints4Pete World Tour Toronto: Strike Out ALS

These four Artists are staples in the music scene, both behind the decks and in the studio! Combined they have toured the globe, collaborated with and/or remixed just about every name you can think of, released tracks on countless of today and yesteryear's top labels including their own (Jungle Funk Recordings, Hatrax, DBR, PBR, Blow Media and the late & great Release Records), they have had a combined total of more than 120 Beatport Hits, many of which have peaked at # 1 and they continue to receive massive support from many of the biggest names in the biz!

622913424461303.description:
‘Goodness in Rwanda’ will have its Toronto theatrical premiere on Monday, April 21st at the Carlton Cinemas - 6:15pm, 8pm, 9:45pm!

Advance tickets are available at the Carlton Cinema box office.

Why should you come?

1.	April 7th, 2014 marked the 20th anniversary of the Rwandan genocide.  This month we not only remember the lessons of Rwanda, but examine them in the shadow of the current conflicts impacting many countries in the world right now (for instance, the Central African Republic).

2.	Three terrific panel discussions! This is how we start creating a discussion around this film to raise awareness and be a part of creating change. We’re creating a movement, and we want you to join us.

3.	Do you like underdogs? Well, this is a great opportunity to come out and support them, by seeing indie Canadian film. These are our stories, and our humble practitioners, often working without funding by the big agencies. 


Goodness in Rwanda - 64 minute Documentary
Toronto Premiere & Panel Discussions
Directed by Gord Rand & John Westheuser

Why do good people rush to do evil and what do they become?

In 2009, Toronto's Volcano Theatre accepted an invitation perform Goodness, a play about genocide, in Rwanda.  Made by the artists themselves, the film presents an unfiltered look at the political delicacy and emotional rawness of mounting 'Goodness' in Rwanda. This 64 minute documentary is part road movie, part performance movie, and all fish out of water story. The film takes the viewer into the quirky and heartbreaking world of a naive theatre troupe representing Canada in a deeply wounded country. We follow them to a struggling theatre festival where, surrounded by Rwanda’s horrific history, they attempt to connect with its people.

An emotional raw movie about storytelling, the nature of evil and the reality of forgiveness. It affords us a chance to look at our own collective guilt in the face of atrocity and our need to affect change. In our unbalanced world, there will always be room for hope.

Each screening followed by a panel discussion, guests TBC. Panel Discussions as follows:

6:15 pm - Film: How do we tell our own stories?
8 pm - PeaceBuilding: The Ethics of Reconciliation.
9:45 pm - Arts in Action: Post-Conflict Healing.
Carlton Cinema, 20 Carlton Street, 416-598-5454, Tix $9.50

Filmmakers and cast in attendance.

"Even though I walked away from the trip with more questions than answers, I hope the film does its part in honestly exploring how one part of the world can relate to another part of the world. And I hope to suggest – with my naïveté as my shield – that this difficult, halting, and sometimes embarrassing conversation is the first, essential step toward greater understanding." Gord Rand 

Come see the Audience Choice Winner of Reelworld, and the Best Documentary Feature of The Thin Line in Texas!

http://twitter.com/GiRdocumentary
Instagram: goodnessinrwandamovie
www.goodnessinrwanda.com
622913424461303.name: ‘Goodness in Rwanda’ - Toronto theatrical premiere

626579577413234.description:
MINILOGUE - Cocoon/Make A Beautiful Corpse -SE **
** FOUR HOUR LIVE PA ** TORONTO DEBUT ** FINAL NA SHOW
w/ Martin Fazekas - breakandenter - CA
--------------------------------------------------------------

In North America this spring to celebrate - and to retire - their almost 2 decade collaboration as MINILOGUE, MUTEK is proud to present the Swedish duo in Montréal on April 18 and Toronto on April 19, in collaboration with breakandenter.

Sebastian Mullaert and Marcus Henriksson have honed a peculiar and wide ranging sound over countless releases and collaborations - from house and techno to jazz, ambient, frenetic dervishes and even animated visual conceptualizations. They appeared for the first time at MUTEK in 2010 before teaming up for a 3 hour improv with MATHEW JONSON, during the 2012 edition. They have never played in Toronto, until now.

This tour marks a kind of denouement as they take an indefinite hiatus from this project to focus on solo pursuits and new opportunities. In a statement, the duo explained: “We feel that the time has come for us to explore new musical universes, one by one. We support each other fully in this and are excited about the musical adventures we have in front of us.”

MINILOGUE will fill these farewell appearances with their unbridled technological and musical prowess, performing a FOUR HOUR LIVE SET.

Event Supported by: alienInFlux, Box of Kittens

Visuals by Artefact
Sound by alienInFlux

TICKETING NOTES:
Please note that Super Earlybird tickets, Earlybird tickets and Advanced tickets are available while quantities last, and not necessarily until end time shown.

Purchasing a Super Earlybird, Earlybird, or Advanced ticket enters the named ticket holder into a draw for a pair of weekend passes to the 15th anniversary of MUTEK in Montreal (EM 15 - http://em15.org/en). Winner will be notified via email within 48 hours of the end of ticket sales for this event.

This is a 19+ event. ID required.

629983200410912.description:
Art Battle Canada is pleased to announce ART BATTLE DAY in Toronto on May 10th 2014. Join us at Artisans at Work for an exciting event featuring the talent and courage of painters from your community! This is one of 3 awesome events scheduled for Art Battle Day in Toronto! 

More than 250 artists will compete on May 10th across 20 Canadian communities for the chance to advance to the 2014 Art Battle National Championship event this summer. In each participating community, local organizers will host a 3-round live painting competition featuring 12 local professional and emerging artists. Audiences will vote to determine round winners and ultimately one individual event champion. The event winners will advance to compete in regularly scheduled Art Battle regional or provincial championships. 

For more information and advance tickets please visit http://artbattle.ca/abd/

Painters can apply here > http://artbattle.ca/register - please check the "Art Battle Day 2014 (May 10th)" box for faster processing.

Looking for a listing of all the events? Join and share the main page for Art Battle Day https://www.facebook.com/events/1400036086935542/

Seeing is believing! Check our videos > http://artbattle.ca/videos 

WHAT IS ART BATTLE?
Art Battle is live competitive painting. Painters create the best work they can in 20 minutes. As they work, patrons move around the easels, closely watching the creative process. The medium is acrylic paint and the tools allowed are brushes, palette knives or any non-mechanical implements. At the end of the round, the audience votes democratically for their favourite painting and bids in silent auction to take the work home. This is Art Battle Canada’s 5th season.

In July, winners of each Art Battle regional event will compete at the 2014 Art Battle National Championship in Toronto. Two-time Champion Yared Nigussu of Vancouver BC will defend his title against the best painters from across Canada. One painter will be chosen by audience vote as the 2014 Art Battle National Champion.

Art Battle Day 
May 10th, 630pm doors, painting starts at 730pm
Artisans at Work
2071 Danforth Avenue, Toronto 
Tickets > http://artbattle.ca/abd/

Let’s paint Canada! 
See you on May 10th

xo
Art Battle

632232126873845.description:
Saturday June, 21st to Friday June, 27th, 2014.
OPENING Saturday, June 21st, 7-10pm
_______________________________________________

The Cabinet of Queeriosities (2014) is a new body of work by Philippine-born, Toronto-based visual artist Julius Poncelet Manapul. This artistic intervention will be located at Studio 386 (386 Ontario Street, just south-east of the Church Wellesley Village) during WorldPride 2014. Spanning three spaces of first floor of the Edwardian building, The Cabinet of Queeriosities consists of installation, sculpture, video projection, digital art, and mixed media works which interrogate the artist’s experiences of racialized queerness using visual vocabularies culled from colonial and Indigenous cultures in the Philippines, abstracted gay pornography, and found everyday objects. 

Curated by Filipina Canadian artist and scholar Marissa Largo, this intervention will include various events that aim to engage the public in conversations on representation and queerness in the age of globalization and diaspora. An artist/curator talk and guided tour will provide opportunities to consider the experiences of queers of colour in the midst of mainstream representations proliferated by the Internet and popular culture. 

The inclusion of Manapul’s work in this celebration of global queerness is important in communicating that queerness is not a universal experience, but it is mediated by race, class, culture, and other subjectivities. These are often unaccounted for by globalized discourses of queerness, which sometimes purport solidarity and pride at the expense of difference. Manapul’s artistic intervention in WorldPride is an assertion of his experiences from the margins of the margin in the global city.    

The Art of Julius Poncelet Manapul  
http://juliusmanapul.blogspot.ca/

Curated by Marissa Largo
www.marissalargo.com

https://www.facebook.com/WP14TO

632445366824027.description:
SILVESTRE TECHNIQUE & ORIXA DANCE MOVEMENT WORKSHOP W ROSANGELA SILVESTRE MAY 1-4th

Rosangela Silvestre choreographer, instructor, dancer, and creator of   The Silvestre Dance Technique will be joining us in Toronto for  a 4 day dance intensive.
 A native of Salvador, Bahia, Brasil, Rosangela has researched dance and music in Brazil, India, Egypt, Senegal and Cuba as part of her ever-evolving and eclectic palette of movement. She choreographed numerous dance pieces for companies based in Brazil - Balé Folclórico da Bahia and Odunde - as well as Cleo Parker Robinson Dance Company, Ballet Hispanico Repertory Company, American Academy of Ballet, and more. Her dance investigation and constant development created an opportunity to connect with the eclectic American musician Steve Coleman, where she performed on various world tours. With Steve Coleman, Rosangela developed an idea to have the body as an instrument that provides the movement-form of any sound that can be captured - thereby discovering and creating dance at any moment.
Rosangela Silvestre teaches workshops all over the world in the Silvestre Technique and Orixa Dance movement. It is an honour and a privilege to have her come to Toronto, Canada.
For more info on Rosangela please check out www.silvestretraining.com

633871073335176.description:
Twenty-nine years ago, on April 20th 1985, a monkey named Britches was rescued, along with 1,115 other animals, from an animal experimentation facility at University of California, Riverside. He was five weeks old; he had been taken from his mother and was completely alone. Britches’ eyes were sewn shut and a device strapped to his head that emitted a high-pitched screech every few minutes. 

Every day, billions of other animals suffer to the degree that Britches did. The only unique thing about Britches’ story is that he was rescued. There remain millions of animals in laboratories in the U.S. and billions around the world who experience abuse, cruelty, and are murdered at the hands of humans. 

April 20th is the anniversary of Britches’ rescue and it is the beginning of World Week for Laboratory Animal Liberation. To honor Britches, to remember those who were not rescued, and honor those currently trapped in labs, please take time to pause on this anniversary. 

Please join us on April 20th to pay tribute to the non-consenting experimental subjects at the University of Toronto, and around the world. Hosted by the Institute for Critical Animal Studies (http://www.criticalanimalstudies.org/) and Progress for Science (http://progressforscience.com/); organized by the U of T Animal Rights Club and Aurora's Animal Rights Advocates. We want to show our empathy for our fellow sentient creatures who are being help captive and are used for unimaginable tests.

We will gather at 3pm at the University of Toronto (please wear black /dark clothing) to have a short Respectfully Mourning March after which will have a group of reading for the individual species that are used in the labs at the University of Toronto and elsewhere. This will be a non aggressive love energy filled event, no room for hate just love for the animals today!

Link here to Memorial Service for Lab Animals at UCLA 

http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=VltVLWuefgM

http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=0bx_nOw3-nk

Please join us to remember the lives lost in testing facilities here in Toronto and across the world.
Please wear black!

More detail to be added soon.
633871073335176.name: International Day in Honour of Britches Toronto

635838926481376.description:
WARM UP TO SPRING AT MOMONDAYS TORONTO!!!

Stephen de Wit has had a most unusual journey, following a most unorthodox career path. From landing in Toronto with no money, no job, nowhere to live and stealing toilet paper from the gym… to where he is today with international exposure as a Board Certified Sexologist!

One day, amidst a successful career, Glynis Devine woke up, thinking, "I'm all grown up... now what do I want?!" What a journey that started her on... and what a story that is! Glynis is also the host of momondays Montreal! 

Gail Scott spent her life talking and trying to be heard. What she didn't understand was that the loudest voice talking was the voice inside her own head. This is the story of how she learned to listen by talking more!

Michael Yarde is re-imagining masculinity and considers himself a male emancipation evangelist. Listen carefully and he might tell you something about yourself!

Joyce Dias will share her story about how being both naughty and nice helped her to stardom!

Claudio Marino is going to tell the story of how he caught the thief who was stealing from him, but that’s not really what it’s about… (It's really a hilarious story about forgiveness.)

Cover charge is only is $20 at the door. Bring a friend!

Contending for the Prophetic Destiny of the Black Community

Join us May 9 – May 10, 2014, at the Christian Center Church, as we come together to focus on what the Holy Spirit is saying about the prophetic destiny of the black community.

As the Nation of Islam and Five Percenters gain influence, and AIDS, abortion, and imprisonment are increasing in the black community, the Holy Spirit is raising up a prophetic standard in response. God is calling forth leaders from the black community who will arise and stand in their place in the end-time revival.

“Stand” is a three-day gathering for black young adults who have set their hearts to live prophetic lifestyles of radical obedience and communion with Jesus. The conference will involve prayer, worship, teaching, and extended times of ministry in the power of the Holy Spirit.

Register Online: http://www.ihopkc.org/aafa/upcoming-events/stand-regionals-toronto-canada/

652759011453263.description:
The Toronto launch for my first book, Beerology: Everything You Need to Know to Enjoy Beer…Even More, will take place at C'est What, on the evening of May 13th, starting at 6:00pm. Come celebrate with me!

We will have copies of the book for sale, which is pretty exciting since the in-store release date isn't until May 27th.

During the launch, at 7:00pm, I will be guiding a tasting of four local craft beers paired with small-batch Canadian cheeses. The tasting is now sold out *but* books will be available for purchase on site and there will be plenty of tasty beers on tap. Attendance is free and open to all!

The official event time is 6:00-8:00, but I'm sure I'll be sticking around for quite a while afterwards...

 Hope to see you there!

653923764662347.description:
We are proud to bring you the official SXE10 Crew Toronto Summer Meet!

As promised we are coming out strong for 2014. It has been a long winter… it is time for everyone to get out of winter-mode and start working on your cars for this summer. Hence, the reason why we made it two months in advance for early notice in case anyone needs to book off work. Please leave SUNDAY JUNE 1ST free. The admin team of SXE Toronto has been working together in planning this meet to provide you with a successful turn out

Every one/car is welcome to attend. Please help by asking/inviting any of your friends (especially if they own a Lexus IS) to this event, each and every Lexus IS in the GTA counts, as some photo shoots will be taken at this meet, and will be posted up. Would be great to represent and show what Torontonians got!

Rules:
-We DO NOT want to get kicked out. Please no rubber burning, or reving, we must respect everyone around us, as we do not want to ruin the reputation of Nextmod and their property.
-This is a friendly environment; some respect for one another is appreciated.

For Sale:
-A limited amount of SXE Toronto T-shirts will be sold at the meet. Meet starts at 1:00PM sharp. FIRST COME FIRST SERVE.


MEET DETAILS:

Location:	NEXTMOD MISSISSAUGA
Address:	776 DUNDAS ST E.
		MISSISSAUGA, ON L4Y 2B7
Time:	1:00PM – 5:00PM (SHARP!)


We can only make this BIG if all of you help make this happen, each and every one of you!
Thank you for everyone’s time and cooperation, much appreciated. Hope everyone will enjoy this event!


Best Regards,
-SXE10 CREW TORONTO Admin Team.

*12th Muslim Matrimonial  – Toronto & GTA* 

All our events take place in a comfortable environment, relaxed and get the most out of their time at the event. 
It will be the 12th Muslim Matrimonial event. We are aiming to organize an event where Muslim singles can meet each other, solely for the purpose of seeking an ideal marriage partner.

*************************************************************

12 Muslim Matrimonial hosted by Farah Matrimonial Services

Overview:
 
All our events take place in a comfortable environment, so the candidates feel at ease and make the most of their time.
 
We are aiming to organize an event where Muslim singles can meet each other, solely for the purpose of seeking an ideal marriage partner.

The event is not restricted based on ethnicity, all Muslim individual are welcome (and encouraged to attend).

Attendees also have the option of bringing along a chaperone for support but they will also need to purchase a ticket. Please note places are limited and tickets need to be purchased in advance.

What we offer:
 
•	Snacks and Refreshments
•	Meet up to 150 professional Muslims 
•	Ice breaking group activity and conversations 
•	Face to face introductions 
•	A dedicated, friendly team on hand throughout the event 
•	Private venue
•	Free parking
 

The Venue:
Candles Banquet Hall. An elegant and modern venue, which is located in Mississauga, Ontario. 
 
Itinerary:
 
•       The doors will open at 5:00 pm sharp
•       Guests will have an hour for introduction and interactions.
•       The program will start at 6:00 pm. 
•       Snacks and refreshments will be served at 8:00 pm, followed by one on one introduction. 
 
The team will assist you with the introductions if necessary. If you prefer to introduce yourself on your own, you are more than welcome to! 

Dress Code:

Formal – You never get a second chance to make a first impression!

Tickets:
 
You can purchase tickets directly via The link provided below:

https://12muslimmatrimonial.eventbrite.ca

Early bird discount (March 20 – March 27): $25.00
Regular price: $30.00


** For any further information please contact: sarasyeda101@hotmail.com

661491437220800.description:
OPIRG-Toronto Annual General Meeting
Wednesday, April 23rd
6 p.m. – 8 p.m.
Location: Room 5230, Ontario Institute for Studies in Education
252 Bloor Street West (Closest subway station: St. George)
***This space is wheelchair accessible***
***Food and refreshments available***

Celebrating an inspiring year of student and community activism, OPIRG-Toronto invites you to participate in our Annual General Meeting. Join us for an evening featuring reports from staff, volunteers & board members, election of the 2014-2015 Board of Directors and a review of our audit.

**Voting is open only to OPIRG-Toronto Members: registered undergraduate and graduate students who have not opted out of their OPIRG levy fee. Student members must bring their T-card (photo ID with student number) for verification of membership status.

**Are you interested in social and environmental justice? Do you feel passionate about campus/community organizing and social change? Do you want the opportunity to meet other activists, students and receive training in anti-oppression, consensus decision making, financial management and more? Consider running for the OPIRG-Toronto Board of Directors!
***Nominations open to University of Toronto students and alumni only***

To run for the 2014-2015 Board of Directors, please email your completed nomination package to opirgcro2014@gmail.com or hand deliver it to the OPIRG-Toronto office (563 Spadina Crescent, Room 101) between 11 a.m. – 6 p.m., during the April 2nd to April 9th nomination period. 2014-2015 nomination packages can be picked up at the OPIRG-Toronto office or obtained by emailing opirgcro2014@gmail.com. More details on the nomination process below.

**Please e-mail opirg.toronto@gmail.com for any accessibility needs. For more info, e-mail opirg.toronto@gmail.com OR call 416-978-7770

------Run for the OPIRG-Toronto Board of Directors!-------

OPIRG-Toronto is pleased to announce its annual election for its Board of Directors, scheduled for Wednesday, April 23rd, 2014.

Nominations are open from 9:00 a.m. on Wednesday, April 2nd, 2014 until 5:00 p.m. Wednesday, April 9th, 2014. To receive a nomination package, please write to the Chief Returning Officer for OPIRG's 2014 elections at opirgcro2014@gmail.com or drop by the OPIRG office Monday-Thursday 11 a.m. – 6 p.m. to pick one up, after the nominations period has begun.

Completed nomination
packages MUST include:
- 10 signatures from members of OPIRG-Toronto
- a completed nomination form
- a completed questionnaire
- a brief statement about why you would like to join the Board of Directors.

Polling will be held at the OPIRG office (563 Spadina Crescent) on April 23rd, 2014 from 11:00 a.m. to 3:00 p.m. and during the Annual General Meeting from 6:00 p.m. to
8:00 p.m.  (Location TBA). Election results will be announced that evening.

We look forward to your participation and encourage interested OPIRG members to run!

**What is the OPIRG-Toronto Board of Directors?

With 30 years of commitment to social and environmental justice, OPIRG-Toronto is a campus-based group with a mandate for research, education and action on issues of social and environmental justice. OPIRG-Toronto is a student and community funded and volunteer-driven organization that works to empower students and community members, to give people the tools and the opportunity to work cooperatively for a more just and healthy society.

The Board of Directors is the decision-making governing body, elected annually, to uphold OPIRG Toronto's organizational mandate. It implements policy, approves programming, manages the annual budget, and acts as an employer for two full-time, unionized staff members. Board members are responsible for decisions made at Board meetings.

OPIRG-Toronto Board members work collaboratively with staff and volunteers.

OPIRG-Toronto knows and believes that socially marginalized groups are often in better positions to understand how systems of oppression, power, and privilege function and are maintained. We especially encourage people with experiential knowledge of racism, colonization, poverty, transphobia, homophobia, ableism, and sexism to apply for the Board of Directors.

**Reasons You Should Join the OPIRG-Toronto Board

• Learn new skills and receive training
• Meet and get to know new and exciting friends, allies and collaborators
• Experience and gain decision-making skills on an organizational level, and as an employer to staff
• Enhance your school experience by layering it with aspects of organizing in issues of social and
environmental justice

**How does the OPIRG Board of Directors work?

Board transition takes place within the two weeks following the Board election at the Annual General Meeting (AGM) held in April of every year. Training for the new Board will take place through a Board Retreat and also at the OPIRG Provincial Board Training School in May (a great time to liaise and network with Board members from the 11 PIRGs across Ontario).

We ask that ALL individuals who are running for the 2014-2015 Board of Directors make a one-year commitment to OPIRG-Toronto. The level of participation and involvement of Board members may vary depending on financial constraints, office hours, outreach, holidays, and the going-ons of life—we understand all of this. The following are the time commitments we ask of ALL our Board members.

• You MUST attend Board meetings - generally held bi-weekly, though the exact frequency of meetings will be determined by Board members at the beginning of the term
• Involvement in a committee, established and struck by the OPIRG Board (in place of Portfolios), which will meet once a month, or by the discretion of the committee
• Board Summer Retreat
• Board Training School
• Office hours at OPIRG, once a week (for at least two hours)

**What do I need /How do I join the Board?
• A strong commitment to social and environmental justice
• An integrated analysis of the intersections of oppression
• A completed nomination form
• A completed questionnaire, to be submitted as part of your nomination package
• A brief statement (one paragraph) about “who you are”, to be submitted as part of your nomination package - This statement will be circulated to all voters in the event that we proceed to elections
• Make sure you speak to a staff member or a Board member who will explain the
logistics of the night

**If you have any questions, please contact the Chief Returning Officer of the 2014-2015 elections
by emailing opirgcro2014@gmail.com or contact OPIRG-Toronto by emailing opirg.toronto@gmail.com or call 416-978-7770.

661793877215776.description:
We know, we know... you're all thinking "Toronto Beermile there's so much snow, nothing can pull us from this winter depression" Well here you go!

Shake off the winter gloom and start prepairing for the second most talked about event in sports, 1st being the Summer Beermile. Saturday May 3rd at 7pm the Annual Spring Beermile will take place at the West Toronto Collegiate Institute! BE THERE.

Whether or not you "love running", come and join us for the first Toronto Beermile of the year!

Given the time of the year its going to be a little nippy, but fret not the beer always keeps your warm.

This time honored tradition has been going on for centuries now. Whether your competing or cheering we want to see you there. Please invite any friends, family or loved ones to aid in the excitement.

For those who don't know what a beer mile is, its simple!

1. Each competitor drinks four cans of beer and runs four laps on a track (Start - beer/lap, beer/lap, beer/lap, beer/lap - finish).

2. Beer must be consumed before the lap is begun, within the transition area which is the 10 meter zone before the start/finish line on a 400m track.

3. The race begins with the drinking of the first beer in the last meter of the transition zone to ensure the competitors run a complete mile (1609 meters).

4. Competitors must drink canned beer and the cans should not be less than 355ml (the standard can volume) or 12oz (the imperial equivalent). Bottles may be substituted for cans as long as they are at least 12 oz (355 ml) in volume.

5. No specialized cans or bottles may be used that give an advantage by allowing the beer to pour at a faster rate. ie "super mega mouth cans" or "wide mouth bottles" are prohibited.

6. Beer cans must not be tampered with in any manner, ie. no shotgunning or puncturing of the can except for opening the can by the tab at the top. The same applies with bottles - no straws or other aids are allowed in order to aid in the speed of pouring.

7. Beer must be a minimum of 5% alcohol by volume. Hard ciders and lemonades will not suffice. The beer must be a fermented alcoholic beverage brewed from malt and flavored with hops. For an abbreviated list of valid beers and exceptions, click here.

8. Each beer can must not be opened until the competitor enters the transition zone on each lap.

9. Competitors who vomit before they finish the race must complete one penalty lap at the end of the race (immediately after the completion of their 4th lap). Note: Vomiting more than once during the race still requires only one penalty lap at the end.

10. Have as much fun as possible!


For any questions or regrets please let us know!
661793877215776.name: SPRING TORONTO BEERMILE - MAY 3rd 2014

662895553777583.description:
Aspire2Lead invites you to come join us for the Toronto premiere of Through the Fire feat. Mama Hawa, Dr Edna Aden and Ilwad Elman. 


About the film: 

Through the Fire is a documentary film and photo essay that showcases the resilience of Somali people, with a focus on women, as they do their part in rebuilding their country. It tells the story of three heroic Somali women, Dr Edna Aden Ismail, Dr Hawa Adbi and Ilwad Elman, who have each led groundbreaking humanitarian initiatives. Aimed at providing a different perspective on Somalia by portraying Somalis not as helpless victims but as people who have managed to thrive in difficult circumstances. Through the Fire is a dedication to the strength of Somali women who have found ways to rebuild the country regardless of circumstances.


For more information about the film please visit www.throughthefire.co.uk 

Check out the trailer 
http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=bUzLtf_Jbyo&hd=1

Doors open at 6:50pm

Show starts at 7:15pm

Entrance fee of $10

Refreshments will be served

665861300147000.description:
The Black Tooth Grinn Ruthless and Toothless cd release tour of the CBRM finishes up at Governor's Pub for a special Thursday night show with Toronto's Mokomokai.

Black Tooth Grinn is from Sydney NS, a town known as much for the remnants of industrial exploitation as it is for a deep culture of music. This influences drives them to push a little harder to shine through the smoke and fog. Playing to sellout crowds in Cape Breton, the band has perfected a unique sound that modernizes the old town New Orleans blues aesthetic with the huge guitars of classic rock. The show appeals to your most carnal senses, pushing you to take that extra shot, stay for one more song. You're going to feel it the next morning.

GOVERNORS PUB is located at 233 Esplanade in Downtown Sydney. The show is 19+ with admission required at 10pm. 

WE UNITE! MUSIC is a multifaceted music company based out of Sydney NS. They hold shows across the region, including every Saturday night at the Fox Den in Sydney. For more listings or booking information, visit http://www.weunitepromo.ca./

666059480121178.description:
A Muslim woman defies the Nazis in World War II Paris. A true story. 

Enemy of the Reich is a new docudrama film from Unity Productions Foundation that depicts the inspiring, true story of a Muslim woman who opposed Hitler, risked her life, and helped launch the French Resistance. Her name was Noor Inayat Khan.

Opening remarks by Executive Producer Michael Wolfe

"Americans of different faiths need to know and appreciate Noor's heroism. It can bring us together."
- Imam Mohamed Hag Magid
 
"Enemy of the Reich: The Noor Inayat Khan Story is a moving account of a young Muslim woman who sacrificed her life to combat the brutal domination of Nazi Germany.  As a leader in the international movement to reconcile Jews and Muslims, this compelling film is a source of inspiration to me."
-Rabbi Marc Schneier

A Film by Unity Productions Foundation   

Toronto Premiere presented by:
Sheikh-it Entertainment

Our Gracious Sponsors:
Keystone - Muslim Association of Canada (MAC)
Platinum - Faith of Life Network
Gold - Muslim Welfare Centre
Gold - eXe Steel
Media Sponsor - BuzzPR Toronto

The Toronto premiere for Enemy of the Reich will take place at TIFF Bell Lightbox, home of the Toronto International Film Festival on Saturday, April 5th, 2014.

Doors open at 8:00 PM | Show starts at 8:30 PM

Tickets will be available starting March 17, 2014 for $20 + HST and can be purchased in three ways:

1) Online at https://tytix.tiff.net/scripts/max/10.17.40.32-39000/maxweb.exe

2) By Phone: 1-888-599-8433 (10am to 7pm daily)

3) In Person at the TIFF Bell Lightbox Box Office located at 350 King St. W. (10am to 10pm daily). Tickets may be purchased on the day of the event up until 8:30 PM when the show starts. 

Watch the trailer or learn more about the film by visiting www.EnemyOfTheReich.com

For more information about the Toronto Premiere or to become a sponsor, please contact:
Oroosh Shiekh ~ 416-940-0025 ~ oroosh@sheikh-it.com
Anita Verma ~ 416-998-5942 ~ averma@buzzpr.ca

ROUTE PLAN (note that these are *estimated* times -- Bunnies tend to have random side adventures along the way and we cannot guarantee we'll be anywhere at a specific time once we leave Brass Taps until we get to Lunacy) 
1pm - 2pm:  Brass Taps on Danforth, 493 Danforth Ave
2pm - 3pm: Withrow Park for egg hunt
3pm - 4pm: Court Jester, 609 Danforth Avenue

Show may sell out & bunny costume is not a guarantee of entry, so get your Lunacy tickets in advance on Eventbrite:

678945852148476.description:
Down River has moved to the Kingsway Theatre! It will be playing until Thursday (April 10th) at 5:25 pm daily so please come check out a screening while you still can!

http://www.kingswaymovies.com/

Thank you so much to everyone who has been coming out to our screenings - you've helped give this film that is so incredibly dear to us a life!

Down River won the AUDIENCE AWARD for Most Popular Canadian Film at the Vancouver International Film Festival and was named BEST BC FILM by the Vancouver Film Critics Circle.  

-------------------------------
Written and directed by Ben Ratner, Down River is a feature film starring Helen Shaver, Gabrielle Miller, Jennifer Spence and Colleen Rennison.

Down River is the emotionally stirring story of three young women teetering on the edge between creative breakthroughs and personal breakdowns, and their connection with the older woman they rely on for guidance, support and inspiration.

Inspired by Ben Ratner's long-time comradeship with actress Babz Chula who passed away in 2010, Down River is a film about mentorship, friendship, living life to the fullest, and ultimately letting go.

For more information, please check out:

Official Website: www.downrivermovie.com
FB Page: https://www.facebook.com/DownRiverMovie
Twitter: @DownRiverMovie

Come check out this film that is so very important to us and that means so much to us to share. And if you've seen it before and enjoyed it, come again and/or tell your friends!
-----

Thank you for supporting Down River and Canadian film!


From the reviews:

“Finally a Canadian script worthy of its excellent cast...Ratner's story has brains and heart..."

~Susan G. Cole, Now Magazine


"...an intelligent work with moments of poignancy and emotional resonance by a talented filmmaker...3/4 stars..."

~Bruce DeMara, The Toronto Star


"Emotionally successful Down River works at gut level…the characters jump off the page and into our hearts…Ratner’s movie finds real feeling without being sentimental…"

~Katherine Monk, The Vancouver Sun


“Ratner balances humour, poignancy and drama…a film of considerable beauty…4/5 stars…”

~Michael D. Reid, Times Colonist


“…my favorite film of Cinequest 2014…full of hope and happiness and a love of life…amazing and intelligent and funny and heartbreaking and truthful...”

~Cynthia Corral, popcornandvodka.com


"Down River wears its emotions honestly on its sleeve...3/4 stars..."

~Chris Knight, National Post


"…very moving and delivers a highly affecting ending…strong believable performances…”

~Volkmar Richter, Vancouver Observer


"…a beautiful experience from funny start to deeply moving finish…"

~Ken Eisner, The Georgia Straight


"a lot of clever, funny business amid the drama...woven seamlessly together..."

~Glen Schaefer, Vancouver Province
678945852148476.name: Last chance to see DOWN RIVER in Toronto!

Dear mommies,

You are invited to meet women who are running their own businesses near you. Share information about your business to other women in the community and enjoy referrals, new connections and insightful conversation with our Toronto Mommies members and beyond.

Our meetings usually have 30-40 mommies that come to tell us about what they do. Each woman gets a few minutes to present her business to a supportive group. We encourage women to give and request referrals, come together with other entrepreneurial women and help them and their business flourish. 

We welcome all women who are able to participate, with the following exceptions:

1. MLMs (Nikken, Herbalife, etc) are not allowed 
2. If you are a Real Estate Agent, please contact the host for more details.

Cost: $10 (refreshment included)
Duration: 1.5-2 hours

Meetings usually take place both in Russian and in English, although we encourage all mommies to speak English.

You are welcome to come and promote your husband's business with us as well.

**If you are a sponsor that would like to offer free sample, gifts or freebies in return for promotion, let us know!**

We will be have to see you at our event, seating is limited.

For more information please call: 416-841-0032 or email torontomommies@gmail.com

We chose a location that is TTC accessible, let us know if you want a pick up from Finch Station. 

See you there!

Bio:

Chris Gethard is a writer, actor, and comedian living in New York City. A mainstay performer at the Upright Citizens Brigade Theater, he has performed at the Just for Laughs festivals in both Montreal and Chicago, at South by Southwest, and at various colleges and theaters throughout the United States. 

He was named one of Variety’s Ten Comics to Watch in 2010, and has told stories on This American Life. 

Chris is the creator and host of The Chris Gethard Show, a variety and talk show that began as a stage show at UCB before becoming a weekly live public access show during the summer of 2011. The show has a fervent cult following, and is known for staging amazing stunts such as using a Twitter campaign to book Sean “Diddy” Combs as a guest on the show.

The Chris Gethard Show has been written about in The New York Times, The Wall Street Journal, New York Magazine, The Hollywood Reporter, and dozens of other publications.

Chris is the author of the book A Bad Idea I’m About to Do, named one of the Huffington Post’s ten books to read for the month of January upon its publication in early 2012.

689858477719357.description:
Bad Movie Night Toronto smashes its way into Clinton’s this month with a pseudo double bill featuring THE AMAZING BULK and POOCHINSKI!

Yes, you can probably guess which oh so famous comic book character THE AMAZING BULK is ripping off, but instead of being a straight-up copycat, this flick gradually transforms into a much more bizarre cinematic experience involving a monocle-wearing mad scientist and a plot to blow up the moon. Plus, there’s the “special effects” that absolutely *need* to be mentioned.  Shot entirely in front of a green screen, THE AMAZING BULK plays like the shoddiest clipart version of Sin City you done ever seen. The movie has the visual style of a cluttered Geocities webpage and even the Dancing Baby gif of the long off 1990s displays more realistic and attractive CGI animation than anything you’ll witness here. Oogachaka, indeed! 

Now since THE AMAZING BULK is only 75 minutes long, we’ll also be watching…

POOCHINSKI – a failed ABC television pilot about a cop (played by Peter Boyle) who is killed in the line of duty, only to come back to life as a street-smart talking bulldog. Yup. Now while the premise itself is ridiculous, what really piles on the crazy is how this poor pilot desperately wants to be everything for everyone. So in a jam-packed 20 minutes, POOCHINSKI tries to provide exciting action, odd couple buddy comedy, a romantic subplot, the obligatory talking dog hijinks, *and* a serious conversation about the precious nature of life. Also, not too be outdone by THE AMAZING BULK’s uber-cheapo fx, the animatronic bulldog puppet of POOCHINSKI is pretty horrid looking and rumoured to have cost a bunch of cash. Woof.  

* * * * *

Admission is FREE.
Doors open at 7:30 PM.
19+ event.
689858477719357.name: Bad Movie Night Toronto presents THE AMAZING BULK and POOCHINSKI!

I have an amazing evening planned for you where inspiration meets entertainment. 

Our Guest Speaker, Steve Dorsey, aka #StandwithSteve from Oprah’s LifeClass joining us in Toronto from Las Vegas to talk about his journey from addiction to recovery, inspiring us all with his new found passion to help heal others. 

Our Second Guest Speaker, my good friend, Hoda Samater, a local counsellor and community mental health advocate will be speaking about FINDING YOUR OWN HAPPINESS.

Hoda is trained in the area of community and outreach program development. For approximately 6 years she executed training workshops in and around the GTA utilizing a multi level approach to increase the satisfaction rate among the participants/users of the program. Currently, she works with marginalized trauma victims and individuals living with addiction/mental illness providing brief and long term counselling using various counselling techniques and approaches such as solution-focused therapy and cognitive behaviour therapy.
